component.title: ElSQL
component.description: The elsql component is an extension to the existing SQL Component that uses ElSql to define the SQL queries.

componentProperty.name: databaseVendor
componentProperty.description: To use a vendor specific com.opengamma.elsql.ElSqlConfig

componentProperty.name: elSqlConfig
componentProperty.description: To use a specific configured ElSqlConfig. It may be better to use the databaseVendor option instead.

componentProperty.name: resourceUri
componentProperty.description: The resource file which contains the elsql SQL statements to use. You can specify multiple resources separated by comma. The resources are loaded on the classpath by default you can prefix with file: to load from file system. Notice you can set this option on the component and then you do not have to configure this on the endpoint.

componentProperty.name: dataSource
componentProperty.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: allowNamedParameters
uriParameter.description: Whether to allow using named parameters in the queries.

uriParameter.name: usePlaceholder
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to use placeholder and replace all placeholder characters with sign in the SQL queries.

uriParameter.name: templateOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures the Spring JdbcTemplate with the key/values from the Map

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to poll

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: elsqlName
uriParameter.description: The name of the elsql to use (is NAMED in the elsql file)

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: batch
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Enables or disables batch mode

uriParameter.name: separator
uriParameter.description: The separator to use when parameter values is taken from message body (if the body is a String type) to be inserted at placeholders.Notice if you use named parameters then a Map type is used instead. The default value is comma

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: processingStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlProcessingStrategy to execute queries when the consumer has processed the rows/batch.

uriParameter.name: prepareStatementStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy to control preparation of the query and prepared statement.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: outputClass
uriParameter.description: Specify the full package and class name to use as conversion when outputType=SelectOne.

uriParameter.name: dataSource
uriParameter.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: breakBatchOnConsumeFail
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to break batch if onConsume failed.

uriParameter.name: onConsume
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed if the Exchange was processed successfully for example to mark the row as processed. The query can have parameter.

uriParameter.name: onConsumeFailed
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed if the Exchange failed for example to mark the row as failed. The query can have parameter.

uriParameter.name: useMessageBodyForSql
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether to use the message body as the SQL and then headers for parameters. If this option is enabled then the SQL in the uri is not used.

uriParameter.name: dataSourceRef
uriParameter.description: Sets the reference to a DataSource to lookup from the registry to use for communicating with the database.

uriParameter.name: outputType
uriParameter.description: Make the output of consumer or producer to SelectList as List of Map or SelectOne as single Java object in the following way:a) If the query has only single column then that JDBC Column object is returned. (such as SELECT COUNT( ) FROM PROJECT will return a Long object.b) If the query has more than one column then it will return a Map of that result.c) If the outputClass is set then it will convert the query result into an Java bean object by calling all the setters that match the column names.It will assume your class has a default constructor to create instance with.d) If the query resulted in more than one rows it throws an non-unique result exception.

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Enables or disables transaction. If enabled then if processing an exchange failed then the consumerbreak out processing any further exchanges to cause a rollback eager.

uriParameter.name: useIterator
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets how resultset should be delivered to route. Indicates delivery as either a list or individual object. defaults to true.

uriParameter.name: parametersCount
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If set greater than zero then Camel will use this count value of parameters to replace instead of querying via JDBC metadata API. This is useful if the JDBC vendor could not return correct parameters count then user may override instead.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: noop
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If set will ignore the results of the SQL query and use the existing IN message as the OUT message for the continuation of processing

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: databaseVendor
uriParameter.description: To use a vendor specific com.opengamma.elsql.ElSqlConfig

uriParameter.name: elSqlConfig
uriParameter.description: To use a specific configured ElSqlConfig. It may be better to use the databaseVendor option instead.

uriParameter.name: placeholder
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies a character that will be replaced to in SQL query. Notice that it is simple String.replaceAll() operation and no SQL parsing is involved (quoted strings will also change).

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: onConsumeBatchComplete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing the entire batch this query can be executed to bulk update rows etc. The query cannot have parameters.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: routeEmptyResultSet
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets whether empty resultset should be allowed to be sent to the next hop. Defaults to false. So the empty resultset will be filtered out.

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: The resource file which contains the elsql SQL statements to use. You can specify multiple resources separated by comma. The resources are loaded on the classpath by default you can prefix with file: to load from file system. Notice you can set this option on the component and then you do not have to configure this on the endpoint.

uriParameter.name: alwaysPopulateStatement
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If enabled then the populateStatement method from org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy is always invoked also if there is no expected parameters to be prepared. When this is false then the populateStatement is only invoked if there is 1 or more expected parameters to be set; for example this avoids reading the message body/headers for SQL queries with no parameters.

uriParameter.name: outputHeader
uriParameter.description: Store the query result in a header instead of the message body. By default outputHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body any existing content in the message body is discarded. If outputHeader is set the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: expectedUpdateCount
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets an expected update count to validate when using onConsume.

component.title: Servlet
component.description: To use a HTTP Servlet as entry for Camel routes when running in a servlet container.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: httpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

componentProperty.name: servletName
componentProperty.description: Default name of servlet to use. The default name is CamelServlet.

componentProperty.name: httpRegistry
componentProperty.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.servlet.HttpRegistry.

componentProperty.name: httpConfiguration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration.

uriParameter.name: eagerCheckContentAvailable
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to eager check whether the HTTP requests has content if the content-length header is 0 or not present. This can be turned on in case HTTP clients do not send streamed data.

uriParameter.name: httpMethodRestrict
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: httpBinding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: matchOnUriPrefix
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.

uriParameter.name: contextPath
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The context-path to use

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: chunked
uriParameter.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageBody
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.

uriParameter.name: servletName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Name of the servlet to use

uriParameter.name: responseBufferSize
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom buffer size on the javax.servlet.ServletResponse.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: disableStreamCache
uriParameter.label: common
uriParameter.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http/http4 producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: optionsEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.

uriParameter.name: traceEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP TRACE for this Servlet consumer. By default TRACE is turned off.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Simple JMS
component.description: The sjms component (simple jms) allows messages to be sent to (or consumed from) a JMS Queue or Topic.

componentProperty.name: transactionCommitStrategy
componentProperty.description: To configure which kind of commit strategy to use. Camel provides two implementations out of the box default and batch.

componentProperty.name: connectionCount
componentProperty.description: The maximum number of connections available to endpoints started under this component

componentProperty.name: jmsKeyFormatStrategy
componentProperty.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides one implementation out of the box: default. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the notation.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: connectionFactory
componentProperty.description: A ConnectionFactory is required to enable the SjmsComponent. It can be set directly or set set as part of a ConnectionResource.

componentProperty.name: destinationCreationStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom DestinationCreationStrategy.

componentProperty.name: timedTaskManager
componentProperty.description: To use a custom TimedTaskManager

componentProperty.name: messageCreatedStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

componentProperty.name: connectionResource
componentProperty.description: A ConnectionResource is an interface that allows for customization and container control of the ConnectionFactory. See Plugable Connection Resource Management for further details.

uriParameter.name: mapJmsMessage
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether Camel should auto map the received JMS message to a suited payload type such as javax.jms.TextMessage to a String etc. See section about how mapping works below for more details.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: includeAllJMSXProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to include all JMSXxxx properties when mapping from JMS to Camel Message. Setting this to true will include properties such as JMSXAppID and JMSXUserID etc. Note: If you are using a custom headerFilterStrategy then this option does not apply.

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.label: consumer,transaction
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to use transacted mode

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: transactionBatchCount
uriParameter.label: consumer,transaction
uriParameter.description: If transacted sets the number of messages to process before committing a transaction.

uriParameter.name: jmsKeyFormatStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides two implementations out of the box: default and passthrough. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). The passthrough strategy leaves the key as is. Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the notation.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: destinationName
uriParameter.description: DestinationName is a JMS queue or topic name. By default the destinationName is interpreted as a queue name.

uriParameter.name: messageCreatedStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

uriParameter.name: asyncStopListener
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to stop the consumer message listener asynchronously when stopping a route.

uriParameter.name: destinationType
uriParameter.description: The kind of destination to use

uriParameter.name: asyncStartListener
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to startup the consumer message listener asynchronously when starting a route. For example if a JmsConsumer cannot get a connection to a remote JMS broker then it may block while retrying and/or failover. This will cause Camel to block while starting routes. By setting this option to true you will let routes startup while the JmsConsumer connects to the JMS broker using a dedicated thread in asynchronous mode. If this option is used then beware that if the connection could not be established then an exception is logged at WARN level and the consumer will not be able to receive messages; You can then restart the route to retry.

uriParameter.name: persistent
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Flag used to enable/disable message persistence.

uriParameter.name: allowNullBody
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to allow sending messages with no body. If this option is false and the message body is null then an JMSException is thrown.

uriParameter.name: namedReplyTo
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the reply to destination name used for InOut producer endpoints.

uriParameter.name: consumerCount
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the number of consumer listeners used for this endpoint.

uriParameter.name: destinationCreationStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom DestinationCreationStrategy.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: prefillPool
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to prefill the producer connection pool on startup or create connections lazy when needed.

uriParameter.name: messageSelector
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the JMS Message selector syntax.

uriParameter.name: ttl
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Flag used to adjust the Time To Live value of produced messages.

uriParameter.name: acknowledgementMode
uriParameter.description: The JMS acknowledgement name which is one of: SESSION_TRANSACTED CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE

uriParameter.name: transactionBatchTimeout
uriParameter.label: consumer,transaction
uriParameter.description: Sets timeout (in millis) for batch transactions the value should be 1000 or higher.

uriParameter.name: transactionCommitStrategy
uriParameter.label: transaction
uriParameter.description: Sets the commit strategy.

uriParameter.name: producerCount
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the number of producers used for this endpoint.

uriParameter.name: durableSubscriptionId
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the durable subscription Id required for durable topics.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: responseTimeOut
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the amount of time we should wait before timing out a InOut response.

component.title: SSH
component.description: The ssh component enables access to SSH servers such that you can send an SSH command and process the response.

componentProperty.name: password
componentProperty.description: Sets the password to use in connecting to remote SSH server. Requires keyPairProvider to be set to null.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared SSH configuration

componentProperty.name: port
componentProperty.description: Sets the port number for the remote SSH server.

componentProperty.name: host
componentProperty.description: Sets the hostname of the remote SSH server.

componentProperty.name: certResource
componentProperty.description: Sets the resource path of the certificate to use for Authentication. Will use ResourceHelperKeyPairProvider to resolve file based certificate and depends on keyType setting.

componentProperty.name: certFilename
componentProperty.description: Sets the resource path of the certificate to use for Authentication.

componentProperty.name: keyPairProvider
componentProperty.description: Sets the KeyPairProvider reference to use when connecting using Certificates to the remote SSH Server.

componentProperty.name: keyType
componentProperty.description: Sets the key type to pass to the KeyPairProvider as part of authentication. KeyPairProvider.loadKey(...) will be passed this value. Defaults to ssh-rsa.

componentProperty.name: pollCommand
componentProperty.description: Sets the command string to send to the remote SSH server during every poll cycle. Only works with camel-ssh component being used as a consumer i.e. from(ssh://...). You may need to end your command with a newline and that must be URL encoded 0A

componentProperty.name: timeout
componentProperty.description: Sets the timeout in milliseconds to wait in establishing the remote SSH server connection. Defaults to 30000 milliseconds.

componentProperty.name: username
componentProperty.description: Sets the username to use in logging into the remote SSH server.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: Sets the timeout in milliseconds to wait in establishing the remote SSH server connection. Defaults to 30000 milliseconds.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: Sets the password to use in connecting to remote SSH server. Requires keyPairProvider to be set to null.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: Sets the hostname of the remote SSH server.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: keyType
uriParameter.description: Sets the key type to pass to the KeyPairProvider as part of authentication. KeyPairProvider.loadKey(...) will be passed this value. Defaults to ssh-rsa.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: pollCommand
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the command string to send to the remote SSH server during every poll cycle. Only works with camel-ssh component being used as a consumer i.e. from(ssh://...) You may need to end your command with a newline and that must be URL encoded 0A

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Sets the port number for the remote SSH server.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: certResource
uriParameter.description: Sets the resource path of the certificate to use for Authentication. Will use ResourceHelperKeyPairProvider to resolve file based certificate and depends on keyType setting.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced

component.title: Hazelcast
component.description: The hazelcast component allows you to work with the Hazelcast distributed data grid / cache.

componentProperty.name: hazelcastInstance
componentProperty.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: defaultOperation
uriParameter.description: To specify a default operation to use if no operation header has been provided.

uriParameter.name: pollTimeout
uriParameter.label: seda
uriParameter.description: The timeout used when consuming from the SEDA queue. When a timeout occurs the consumer can check whether it is allowed to continue running. Setting a lower value allows the consumer to react more quickly upon shutdown.

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.label: seda
uriParameter.description: If set to true then the consumer runs in transaction mode where the messages in the seda queue will only be removed if the transaction commits which happens when the processing is complete.

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: seda
uriParameter.description: To use concurrent consumers polling from the SEDA queue.

uriParameter.name: command
uriParameter.description: What operation to perform.

uriParameter.name: cacheName
uriParameter.description: The name of the cache

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: hazelcastInstance
uriParameter.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint.

uriParameter.name: transferExchange
uriParameter.label: seda
uriParameter.description: If set to true the whole Exchange will be transfered. If header or body contains not serializable objects they will be skipped.

uriParameter.name: hazelcastInstanceName
uriParameter.description: The hazelcast instance reference name which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: APNS
component.description: For sending notifications to Apple iOS devices.

componentProperty.name: apnsService
componentProperty.description: To use a custom link ApnsService

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name of the endpoint

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: tokens
uriParameter.description: Configure this property in case you want to statically declare tokens related to devices you want to notify. Tokens are separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

componentProperty.name: jobLauncher

uriParameter.name: jobLauncher

uriParameter.name: accessKey
uriParameter.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

uriParameter.name: subject
uriParameter.description: The subject which is used if the message header 'CamelAwsSnsSubject' is not present.

uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

component.title: SCP
component.description: To copy files using the secure copy protocol (SCP).

componentProperty.name: verboseLogging
componentProperty.description: JSCH is verbose logging out of the box. Therefore we turn the logging down to DEBUG logging by default. But setting this option to true turns on the verbose logging again.

uriParameter.name: useUserKnownHostsFile
uriParameter.description: If knownHostFile has not been explicit configured then use the host file from System.getProperty(user.home) /.ssh/known_hosts

uriParameter.name: charset
uriParameter.description: This option is used to specify the encoding of the file. You can use this on the consumer to specify the encodings of the files which allow Camel to know the charset it should load the file content in case the file content is being accessed. Likewise when writing a file you can use this option to specify which charset to write the file as well.

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to disconnect from remote FTP server right after use. Disconnect will only disconnect the current connection to the FTP server. If you have a consumer which you want to stop then you need to stop the consumer/route instead.

uriParameter.name: fileName
uriParameter.description: Use Expression such as File Language to dynamically set the filename. For consumers it's used as a filename filter. For producers it's used to evaluate the filename to write. If an expression is set it take precedence over the CamelFileName header. (Note: The header itself can also be an Expression). The expression options support both String and Expression types. If the expression is a String type it is always evaluated using the File Language. If the expression is an Expression type the specified Expression type is used - this allows you for instance to use OGNL expressions. For the consumer you can use it to filter filenames so you can for instance consume today's file using the File Language syntax: mydata-$date:now:yyyyMMdd.txt. The producers support the CamelOverruleFileName header which takes precedence over any existing CamelFileName header; the CamelOverruleFileName is a header that is used only once and makes it easier as this avoids to temporary store CamelFileName and have to restore it afterwards.

uriParameter.name: fileExist
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: What to do if a file already exists with the same name. Override which is the default replaces the existing file. Append - adds content to the existing file. Fail - throws a GenericFileOperationException indicating that there is already an existing file. Ignore - silently ignores the problem and does not override the existing file but assumes everything is okay. Move - option requires to use the moveExisting option to be configured as well. The option eagerDeleteTargetFile can be used to control what to do if an moving the file and there exists already an existing file otherwise causing the move operation to fail. The Move option will move any existing files before writing the target file. TryRename Camel is only applicable if tempFileName option is in use. This allows to try renaming the file from the temporary name to the actual name without doing any exists check.This check may be faster on some file systems and especially FTP servers.

uriParameter.name: maximumReconnectAttempts
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum reconnect attempts Camel performs when it tries to connect to the remote FTP server. Use 0 to disable this behavior.

uriParameter.name: strictHostKeyChecking
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to use strict host key checking. Possible values are: no yes

uriParameter.name: stepwise
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether we should stepwise change directories while traversing file structures when downloading files or as well when uploading a file to a directory. You can disable this if you for example are in a situation where you cannot change directory on the FTP server due security reasons.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: moveExisting
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Expression (such as File Language) used to compute file name to use when fileExist=Move is configured. To move files into a backup subdirectory just enter backup. This option only supports the following File Language tokens: file:name file:name.ext file:name.noext file:onlyname file:onlyname.noext file:ext and file:parent. Notice the file:parent is not supported by the FTP component as the FTP component can only move any existing files to a relative directory based on current dir as base.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnConnectFailed
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Should an exception be thrown if connection failed (exhausted) By default exception is not thrown and a WARN is logged. You can use this to enable exception being thrown and handle the thrown exception from the org.apache.camel.spi.PollingConsumerPollStrategy rollback method.

uriParameter.name: autoCreate
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Automatically create missing directories in the file's pathname. For the file consumer that means creating the starting directory. For the file producer it means the directory the files should be written to.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the data timeout for waiting for reply Used only by FTPClient

uriParameter.name: keepLastModified
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Will keep the last modified timestamp from the source file (if any). Will use the Exchange.FILE_LAST_MODIFIED header to located the timestamp. This header can contain either a java.util.Date or long with the timestamp. If the timestamp exists and the option is enabled it will set this timestamp on the written file. Note: This option only applies to the file producer. You cannot use this option with any of the ftp producers.

uriParameter.name: flatten
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Flatten is used to flatten the file name path to strip any leading paths so it's just the file name. This allows you to consume recursively into sub-directories but when you eg write the files to another directory they will be written in a single directory. Setting this to true on the producer enforces that any file name in CamelFileName header will be stripped for any leading paths.

uriParameter.name: download
uriParameter.description: Whether the FTP consumer should download the file. If this option is set to false then the message body will be null but the consumer will still trigger a Camel Exchange that has details about the file such as file name file size etc. It's just that the file will not be downloaded.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Password to use for login

uriParameter.name: eagerDeleteTargetFile
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to eagerly delete any existing target file. This option only applies when you use fileExists=Override and the tempFileName option as well. You can use this to disable (set it to false) deleting the target file before the temp file is written. For example you may write big files and want the target file to exists during the temp file is being written. This ensure the target file is only deleted until the very last moment just before the temp file is being renamed to the target filename. This option is also used to control whether to delete any existing files when fileExist=Move is enabled and an existing file exists. If this option copyAndDeleteOnRenameFails false then an exception will be thrown if an existing file existed if its true then the existing file is deleted before the move operation.

uriParameter.name: privateKeyFile
uriParameter.description: Set the private key file to that the SFTP endpoint can do private key verification.

uriParameter.name: doneFileName
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If provided then Camel will write a 2nd done file when the original file has been written. The done file will be empty. This option configures what file name to use. Either you can specify a fixed name. Or you can use dynamic placeholders. The done file will always be written in the same folder as the original file. Only $file.name and $file.name.noext is supported as dynamic placeholders.

uriParameter.name: siteCommand
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets optional site command(s) to be executed after successful login. Multiple site commands can be separated using a new line character (\n).

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: Hostname of the FTP server

uriParameter.name: ciphers
uriParameter.description: Set a comma separated list of ciphers that will be used in order of preference. Possible cipher names are defined by JCraft JSCH. Some examples include: aes128-ctraes128-cbc3des-ctr3des-cbcblowfish-cbcaes192-cbcaes256-cbc. If not specified the default list from JSCH will be used.

uriParameter.name: connectTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the connect timeout for waiting for a connection to be established Used by both FTPClient and JSCH

uriParameter.name: chmod
uriParameter.description: Allows you to set chmod on the stored file. For example chmod=664.

uriParameter.name: fastExistsCheck
uriParameter.description: If set this option to be true camel-ftp will use the list file directly to check if the file exists. Since some FTP server may not support to list the file directly if the option is false camel-ftp will use the old way to list the directory and check if the file exists. This option also influences readLock=changed to control whether it performs a fast check to update file information or not. This can be used to speed up the process if the FTP server has a lot of files.

uriParameter.name: tempPrefix
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: This option is used to write the file using a temporary name and then after the write is complete rename it to the real name. Can be used to identify files being written and also avoid consumers (not using exclusive read locks) reading in progress files. Is often used by FTP when uploading big files.

uriParameter.name: sendNoop
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to send a noop command as a pre-write check before uploading files to the FTP server. This is enabled by default as a validation of the connection is still valid which allows to silently re-connect to be able to upload the file. However if this causes problems you can turn this option off.

uriParameter.name: directoryName
uriParameter.description: The starting directory

uriParameter.name: allowNullBody
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Used to specify if a null body is allowed during file writing. If set to true then an empty file will be created when set to false and attempting to send a null body to the file component a GenericFileWriteException of 'Cannot write null body to file.' will be thrown. If the fileExist option is set to 'Override' then the file will be truncated and if set to append the file will remain unchanged.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: privateKeyFilePassphrase
uriParameter.description: Set the private key file passphrase to that the SFTP endpoint can do private key verification.

uriParameter.name: reconnectDelay
uriParameter.description: Delay in millis Camel will wait before performing a reconnect attempt.

uriParameter.name: separator
uriParameter.description: Sets the path separator to be used. UNIX = Uses unix style path separator Windows = Uses windows style path separator Auto = (is default) Use existing path separator in file name

uriParameter.name: soTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the so timeout Used only by FTPClient

uriParameter.name: passiveMode
uriParameter.description: Sets passive mode connections. Default is active mode connections.

uriParameter.name: tempFileName
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The same as tempPrefix option but offering a more fine grained control on the naming of the temporary filename as it uses the File Language.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Port of the FTP server

uriParameter.name: binary
uriParameter.description: Specifies the file transfer mode BINARY or ASCII. Default is ASCII (false).

uriParameter.name: knownHostsFile
uriParameter.description: Sets the known_hosts file so that the jsch endpoint can do host key verification.

uriParameter.name: bufferSize
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Write buffer sized in bytes.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Username to use for login

component.title: EHCache
component.description: The cache component enables you to perform caching operations using EHCache as the Cache Implementation.

componentProperty.name: cacheManagerFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the given CacheManagerFactory for creating the CacheManager. By default the DefaultCacheManagerFactory is used.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: Sets the Cache configuration

componentProperty.name: configurationFile
componentProperty.description: Sets the location of the ehcache.xml file to load from classpath or file system. By default the file is loaded from classpath:ehcache.xml

uriParameter.name: overflowToDisk
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether cache may overflow to disk

uriParameter.name: timeToLiveSeconds
uriParameter.description: The maximum time between creation time and when an element expires. Is used only if the element is not eternal

uriParameter.name: cacheManagerFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom CacheManagerFactory for creating the CacheManager to be used by this endpoint. By default the CacheManagerFactory configured on the component is used.

uriParameter.name: timeToIdleSeconds
uriParameter.description: The maximum amount of time between accesses before an element expires

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: eventListenerRegistry
uriParameter.description: To configure event listeners using the CacheEventListenerRegistry

uriParameter.name: maxElementsInMemory
uriParameter.description: The number of elements that may be stored in the defined cache in memory.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: diskStorePath
uriParameter.description: This parameter is ignored. CacheManager sets it using setter injection.

uriParameter.name: memoryStoreEvictionPolicy
uriParameter.description: Which eviction strategy to use when maximum number of elements in memory is reached. The strategy defines which elements to be removed. LRU - Lest Recently Used LFU - Lest Frequently Used FIFO - First In First Out

uriParameter.name: objectCache
uriParameter.description: Whether to turn on allowing to store non serializable objects in the cache. If this option is enabled then overflow to disk cannot be enabled as well.

uriParameter.name: eternal
uriParameter.description: Sets whether elements are eternal. If eternal timeouts are ignored and the element never expires.

uriParameter.name: cacheName
uriParameter.description: Name of the cache

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: diskPersistent
uriParameter.description: Whether the disk store persists between restarts of the application.

uriParameter.name: cacheLoaderRegistry
uriParameter.description: To configure cache loader using the CacheLoaderRegistry

uriParameter.name: diskExpiryThreadIntervalSeconds
uriParameter.description: The number of seconds between runs of the disk expiry thread.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.description: The default cache operation to use. If an operation in the message header then the operation from the header takes precedence.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: key
uriParameter.description: The default key to use. If a key is provided in the message header then the key from the header takes precedence.

component.title: Quartz2
component.description: Provides a scheduled delivery of messages using the Quartz 2.x scheduler.

componentProperty.name: autoStartScheduler
componentProperty.description: Whether or not the scheduler should be auto started. This options is default true

componentProperty.name: propertiesFile
componentProperty.description: File name of the properties to load from the classpath

componentProperty.name: scheduler
componentProperty.description: To use the custom configured Quartz scheduler instead of creating a new Scheduler.

componentProperty.name: prefixInstanceName
componentProperty.description: Whether to prefix the Quartz Scheduler instance name with the CamelContext name. This is enabled by default to let each CamelContext use its own Quartz scheduler instance by default. You can set this option to false to reuse Quartz scheduler instances between multiple CamelContext's.

componentProperty.name: prefixJobNameWithEndpointId
componentProperty.description: Whether to prefix the quartz job with the endpoint id. This option is default false.

componentProperty.name: schedulerFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the custom SchedulerFactory which is used to create the Scheduler.

componentProperty.name: startDelayedSeconds
componentProperty.description: Seconds to wait before starting the quartz scheduler.

componentProperty.name: enableJmx
componentProperty.description: Whether to enable Quartz JMX which allows to manage the Quartz scheduler from JMX. This options is default true

componentProperty.name: properties
componentProperty.description: Properties to configure the Quartz scheduler.

uriParameter.name: cron
uriParameter.description: Specifies a cron expression to define when to trigger.

uriParameter.name: triggerName
uriParameter.description: The quartz timer name to use. The combination of group name and timer name should be unique.

uriParameter.name: customCalendar
uriParameter.description: Specifies a custom calendar to avoid specific range of date

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: deleteJob
uriParameter.description: If set to true then the trigger automatically delete when route stop. Else if set to false it will remain in scheduler. When set to false it will also mean user may reuse pre-configured trigger with camel Uri. Just ensure the names match. Notice you cannot have both deleteJob and pauseJob set to true.

uriParameter.name: pauseJob
uriParameter.description: If set to true then the trigger automatically pauses when route stop. Else if set to false it will remain in scheduler. When set to false it will also mean user may reuse pre-configured trigger with camel Uri. Just ensure the names match. Notice you cannot have both deleteJob and pauseJob set to true.

uriParameter.name: triggerStartDelay
uriParameter.description: In case of scheduler has already started we want the trigger start slightly after current time to ensure endpoint is fully started before the job kicks in.

uriParameter.name: autoStartScheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether or not the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: groupName
uriParameter.description: The quartz group name to use. The combination of group name and timer name should be unique.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: prefixJobNameWithEndpointId
uriParameter.description: Whether the job name should be prefixed with endpoint id

uriParameter.name: recoverableJob
uriParameter.description: Instructs the scheduler whether or not the job should be re-executed if a 'recovery' or 'fail-over' situation is encountered.

uriParameter.name: triggerParameters
uriParameter.description: To configure additional options on the trigger.

uriParameter.name: durableJob
uriParameter.description: Whether or not the job should remain stored after it is orphaned (no triggers point to it).

uriParameter.name: startDelayedSeconds
uriParameter.description: Seconds to wait before starting the quartz scheduler.

uriParameter.name: jobParameters
uriParameter.description: To configure additional options on the job.

uriParameter.name: usingFixedCamelContextName
uriParameter.description: If it is true JobDataMap uses the CamelContext name directly to reference the CamelContext if it is false JobDataMap uses use the CamelContext management name which could be changed during the deploy time.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: fireNow
uriParameter.description: If it is true will fire the trigger when the route is start when using SimpleTrigger.

uriParameter.name: stateful
uriParameter.description: Uses a Quartz PersistJobDataAfterExecution and DisallowConcurrentExecution instead of the default job.

component.title: ZooKeeper
component.description: The zookeeper component allows interaction with a ZooKeeper cluster.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use a shared ZooKeeperConfiguration

uriParameter.name: backoff
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The time interval to backoff for after an error before retrying.

uriParameter.name: createMode
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The create mode that should be used for the newly created node

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: serverUrls
uriParameter.description: The zookeeper server hosts (multiple servers can be separated by comma)

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: The time interval to wait on connection before timing out.

uriParameter.name: path
uriParameter.description: The node in the ZooKeeper server (aka znode)

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: repeat
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Should changes to the znode be 'watched' and repeatedly processed.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageOnDelete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Upon the delete of a znode should an empty message be send to the consumer

uriParameter.name: create
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Should the endpoint create the node if it does not currently exist.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: awaitExistence
uriParameter.description: Not in use

uriParameter.name: listChildren
uriParameter.description: Whether the children of the node should be listed

component.title: AWS EC2
component.description: The aws-ec2 is used for managing Amazon EC2 instances.

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

uriParameter.name: secretKey
uriParameter.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

uriParameter.name: accessKey
uriParameter.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

uriParameter.name: amazonEc2Client
uriParameter.description: To use a existing configured AmazonEC2Client as client

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: amazonEc2Endpoint
uriParameter.description: The region with which the AWS-EC2 client wants to work with.

uriParameter.name: label
uriParameter.description: Logical name

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.description: The operation to perform

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

component.title: OSGi EventAdmin
component.description: The eventadmin component can be used in an OSGi environment to receive OSGi EventAdmin events and process them.

componentProperty.name: bundleContext
componentProperty.description: The OSGi BundleContext is automatic injected by Camel

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: topic
uriParameter.description: Name of topic to listen or send to

uriParameter.name: send
uriParameter.description: Whether to use 'send' or 'synchronous' deliver. Default false (async delivery)

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: POP3
component.description: To send or receive emails using imap/pop3 or stmp protocols.

componentProperty.name: contentTypeResolver
componentProperty.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: Sets the Mail configuration

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should disconnect after polling. If enabled this forces Camel to connect on each poll.

uriParameter.name: contentTypeResolver
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

uriParameter.name: subject
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: copyTo
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing a mail message it can be copied to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value with a header with the key copyTo allowing you to copy messages to folder names configured at runtime.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The password for login

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: searchTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: Refers to a javax.mail.search.SearchTerm which allows to filter mails based on search criteria such as subject body from sent after a certain date etc.

uriParameter.name: alternativeBodyHeader
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The mail server host name

uriParameter.name: skipFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to skip the message and move on to retrieve the next mail message. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of messages to gather per poll. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid downloading thousands of files when the server starts up. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable this option.

uriParameter.name: from
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The from email address

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

uriParameter.name: postProcessAction
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to an MailBoxPostProcessAction for doing post processing tasks on the mailbox once the normal processing ended.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: sortTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,sort
uriParameter.description: Sorting order for messages. Only natively supported for IMAP. Emulated to some degree when using POP3 or when IMAP server does not have the SORT capability.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: When using idempotent repository then when the mail message has been successfully processed and is committed should the message id be removed from the idempotent repository (default) or be kept in the repository. By default its assumed the message id is unique and has no value to be kept in the repository because the mail message will be marked as seen/moved or deleted to prevent it from being consumed again. And therefore having the message id stored in the idempotent repository has little value. However this option allows to store the message id for whatever reason you may have.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The port number of the mail server

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: dummyTrustManager
uriParameter.label: security
