As of Camel 2.10 you can override this configuration option by setting a header with the key delete to determine if the mail should be deleted or not.

uriParameter.name: handleFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to handle the caused exception by the consumer's error handler. By enable the bridge error handler on the consumer then the Camel routing error handler can handle the exception instead. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: closeFolder
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should close the folder after polling. Setting this option to false and having disconnect=false as well then the consumer keep the folder open between polls.

uriParameter.name: additionalJavaMailProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets additional java mail properties that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: connectionTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: cc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: fetchSize
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to consume during a poll. This can be used to avoid overloading a mail server if a mailbox folder contains a lot of messages. Default value of -1 means no fetch size and all messages will be consumed. Setting the value to 0 is a special corner case where Camel will not consume any messages at all.

uriParameter.name: javaMailSender
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.

uriParameter.name: useInlineAttachments
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepository
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: A pluggable repository org.apache.camel.spi.IdempotentRepository which allows to cluster consuming from the same mailbox and let the repository coordinate whether a mail message is valid for the consumer to process. By default no repository is in use.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: ignoreUnsupportedCharset
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: ignoreUriScheme
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: peek
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Will mark the javax.mail.Message as peeked before processing the mail message. This applies to IMAPMessage messages types only. By using peek the mail will not be eager marked as SEEN on the mail server which allows us to rollback the mail message if there is an error processing in Camel.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: to
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: unseen
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to limit by unseen mails only.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The username for login

uriParameter.name: autoRejoin

uriParameter.name: onTopic

uriParameter.name: colors

uriParameter.name: onQuit

uriParameter.name: onReply

uriParameter.name: hostname

uriParameter.name: onJoin
uriParameter.description: Handle user join events.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: The IRC server password.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler

uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: onPrivmsg

uriParameter.name: port

uriParameter.name: onMode

uriParameter.description: Handle nickname change events.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.description: The IRC server user name.

component.title: EJB
component.description: The ejb component is for invoking EJB Java beans from Camel.

componentProperty.name: context
componentProperty.description: The Context to use for looking up the EJBs

componentProperty.name: properties
componentProperty.description: Properties for creating javax.naming.Context if a context has not been configured.

uriParameter.name: cache
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If enabled Camel will cache the result of the first Registry look-up. Cache can be enabled if the bean in the Registry is defined as a singleton scope.

uriParameter.name: method
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of the method to invoke on the bean

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: beanName
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of the bean to invoke

uriParameter.name: multiParameterArray
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: How to treat the parameters which are passed from the message body.true means the message body should be an array of parameters. Note: This option is used internally by Camel and is not intended for end users to use.

uriParameter.name: parameters
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Used for configuring additional properties on the bean

component.title: Kestrel
component.description: The kestrel component allows messages to be sent to (or consumed from) Kestrel brokers.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use a shared configured configuration as base for creating new endpoints.

uriParameter.name: addresses
uriParameter.description: The address(es) on which kestrel is running

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: waitTimeMs
uriParameter.description: How long a given wait should block (server side) in milliseconds

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.description: How many concurrent listeners to schedule for the thread pool

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: queue
uriParameter.description: The queue we are polling

component.title: Data Format
component.description: The dataformat component is used for working with Data Formats as if it was a regular Component supporting Endpoints and URIs.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name of data format

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.description: Operation to use either marshal or unmarshal

component.title: IMAP
component.description: To send or receive emails using imap/pop3 or stmp protocols.

componentProperty.name: contentTypeResolver
componentProperty.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: Sets the Mail configuration

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should disconnect after polling. If enabled this forces Camel to connect on each poll.

uriParameter.name: contentTypeResolver
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

uriParameter.name: subject
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: copyTo
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing a mail message it can be copied to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value with a header with the key copyTo allowing you to copy messages to folder names configured at runtime.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The password for login

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: searchTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: Refers to a javax.mail.search.SearchTerm which allows to filter mails based on search criteria such as subject body from sent after a certain date etc.

uriParameter.name: alternativeBodyHeader
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The mail server host name

uriParameter.name: skipFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to skip the message and move on to retrieve the next mail message. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of messages to gather per poll. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid downloading thousands of files when the server starts up. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable this option.

uriParameter.name: from
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The from email address

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

uriParameter.name: postProcessAction
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to an MailBoxPostProcessAction for doing post processing tasks on the mailbox once the normal processing ended.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: sortTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,sort
uriParameter.description: Sorting order for messages. Only natively supported for IMAP. Emulated to some degree when using POP3 or when IMAP server does not have the SORT capability.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: When using idempotent repository then when the mail message has been successfully processed and is committed should the message id be removed from the idempotent repository (default) or be kept in the repository. By default its assumed the message id is unique and has no value to be kept in the repository because the mail message will be marked as seen/moved or deleted to prevent it from being consumed again. And therefore having the message id stored in the idempotent repository has little value. However this option allows to store the message id for whatever reason you may have.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The port number of the mail server

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: dummyTrustManager
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To use a dummy security setting for trusting all certificates. Should only be used for development mode and not production.

uriParameter.name: replyTo
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.

uriParameter.name: mailUidGenerator
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable MailUidGenerator that allows to use custom logic to generate UUID of the mail message.

uriParameter.name: folderName
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The folder to poll.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: debugMode
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: bcc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: session
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource such as a JavaEE container. If this is not specified Camel automatically creates the mail session for you.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters.

uriParameter.name: mapMailMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether Camel should map the received mail message to Camel body/headers. If set to true the body of the mail message is mapped to the body of the Camel IN message and the mail headers are mapped to IN headers. If this option is set to false then the IN message contains a raw javax.mail.Message. You can retrieve this raw message by calling exchange.getIn().getBody(javax.mail.Message.class).

uriParameter.name: delete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Deletes the messages after they have been processed. This is done by setting the DELETED flag on the mail message. If false the SEEN flag is set instead. As of Camel 2.10 you can override this configuration option by setting a header with the key delete to determine if the mail should be deleted or not.

uriParameter.name: handleFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to handle the caused exception by the consumer's error handler. By enable the bridge error handler on the consumer then the Camel routing error handler can handle the exception instead. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: closeFolder
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should close the folder after polling. Setting this option to false and having disconnect=false as well then the consumer keep the folder open between polls.

uriParameter.name: additionalJavaMailProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets additional java mail properties that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: connectionTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: cc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: fetchSize
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to consume during a poll. This can be used to avoid overloading a mail server if a mailbox folder contains a lot of messages. Default value of -1 means no fetch size and all messages will be consumed. Setting the value to 0 is a special corner case where Camel will not consume any messages at all.

uriParameter.name: javaMailSender
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.

uriParameter.name: useInlineAttachments
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepository
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: A pluggable repository org.apache.camel.spi.IdempotentRepository which allows to cluster consuming from the same mailbox and let the repository coordinate whether a mail message is valid for the consumer to process. By default no repository is in use.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: ignoreUnsupportedCharset
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: ignoreUriScheme
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: peek
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Will mark the javax.mail.Message as peeked before processing the mail message. This applies to IMAPMessage messages types only. By using peek the mail will not be eager marked as SEEN on the mail server which allows us to rollback the mail message if there is an error processing in Camel.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: to
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: unseen
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to limit by unseen mails only.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The username for login

component.title: XQuery
component.description: Transforms the message using a XQuery template using Saxon.

componentProperty.name: moduleURIResolver
componentProperty.description: To use the custom ModuleURIResolver

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: configuration
uriParameter.description: To use a custom Saxon configuration

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: resultsFormat
uriParameter.description: What output result to use

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: resultType
uriParameter.description: What output result to use defined as a class

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: headerName
uriParameter.description: To use a Camel Message header as the input source instead of Message body.

uriParameter.name: namespacePrefixes
uriParameter.description: Allows to control which namespace prefixes to use for a set of namespace mappings

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: The name of the template to load from classpath or file system

uriParameter.name: allowStAX
uriParameter.description: Whether to allow using StAX mode

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: staticQueryContext
uriParameter.description: To use a custom Saxon StaticQueryContext

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: moduleURIResolver
uriParameter.description: To use the custom ModuleURIResolver

uriParameter.name: stripsAllWhiteSpace
uriParameter.description: Whether to strip all whitespaces

uriParameter.name: parameters
uriParameter.description: Additional parameters

uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: properties

component.title: Beanstalk

componentProperty.description: Custom ConnectionSettingsFactory. Specify which ConnectionSettingsFactory to use to make connections to Beanstalkd. Especially useful for unit testing without beanstalkd daemon (you can mock ConnectionSettings)

uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.label: advanced

By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: awaitJob
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to wait for job to complete before ack the job from beanstalk

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: jobPriority
uriParameter.description: Job priority. (0 is the highest see Beanstalk protocol)

uriParameter.name: jobTimeToRun
uriParameter.description: Job time to run in seconds. (when 0 the beanstalkd daemon raises it to 1 automatically see Beanstalk protocol)

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: command
uriParameter.description: put means to put the job into Beanstalk. Job body is specified in the Camel message body. Job ID will be returned in beanstalk.jobId message header. delete release touch or bury expect Job ID in the message header beanstalk.jobId. Result of the operation is returned in beanstalk.result message header kick expects the number of jobs to kick in the message body and returns the number of jobs actually kicked out in the message header beanstalk.result.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: connectionSettings
uriParameter.description: Connection settings host:port/tube

uriParameter.name: useBlockIO
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to use blockIO.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: jobDelay
uriParameter.description: Job delay in seconds.

component.title: SEDA
component.description: The seda component provides asynchronous call to another endpoint from any CamelContext in the same JVM.

componentProperty.name: queueSize
componentProperty.description: Sets the default maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e. the number of messages it can hold).

componentProperty.name: defaultQueueFactory
componentProperty.description: Sets the default queue factory.

componentProperty.name: concurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Sets the default number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: pollTimeout
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The timeout used when polling. When a timeout occurs the consumer can check whether it is allowed to continue running. Setting a lower value allows the consumer to react more quickly upon shutdown.

uriParameter.name: failIfNoConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether the producer should fail by throwing an exception when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.

uriParameter.name: waitForTaskToComplete
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to specify whether the caller should wait for the async task to complete or not before continuing. The following three options are supported: Always Never or IfReplyExpected. The first two values are self-explanatory. The last value IfReplyExpected will only wait if the message is Request Reply based. The default option is IfReplyExpected.

uriParameter.name: limitConcurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to limit the number of concurrentConsumers to the maximum of 500. By default an exception will be thrown if an endpoint is configured with a greater number. You can disable that check by turning this option off.

uriParameter.name: blockWhenFull
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full SEDA queue will block until the queue's capacity is no longer exhausted. By default an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full. By enabling this option the calling thread will instead block and wait until the message can be accepted.

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) before a SEDA producer will stop waiting for an asynchronous task to complete. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: size
uriParameter.description: The maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e. the number of messages it can hold).

uriParameter.name: discardIfNoConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether the producer should discard the message (do not add the message to the queue) when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name of queue

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: purgeWhenStopping
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to purge the task queue when stopping the consumer/route. This allows to stop faster as any pending messages on the queue is discarded.

uriParameter.name: multipleConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether multiple consumers are allowed. If enabled you can use SEDA for Publish-Subscribe messaging. That is you can send a message to the SEDA queue and have each consumer receive a copy of the message. When enabled this option should be specified on every consumer endpoint.

uriParameter.name: queue
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Define the queue instance which will be used by the endpoint. This option is only for rare use-cases where you want to use a custom queue instance.

component.title: Mina
component.description: Socket level networking using TCP or UDP with the Apache Mina 1.x library.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared mina configuration.

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to disconnect(close) from Mina session right after use. Can be used for both consumer and producer.

uriParameter.name: lazySessionCreation
uriParameter.description: Sessions can be lazily created to avoid exceptions if the remote server is not up and running when the Camel producer is started.

uriParameter.name: textlineDelimiter
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP and if textline=true. Sets the text line delimiter to use. If none provided Camel will use DEFAULT. This delimiter is used to mark the end of text.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: disconnectOnNoReply
uriParameter.description: If sync is enabled then this option dictates MinaConsumer if it should disconnect where there is no reply to send back.

uriParameter.name: encoderMaxLineLength
uriParameter.description: To set the textline protocol encoder max line length. By default the default value of Mina itself is used which are Integer.MAX_VALUE.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: filters
uriParameter.description: You can set a list of Mina IoFilters to use.

uriParameter.name: encoding
uriParameter.description: You can configure the encoding (a charset name) to use for the TCP textline codec and the UDP protocol. If not provided Camel will use the JVM default Charset

uriParameter.name: sync
uriParameter.description: Setting to set endpoint as one-way or request-response.

uriParameter.name: minaLogger
uriParameter.description: You can enable the Apache MINA logging filter. Apache MINA uses slf4j logging at INFO level to log all input and output.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: You can configure the timeout that specifies how long to wait for a response from a remote server. The timeout unit is in milliseconds so 60000 is 60 seconds.

uriParameter.name: codec
uriParameter.description: To use a custom minda codec implementation.

uriParameter.name: protocol
uriParameter.description: Protocol to use

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Port number

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: Hostname to use. Use localhost or 0.0.0.0 for local server as consumer. For producer use the hostname or ip address of the remote server.

uriParameter.name: allowDefaultCodec
uriParameter.description: The mina component installs a default codec if both codec is null and textline is false. Setting allowDefaultCodec to false prevents the mina component from installing a default codec as the first element in the filter chain. This is useful in scenarios where another filter must be the first in the filter chain like the SSL filter.

uriParameter.name: noReplyLogLevel
uriParameter.description: If sync is enabled this option dictates MinaConsumer which logging level to use when logging a there is no reply to send back.

uriParameter.name: textline
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP. If no codec is specified you can use this flag to indicate a text line based codec; if not specified or the value is false then Object Serialization is assumed over TCP.

uriParameter.name: transferExchange
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP. You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body. The following fields are transferred: In body Out body fault body In headers Out headers fault headers exchange properties exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level.

uriParameter.name: decoderMaxLineLength
uriParameter.description: To set the textline protocol decoder max line length. By default the default value of Mina itself is used which are 1024.

uriParameter.name: clientMode
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the clientMode is true mina consumer will connect the address as a TCP client.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Dataset
component.description: The dataset component provides a mechanism to easily perform load & soak testing of your system.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: consumeDelay
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Allows a delay to be specified which causes a delay when a message is consumed by the producer (to simulate slow processing)

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: preloadSize
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets how many messages should be preloaded (sent) before the route completes its initialization

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Time period in millis to wait before starting sending messages.

uriParameter.name: expectedCount
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the expected number of message exchanges that should be received by this endpoint. Beware: If you want to expect that 0 messages then take extra care as 0 matches when the tests starts so you need to set a assert period time to let the test run for a while to make sure there are still no messages arrived; for that use link setAssertPeriod(long). An alternative is to use NotifyBuilder and use the notifier to know when Camel is done routing some messages before you call the link assertIsSatisfied() method on the mocks. This allows you to not use a fixed assert period to speedup testing times. If you want to assert that exactly n'th message arrives to this mock endpoint then see also the link setAssertPeriod(long) method for further details.

uriParameter.name: retainLast
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies to only retain the last n'th number of received Exchanges. This is used when testing with big data to reduce memory consumption by not storing copies of every Exchange this mock endpoint receives. Important: When using this limitation then the link getReceivedCounter() will still return the actual number of received Exchanges. For example if we have received 5000 Exchanges and have configured to only retain the last 20 Exchanges then the link getReceivedCounter() will still return 5000 but there is only the last 20 Exchanges in the link getExchanges() and link getReceivedExchanges() methods. When using this method then some of the other expectation methods is not supported for example the link expectedBodiesReceived(Object...) sets a expectation on the first number of bodies received. You can configure both link setRetainFirst(int) and link setRetainLast(int) methods to limit both the first and last received.

uriParameter.name: assertPeriod
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets a grace period after which the mock endpoint will re-assert to ensure the preliminary assertion is still valid. This is used for example to assert that exactly a number of messages arrives. For example if link expectedMessageCount(int) was set to 5 then the assertion is satisfied when 5 or more message arrives. To ensure that exactly 5 messages arrives then you would need to wait a little period to ensure no further message arrives. This is what you can use this link setAssertPeriod(long) method for. By default this period is disabled.

uriParameter.name: resultMinimumWaitTime
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the minimum expected amount of time (in millis) the link assertIsSatisfied() will wait on a latch until it is satisfied

uriParameter.name: reportGroup
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: A number that is used to turn on throughput logging based on groups of the size.

uriParameter.name: sleepForEmptyTest
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Allows a sleep to be specified to wait to check that this endpoint really is empty when link expectedMessageCount(int) is called with zero

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name of DataSet to lookup in the registry

uriParameter.name: dataSetIndex
uriParameter.description: Controls the behaviour of the CamelDataSetIndex header. For Consumers: - off = the header will not be set - strict/lenient = the header will be set For Producers: - off = the header value will not be verified and will not be set if it is not present = strict = the header value must be present and will be verified = lenient = the header value will be verified if it is present and will be set if it is not present

uriParameter.name: minRate
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Wait until the DataSet contains at least this number of messages

uriParameter.name: copyOnExchange
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to make a deep copy of the incoming Exchange when received at this mock endpoint. Is by default true.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: produceDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows a delay to be specified which causes a delay when a message is sent by the consumer (to simulate slow processing)

uriParameter.name: resultWaitTime
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum amount of time (in millis) the link assertIsSatisfied() will wait on a latch until it is satisfied

uriParameter.name: retainFirst
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies to only retain the first n'th number of received Exchanges. This is used when testing with big data to reduce memory consumption by not storing copies of every Exchange this mock endpoint receives. Important: When using this limitation then the link getReceivedCounter() will still return the actual number of received Exchanges. For example if we have received 5000 Exchanges and have configured to only retain the first 10 Exchanges then the link getReceivedCounter() will still return 5000 but there is only the first 10 Exchanges in the link getExchanges() and link getReceivedExchanges() methods. When using this method then some of the other expectation methods is not supported for example the link expectedBodiesReceived(Object...) sets a expectation on the first number of bodies received. You can configure both link setRetainFirst(int) and link setRetainLast(int) methods to limit both the first and last received.

component.description: Validates the payload of a message using XML Schema and JAXP Validation.

uriParameter.description: To use a custom javax.xml.validation.SchemaFactory

uriParameter.name: failOnNullHeader
uriParameter.description: Whether to fail if no header exists when validating against a header.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: URL to a local resource on the classpathor a reference to lookup a bean in the Registry or a full URL to a remote resource or resource on the file system which contains the XSD to validate against.

uriParameter.name: schemaLanguage
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures the W3C XML Schema Namespace URI.

uriParameter.name: resourceResolverFactory
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: For creating a resource resolver which depends on the endpoint resource URI. Must not be used in combination with method link setResourceResolver(LSResourceResolver). If not set then DefaultValidatorResourceResolverFactory is used

uriParameter.name: useDom
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether DOMSource/DOMResult or SaxSource/SaxResult should be used by the validator.

uriParameter.name: resourceResolver

uriParameter.name: useSharedSchema
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether the Schema instance should be shared or not. This option is introduced to work around a JDK 1.6.x bug. Xerces should not have this issue.

uriParameter.name: failOnNullBody

uriParameter.name: errorHandler
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.processor.validation.ValidatorErrorHandler. The default error handler captures the errors and throws an exception.

uriParameter.name: cxfBinding

uriParameter.name: synchronous

uriParameter.name: mtomEnabled

uriParameter.name: portName

uriParameter.name: defaultBus

uriParameter.description: Will set the default bus when CXF endpoint create a bus by itself

uriParameter.name: mergeProtocolHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to merge protocol headers. If enabled then propagating headers between Camel and CXF becomes more consistent and similar. For more details see CAMEL-6393.

uriParameter.name: cxfEndpointConfigurer

uriParameter.description: This option could apply the implementation of org.apache.camel.component.cxf.CxfEndpointConfigurer which supports to configure the CXF endpoint in programmatic way. User can configure the CXF server and client by implementing configureServerClient method of CxfEndpointConfigurer.

uriParameter.name: defaultOperationName

uriParameter.description: This option will set the default operationName that will be used by the CxfProducer which invokes the remote service.

uriParameter.name: password

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer

By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
