uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: AWS S3 Storage Service
component.description: The aws-s3 component is used for storing and retrieving objetc from Amazon S3 Storage Service.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: bucketName
uriParameter.description: Name of the bucket. The bucket will be created if it don't already exists.

uriParameter.name: fileName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To get the object from the bucket with the given file name

uriParameter.name: serverSideEncryption
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.16: Sets the server-side encryption algorithm when encrypting the object using AWS-managed keys. For example use AES256.

uriParameter.name: prefix
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.10.1: The prefix which is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.ListObjectsRequest to only consume objects we are interested in.

uriParameter.name: partSize
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.15.0: Setup the partSize which is used in multi part upload the default size is 25M.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.16: Specify a proxy port to be used inside the client definition.

uriParameter.name: multiPartUpload
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.15.0: If it is true camel will upload the file with multi part format the part size is decided by the option of partSize

uriParameter.name: storageClass
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.8.4: The storage class to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.PutObjectRequest request.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: amazonS3Client
uriParameter.description: Reference to a com.amazonaws.services.sqs.AmazonS3 in the link:registry.htmlRegistry.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Is default unlimited but use 0 or negative number to disable it as unlimited.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: policy
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.8.4: The policy for this queue to set in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.AmazonS3setBucketPolicy() method.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: secretKey
uriParameter.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.16: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: amazonS3Endpoint
uriParameter.description: The region with which the AWS-S3 client wants to work with.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: includeBody
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.17: If it is true the exchange body will be set to a stream to the contents of the file. If false the headers will be set with the S3 object metadata but the body will be null.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: accessKey
uriParameter.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: deleteAfterRead
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Delete objects from S3 after they have been retrieved. The delete is only performed if the Exchange is committed. If a rollback occurs the object is not deleted. If this option is false then the same objects will be retrieve over and over again on the polls. Therefore you need to use the Idempotent Consumer EIP in the route to filter out duplicates. You can filter using the link S3ConstantsBUCKET_NAME and link S3ConstantsKEY headers or only the link S3ConstantsKEY header.

uriParameter.name: deleteAfterWrite
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Camel 2.11.0: Delete file object after the S3 file has been uploaded

uriParameter.name: region
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The region where the bucket is located. This option is used in the com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.CreateBucketRequest.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: VM
component.description: The vm component provides asynchronous call to another endpoint from the same CamelContext.

componentProperty.name: queueSize
componentProperty.description: Sets the default maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e. the number of messages it can hold).

componentProperty.name: defaultQueueFactory
componentProperty.description: Sets the default queue factory.

componentProperty.name: concurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Sets the default number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: pollTimeout
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The timeout used when polling. When a timeout occurs the consumer can check whether it is allowed to continue running. Setting a lower value allows the consumer to react more quickly upon shutdown.

uriParameter.name: failIfNoConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether the producer should fail by throwing an exception when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.

uriParameter.name: waitForTaskToComplete
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to specify whether the caller should wait for the async task to complete or not before continuing. The following three options are supported: Always Never or IfReplyExpected. The first two values are self-explanatory. The last value IfReplyExpected will only wait if the message is Request Reply based. The default option is IfReplyExpected.

uriParameter.name: limitConcurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to limit the number of concurrentConsumers to the maximum of 500. By default an exception will be thrown if an endpoint is configured with a greater number. You can disable that check by turning this option off.

uriParameter.name: blockWhenFull
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full SEDA queue will block until the queue's capacity is no longer exhausted. By default an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full. By enabling this option the calling thread will instead block and wait until the message can be accepted.

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) before a SEDA producer will stop waiting for an asynchronous task to complete. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: size
uriParameter.description: The maximum capacity of the SEDA queue (i.e. the number of messages it can hold).

uriParameter.name: discardIfNoConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether the producer should discard the message (do not add the message to the queue) when sending to a queue with no active consumers. Only one of the options discardIfNoConsumers and failIfNoConsumers can be enabled at the same time.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name of queue

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: purgeWhenStopping
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to purge the task queue when stopping the consumer/route. This allows to stop faster as any pending messages on the queue is discarded.

uriParameter.name: multipleConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether multiple consumers are allowed. If enabled you can use SEDA for Publish-Subscribe messaging. That is you can send a message to the SEDA queue and have each consumer receive a copy of the message. When enabled this option should be specified on every consumer endpoint.

uriParameter.name: queue
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Define the queue instance which will be used by the endpoint. This option is only for rare use-cases where you want to use a custom queue instance.

component.title: HTTP
component.description: For calling out to external HTTP servers using Apache HTTP Client 3.x.

componentProperty.name: httpClientConfigurer
componentProperty.description: To use the custom HttpClientConfigurer to perform configuration of the HttpClient that will be used.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: httpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

componentProperty.name: httpConnectionManager
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpConnectionManager to manage connections

componentProperty.name: httpConfiguration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration.

uriParameter.name: authMethodPriority
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Authentication method for proxy either as Basic Digest or NTLM.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: ignoreResponseBody
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true The http producer won't read response body and cache the input stream

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageBody
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy port number

uriParameter.name: httpUri
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to call.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: copyHeaders
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).

uriParameter.name: httpConnectionManagerOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the HttpConnectionManager using the key/values from the Map.

uriParameter.name: httpConnectionManager
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpConnectionManager to manage connections

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the HttpProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: httpBinding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: chunked
uriParameter.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

uriParameter.name: httpClientOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the HttpClient using the key/values from the Map.

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether a Connection Close header must be added to HTTP Request. By default connectionClose is false.

uriParameter.name: okStatusCodeRange
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The status codes which is considered a success response. The values are inclusive. The range must be defined as from-to with the dash included.

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy host name

uriParameter.name: preserveHostHeader
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service

uriParameter.name: httpClientConfigurer
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Register a custom configuration strategy for new HttpClient instances created by producers or consumers such as to configure authentication mechanisms etc

uriParameter.name: disableStreamCache
uriParameter.label: common
uriParameter.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http/http4 producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.

uriParameter.name: urlRewrite
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to a custom org.apache.camel.component.http.UrlRewrite which allows you to rewrite urls when you bridge/proxy endpoints. See more details at http://camel.apache.org/urlrewrite.html

component.title: Exec
component.description: The exec component can be used to execute OS system commands.

uriParameter.name: args
uriParameter.description: The arguments may be one or many whitespace-separated tokens.

uriParameter.name: useStderrOnEmptyStdout
uriParameter.description: A boolean indicating that when stdout is empty this component will populate the Camel Message Body with stderr. This behavior is disabled (false) by default.

uriParameter.name: outFile
uriParameter.description: The name of a file created by the executable that should be considered as its output. If no outFile is set the standard output (stdout) of the executable will be used instead.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: workingDir
uriParameter.description: The directory in which the command should be executed. If null the working directory of the current process will be used.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.description: A reference to a org.apache.commons.exec.ExecBinding in the Registry.

uriParameter.name: commandExecutor
uriParameter.description: A reference to a org.apache.commons.exec.ExecCommandExecutor in the Registry that customizes the command execution. The default command executor utilizes the commons-exec library which adds a shutdown hook for every executed command.

uriParameter.name: executable
uriParameter.description: Sets the executable to be executed. The executable must not be empty or null.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which the executable should be terminated. If execution has not completed within the timeout the component will send a termination request.

component.title: Undertow
component.description: The undertow component provides HTTP-based endpoints for consuming and producing HTTP requests.

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

componentProperty.name: undertowHttpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: reuseAddresses
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Setting to facilitate socket multiplexing

uriParameter.name: keepAlive
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Setting to ensure socket is not closed due to inactivity

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the producer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: httpMethodRestrict
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: matchOnUriPrefix
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: undertowHttpBinding
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom UndertowHttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and undertow.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: httpURI
uriParameter.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to use.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: options
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets additional channel options. The options that can be used are defined in org.xnio.Options. To configure from endpoint uri then prefix each option with option. such as option.close-abort=true&option.send-buffer=8192

uriParameter.name: optionsEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: tcpNoDelay
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Setting to improve TCP protocol performance

component.title: Google Calendar
component.description: The google-calendar component provides access to Google Calendar.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared configuration

componentProperty.name: clientFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the GoogleCalendarClientFactory as factory for creating the client. Will by default use BatchGoogleCalendarClientFactory

uriParameter.name: apiName
uriParameter.description: What kind of operation to perform

uriParameter.name: p12FileName
uriParameter.description: The name of the p12 file which has the private key to use with the Google Service Account.

uriParameter.name: clientId
uriParameter.description: Client ID of the calendar application

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: methodName
uriParameter.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

uriParameter.name: accessToken
uriParameter.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

uriParameter.name: emailAddress
uriParameter.description: The emailAddress of the Google Service Account.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: clientSecret
uriParameter.description: Client secret of the calendar application

uriParameter.name: scopes
uriParameter.description: Specifies the level of permissions you want a calendar application to have to a user account. See https://developers.google.com/google-apps/calendar/auth for more info.

uriParameter.name: inBody
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

uriParameter.name: user
uriParameter.description: The email address of the user the application is trying to impersonate in the service account flow

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: applicationName
uriParameter.description: Google calendar application name. Example would be camel-google-calendar/1.0

uriParameter.name: refreshToken
uriParameter.description: OAuth 2 refresh token. Using this the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

component.title: FOP
component.description: The fop component allows you to render a message into different output formats using Apache FOP.

uriParameter.name: fopFactory
uriParameter.description: Allows to use a custom configured or implementation of org.apache.fop.apps.FopFactory.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: outputType
uriParameter.description: The primary output format is PDF but other output formats are also supported.

uriParameter.name: userConfigURL
uriParameter.description: The location of a configuration file which can be loaded from classpath or file system.

component.title: JDBC
component.description: The jdbc component enables you to access databases through JDBC where SQL queries are sent in the message body.

componentProperty.name: dataSource
componentProperty.description: To use the DataSource instance instead of looking up the data source by name from the registry.

uriParameter.name: resetAutoCommit
uriParameter.description: Camel will set the autoCommit on the JDBC connection to be false commit the change after executed the statement and reset the autoCommit flag of the connection at the end if the resetAutoCommit is true. If the JDBC connection doesn't support to reset the autoCommit flag you can set the resetAutoCommit flag to be false and Camel will not try to reset the autoCommit flag. When used with XA transactions you most likely need to set it to false so that the transaction manager is in charge of committing this tx.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: outputType
uriParameter.description: Determines the output the producer should use.

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.description: Whether transactions are in use.

uriParameter.name: useHeadersAsParameters
uriParameter.description: Set this option to true to use the prepareStatementStrategy with named parameters. This allows to define queries with named placeholders and use headers with the dynamic values for the query placeholders.

uriParameter.name: allowNamedParameters
uriParameter.description: Whether to allow using named parameters in the queries.

uriParameter.name: dataSourceName
uriParameter.description: Name of DataSource to lookup in the Registry.

uriParameter.name: useJDBC4ColumnNameAndLabelSemantics
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to use JDBC 4 or JDBC 3.0 or older semantic when retrieving column name. JDBC 4.0 uses columnLabel to get the column name where as JDBC 3.0 uses both columnName or columnLabel. Unfortunately JDBC drivers behave differently so you can use this option to work out issues around your JDBC driver if you get problem using this component This option is default true.

uriParameter.name: prepareStatementStrategy
uriParameter.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.jdbc.JdbcPrepareStatementStrategy to control preparation of the query and prepared statement.

uriParameter.name: beanRowMapper
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.jdbc.BeanRowMapper when using outputClass. The default implementation will lower case the row names and skip underscores and dashes. For example CUST_ID is mapped as custId.

uriParameter.name: useGetBytesForBlob
uriParameter.description: To read BLOB columns as bytes instead of string data. This may be needed for certain databases such as Oracle where you must read BLOB columns as bytes.

uriParameter.name: outputClass
uriParameter.description: Specify the full package and class name to use as conversion when outputType=SelectOne or SelectList.

uriParameter.name: parameters
uriParameter.description: Optional parameters to the java.sql.Statement. For example to set maxRows fetchSize etc.

uriParameter.name: readSize
uriParameter.description: The default maximum number of rows that can be read by a polling query. The default value is 0.

component.title: Mustache

componentProperty.name: mustacheFactory
componentProperty.description: To use a custom MustacheFactory

uriParameter.name: endDelimiter

uriParameter.name: startDelimiter

uriParameter.name: contentCache

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: Path to the resource or a reference to lookup a bean in the Registry to use as the resource

uriParameter.name: encoding
uriParameter.description: Character encoding of the resource content.

component.title: Scheduler
component.description: The scheduler component is used for generating message exchanges when a scheduler fires.

componentProperty.name: concurrentTasks
componentProperty.description: Number of threads used by the scheduling thread pool. Is by default using a single thread

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle

uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: concurrentTasks
uriParameter.label: scheduler
uriParameter.description: Number of threads used by the scheduling thread pool. Is by default using a single thread

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allow to plugin a custom org.apache.camel.spi.ScheduledPollConsumerScheduler to use as the scheduler for firing when the polling consumer runs. The default implementation uses the ScheduledExecutorService and there is a Quartz2 and Spring based which supports CRON expressions. Notice: If using a custom scheduler then the options for initialDelay useFixedDelay timeUnit and scheduledExecutorService may not be in use. Use the text quartz2 to refer to use the Quartz2 scheduler; and use the text spring to use the Spring based; and use the text myScheduler to refer to a custom scheduler by its id in the Registry. See Quartz2 page for an example.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel. In other words the error occurred while the polling was gathering information for instance access to a file network failed so Camel cannot access it to scan for files. The default implementation will log the caused exception at WARN level and ignore it.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: The name of the scheduler

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool. This option allows you to share a thread pool among multiple consumers.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

component.title: Solr
component.description: The solr component allows you to interface with an Apache Lucene Solr server.

uriParameter.name: defaultMaxConnectionsPerHost
uriParameter.description: maxConnectionsPerHost on the underlying HttpConnectionManager

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: maxTotalConnections
uriParameter.description: maxTotalConnection on the underlying HttpConnectionManager

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: streamingThreadCount
uriParameter.description: Set the number of threads for the StreamingUpdateSolrServer

uriParameter.name: collection
uriParameter.label: solrCloud
uriParameter.description: Set the collection name which the solrCloud server could use

uriParameter.name: zkHost
uriParameter.label: solrCloud
uriParameter.description: Set the ZooKeeper host information which the solrCloud could use such as zkhost=localhost:8123.

uriParameter.name: soTimeout
uriParameter.description: Read timeout on the underlying HttpConnectionManager. This is desirable for queries but probably not for indexing

uriParameter.name: url
uriParameter.description: Hostname and port for the solr server

uriParameter.name: maxRetries
uriParameter.description: Maximum number of retries to attempt in the event of transient errors

uriParameter.name: allowCompression
uriParameter.description: Server side must support gzip or deflate for this to have any effect

uriParameter.name: requestHandler
uriParameter.description: Set the request handler to be used

uriParameter.name: followRedirects
uriParameter.description: indicates whether redirects are used to get to the Solr server

uriParameter.name: streamingQueueSize
uriParameter.description: Set the queue size for the StreamingUpdateSolrServer

uriParameter.name: connectionTimeout
uriParameter.description: connectionTimeout on the underlying HttpConnectionManager

component.title: AHC Secure Websocket
component.description: To exchange data with external Websocket servers using Async Http Client.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.util.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

componentProperty.name: client
componentProperty.description: To use a custom AsyncHttpClient

componentProperty.name: binding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

componentProperty.name: clientConfig
componentProperty.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

uriParameter.name: clientConfigOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClientConfig using the key/values from the Map.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the AhcOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.util.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. This reference overrides any configured SSLContextParameters at the component level. See Using the JSSE Configuration Utility. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Define if the Connection Close header has to be added to HTTP Request. This parameter is false by default

uriParameter.name: clientConfig
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useStreaming
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: To enable streaming to send data as multiple text fragments.

uriParameter.name: httpUri
uriParameter.description: The URI to use such as http://hostname:port/path

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type (for example using Jetty or Servlet Camel components). On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the AhcOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: sendMessageOnError
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to send an message if the web-socket listener received an error.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.description: If the option is true then the Exchange.HTTP_URI header is ignored and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the AhcProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: bufferSize
uriParameter.description: The initial in-memory buffer size used when transferring data between Camel and AHC Client.

component.title: Jetty 9
component.description: The jetty component provides HTTP-based endpoints for consuming and producing HTTP requests.

componentProperty.name: sslSocketConnectors
componentProperty.description: A map which contains per port number specific SSL connectors.

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

componentProperty.name: sslKeyPassword
componentProperty.description: The key password which is used to access the certificate's key entry in the keystore (this is the same password that is supplied to the keystore command's -keypass option).

componentProperty.name: enableJmx
componentProperty.description: If this option is true Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint.

componentProperty.name: sslSocketConnectorProperties
componentProperty.description: A map which contains general SSL connector properties.

componentProperty.name: useContinuation
componentProperty.description: Whether or not to use Jetty continuations for the Jetty Server.

componentProperty.name: proxyPort
componentProperty.description: To use a http proxy to configure the port number.

componentProperty.name: httpClientMinThreads
componentProperty.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in HttpClient thread pool. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: socketConnectors
componentProperty.description: A map which contains per port number specific HTTP connectors. Uses the same principle as sslSocketConnectors.

componentProperty.name: keystore
componentProperty.description: Specifies the location of the Java keystore file which contains the Jetty server's own X.509 certificate in a key entry.

componentProperty.name: threadPool
componentProperty.description: To use a custom thread pool for the server. This option should only be used in special circumstances.

componentProperty.name: maxThreads
componentProperty.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in server thread pool. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured.

componentProperty.name: mbContainer
componentProperty.description: To use a existing configured org.eclipse.jetty.jmx.MBeanContainer if JMX is enabled that Jetty uses for registering mbeans.

componentProperty.name: responseHeaderSize
componentProperty.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the response header size on the Jetty connectors.

componentProperty.name: requestHeaderSize
componentProperty.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the request header size on the Jetty connectors.

componentProperty.name: minThreads
componentProperty.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in server thread pool. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured.

componentProperty.name: httpBinding
componentProperty.description: Not to be used - use JettyHttpBinding instead.

componentProperty.name: continuationTimeout
componentProperty.description: Allows to set a timeout in millis when using Jetty as consumer (server). By default Jetty uses 30000. You can use a value of = 0 to never expire. If a timeout occurs then the request will be expired and Jetty will return back a http error 503 to the client. This option is only in use when using Jetty with the Asynchronous Routing Engine.

componentProperty.name: requestBufferSize
componentProperty.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the request buffer size on the Jetty connectors.

componentProperty.name: proxyHost
componentProperty.description: To use a http proxy to configure the hostname.

componentProperty.name: jettyHttpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.jetty.JettyHttpBinding which are used to customize how a response should be written for the producer.

componentProperty.name: httpConfiguration
componentProperty.description: Jetty component does not use HttpConfiguration.

componentProperty.name: responseBufferSize
componentProperty.description: Allows to configure a custom value of the response buffer size on the Jetty connectors.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: sslPassword
componentProperty.description: The ssl password which is required to access the keystore file (this is the same password that is supplied to the keystore command's -storepass option).

componentProperty.name: errorHandler
componentProperty.description: This option is used to set the ErrorHandler that Jetty server uses.

componentProperty.name: socketConnectorProperties
componentProperty.description: A map which contains general HTTP connector properties. Uses the same principle as sslSocketConnectorProperties.

componentProperty.name: httpClientMaxThreads
componentProperty.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in HttpClient thread pool. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured.

uriParameter.name: jettyBinding
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom JettyHttpBinding which be used to customize how a response should be written for the producer.

uriParameter.name: authMethodPriority
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Authentication method for proxy either as Basic Digest or NTLM.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: ignoreResponseBody
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true The http producer won't read response body and cache the input stream

uriParameter.name: useContinuation
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to use Jetty continuations for the Jetty Server.

uriParameter.name: sendServerVersion
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true jetty will send the server header with the jetty version information to the client which sends the request. NOTE please make sure there is no any other camel-jetty endpoint is share the same port otherwise this option may not work as expected.

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy port number

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: copyHeaders
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the HttpProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: jettyBindingRef
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom JettyHttpBinding which be used to customize how a response should be written for the producer.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: eagerCheckContentAvailable
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to eager check whether the HTTP requests has content if the content-length header is 0 or not present. This can be turned on in case HTTP clients do not send streamed data.

uriParameter.name: httpBinding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether a Connection Close header must be added to HTTP Request. By default connectionClose is false.

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy host name

uriParameter.name: preserveHostHeader
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service

uriParameter.name: disableStreamCache
uriParameter.label: common
uriParameter.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http/http4 producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.

uriParameter.name: multipartFilter
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows using a custom multipart filter. Note: setting multipartFilterRef forces the value of enableMultipartFilter to true.

uriParameter.name: optionsEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParametersRef
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: httpClientMaxThreads
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in HttpClient thread pool. This setting override any setting configured on component level. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured. If not set it default to max 254 threads used in Jettys thread pool.

uriParameter.name: enableMultipartFilter
uriParameter.description: Whether Jetty org.eclipse.jetty.servlets.MultiPartFilter is enabled or not. You should set this value to false when bridging endpoints to ensure multipart requests is proxied/bridged as well.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: enableJmx
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageBody
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.

uriParameter.name: sessionSupport
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable the session manager on the server side of Jetty.

uriParameter.name: httpBindingRef
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: httpUri
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to call.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: httpClientMinThreads
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in HttpClient thread pool. This setting override any setting configured on component level. Notice that both a min and max size must be configured. If not set it default to min 8 threads used in Jettys thread pool.

uriParameter.name: httpClientParameters
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Configuration of Jetty's HttpClient. For example setting httpClient.idleTimeout=30000 sets the idle timeout to 30 seconds. And httpClient.timeout=30000 sets the request timeout to 30 seconds in case you want to timeout sooner if you have long running request/response calls.

uriParameter.name: enableCORS
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true Jetty server will setup the CrossOriginFilter which supports the CORS out of box.

uriParameter.name: httpClient
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets a shared HttpClient to use for all producers created by this endpoint. By default each producer will use a new http client and not share. Important: Make sure to handle the lifecycle of the shared client such as stopping the client when it is no longer in use. Camel will call the start method on the client to ensure its started when this endpoint creates a producer. This options should only be used in special circumstances.

uriParameter.name: filtersRef
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows using a custom filters which is putted into a list and can be find in the Registry. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: filterInitParameters
uriParameter.label: consumer, advanced
uriParameter.description: Configuration of the filter init parameters. These parameters will be applied to the filter list before starting the jetty server.

uriParameter.name: httpMethodRestrict
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: sendDateHeader
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true jetty server will send the date header to the client which sends the request. NOTE please make sure there is no any other camel-jetty endpoint is share the same port otherwise this option may not work as expected.

uriParameter.name: continuationTimeout
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows to set a timeout in millis when using Jetty as consumer (server). By default Jetty uses 30000. You can use a value of = 0 to never expire. If a timeout occurs then the request will be expired and Jetty will return back a http error 503 to the client. This option is only in use when using Jetty with the Asynchronous Routing Engine.

uriParameter.name: matchOnUriPrefix
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: chunked
uriParameter.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

uriParameter.name: okStatusCodeRange
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The status codes which is considered a success response. The values are inclusive. The range must be defined as from-to with the dash included.

uriParameter.name: responseBufferSize
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom buffer size on the javax.servlet.ServletResponse.

uriParameter.name: handlers
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies a comma-delimited set of Handler instances to lookup in your Registry. These handlers are added to the Jetty servlet context (for example to add security). Important: You can not use different handlers with different Jetty endpoints using the same port number. The handlers is associated to the port number. If you need different handlers then use different port numbers.

uriParameter.name: multipartFilterRef
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows using a custom multipart filter. Note: setting multipartFilterRef forces the value of enableMultipartFilter to true.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.

uriParameter.name: traceEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP TRACE for this Servlet consumer. By default TRACE is turned off.

uriParameter.name: urlRewrite
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to a custom org.apache.camel.component.http.UrlRewrite which allows you to rewrite urls when you bridge/proxy endpoints. See more details at http://camel.apache.org/urlrewrite.html

component.title: OSGi PAX Logging
component.description: The paxlogging component can be used in an OSGi environment to receive PaxLogging events and process them.

componentProperty.name: bundleContext
componentProperty.description: The OSGi BundleContext is automatic injected by Camel

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: appender
uriParameter.description: Appender is the name of the pax appender that need to be configured in the PaxLogging service configuration.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: SIP
component.description: To send and receive messages using the SIP protocol (used in telco and mobile).

uriParameter.name: addressFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom AddressFactory

uriParameter.name: messageFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom MessageFactory

uriParameter.name: contentTypeHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message content details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ContentTypeHeader

uriParameter.name: presenceAgent
uriParameter.description: This setting is used to distinguish between a Presence Agent & a consumer. This is due to the fact that the SIP Camel component ships with a basic Presence Agent (for testing purposes only). Consumers have to set this flag to true.

uriParameter.name: eventHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing event details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.EventHeader

uriParameter.name: fromPort
uriParameter.description: Port of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: fromUser
uriParameter.description: Username of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based custom FromHeader is specified.

uriParameter.name: viaHeaders
uriParameter.description: List of custom Header objects of the type javax.sip.header.ViaHeader. Each ViaHeader containing a proxy address for request forwarding. (Note this header is automatically updated by each proxy when the request arrives at its listener)

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: stackName
uriParameter.description: Name of the SIP Stack instance associated with an SIP Endpoint.

uriParameter.name: receiveTimeoutMillis
uriParameter.description: Setting for specifying amount of time to wait for a Response and/or Acknowledgement can be received from another SIP stack

uriParameter.name: sipUri
uriParameter.description: To use a custom SipURI. If none configured then the SipUri fallback to use the options toUser toHost:toPort

uriParameter.name: implementationServerLogFile
uriParameter.description: Name of server log file to use for logging

uriParameter.name: listeningPoint
uriParameter.description: To use a custom ListeningPoint implementation

uriParameter.name: toUser
uriParameter.description: Username of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based custom ToHeader is specified.

uriParameter.name: msgExpiration
uriParameter.description: The amount of time a message received at an endpoint is considered valid

uriParameter.name: eventHeaderName
uriParameter.description: Setting for a String based event Id. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: extensionHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing user/application specific details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ExtensionHeader

uriParameter.name: expiresHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message expiration details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ExpiresHeader

uriParameter.name: maxMessageSize
uriParameter.description: Setting for maximum allowed Message size in bytes.

uriParameter.name: useRouterForAllUris
uriParameter.description: This setting is used when requests are sent to the Presence Agent via a proxy.

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.description: Setting for contentType can be set to any valid MimeType.

uriParameter.name: toHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message receiver settings. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ToHeader

uriParameter.name: consumer
uriParameter.description: This setting is used to determine whether the kind of header (FromHeaderToHeader etc) that needs to be created for this endpoint

uriParameter.name: contactHeader
uriParameter.description: An optional custom Header object containing verbose contact details (email phone number etc). Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ContactHeader

uriParameter.name: implementationDebugLogFile
uriParameter.description: Name of client debug log file to use for logging

uriParameter.name: eventId
uriParameter.description: Setting for a String based event Id. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: automaticDialogSupport
uriParameter.description: Setting to specify whether every communication should be associated with a dialog.

uriParameter.name: maxForwards
uriParameter.description: Number of maximum proxy forwards

uriParameter.name: maxForwardsHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing details on maximum proxy forwards. This header places a limit on the viaHeaders possible. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.MaxForwardsHeader

uriParameter.name: cacheConnections
uriParameter.description: Should connections be cached by the SipStack to reduce cost of connection creation. This is useful if the connection is used for long running conversations.

uriParameter.name: sipFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom SipFactory to create the SipStack to be used

uriParameter.name: fromHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message originator settings. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.FromHeader

uriParameter.name: toPort
uriParameter.description: Portname of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based ToHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: transport
uriParameter.description: Setting for choice of transport protocol. Valid choices are tcp or udp.

uriParameter.name: contentSubType
uriParameter.description: Setting for contentSubType can be set to any valid MimeSubType.

uriParameter.name: uri
uriParameter.description: URI of the SIP server to connect to (the username and password can be included such as: john:secretmyserver:9999)

uriParameter.name: headerFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFactory

uriParameter.name: sipStack
uriParameter.description: To use a custom SipStack

uriParameter.name: toHost
uriParameter.description: Hostname of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based ToHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: implementationTraceLevel
uriParameter.description: Logging level for tracing

uriParameter.name: callIdHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing call details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.CallIdHeader

uriParameter.name: fromHost
uriParameter.description: Hostname of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Stomp
component.description: The stomp component is used for communicating with Stomp compliant message brokers.

componentProperty.name: brokerURL
componentProperty.description: The URI of the Stomp broker to connect to

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared stomp configuration

componentProperty.name: host
componentProperty.description: The virtual host

componentProperty.name: login
componentProperty.description: The username

componentProperty.name: passcode
componentProperty.description: The password

uriParameter.name: brokerURL
uriParameter.description: The URI of the Stomp broker to connect to

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
