uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: destination
uriParameter.description: Name of the queue

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The virtual host name

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: login
uriParameter.description: The username

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: passcode
uriParameter.description: The password

component.title: Class
component.description: The Class Component is for invoking Java Classes (Java beans) from Camel.

uriParameter.name: cache
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If enabled Camel will cache the result of the first Registry look-up. Cache can be enabled if the bean in the Registry is defined as a singleton scope.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: method
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of the method to invoke on the bean

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: beanName
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of the bean to invoke

uriParameter.name: multiParameterArray
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: How to treat the parameters which are passed from the message body; if it is true the message body should be an array of parameters. Note: This option is used internally by Camel and is not intended for end users to use.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: parameters
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Used for configuring additional properties on the bean

component.title: CometD
component.description: The cometd component is a transport for working with the Jetty implementation of the cometd/bayeux protocol.

componentProperty.name: extensions
componentProperty.description: To use a list of custom BayeuxServer.Extension that allows modifying incoming and outgoing requests.

componentProperty.name: sslKeystore
componentProperty.description: The path to the keystore.

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

componentProperty.name: sslPassword
componentProperty.description: The password when using SSL.

componentProperty.name: sslKeyPassword
componentProperty.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

componentProperty.name: securityPolicy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom configured SecurityPolicy to control authorization

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: jsonCommented
uriParameter.description: If true the server will accept JSON wrapped in a comment and will generate JSON wrapped in a comment. This is a defence against Ajax Hijacking.

uriParameter.name: maxInterval
uriParameter.description: The max client side poll timeout in milliseconds. A client will be removed if a connection is not received in this time.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: The server side poll timeout in milliseconds. This is how long the server will hold a reconnect request before responding.

uriParameter.name: filterPath
uriParameter.description: The filterPath will be used by the CrossOriginFilter if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

uriParameter.name: baseResource
uriParameter.description: The root directory for the web resources or classpath. Use the protocol file: or classpath: depending if you want that the component loads the resource from file system or classpath. Classpath is required for OSGI deployment where the resources are packaged in the jar

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: disconnectLocalSession
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether to disconnect local sessions after publishing a message to its channel. Disconnecting local session is needed as they are not swept by default by CometD and therefore you can run out of memory.

uriParameter.name: allowedOrigins
uriParameter.description: The origins domain that support to cross if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

uriParameter.name: crossOriginFilterOn
uriParameter.description: If true the server will support for cross-domain filtering

uriParameter.name: logLevel
uriParameter.description: Logging level. 0=none 1=info 2=debug.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Host port number

uriParameter.name: channelName
uriParameter.description: The channelName represents a topic that can be subscribed to by the Camel endpoints.

uriParameter.name: interval
uriParameter.description: The client side poll timeout in milliseconds. How long a client will wait between reconnects

uriParameter.name: multiFrameInterval
uriParameter.description: The client side poll timeout if multiple connections are detected from the same browser.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: sessionHeadersEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to include the server session headers in the Camel message when creating a Camel Message for incoming requests.

component.title: HBase
component.description: For reading/writing from/to an HBase store (Hadoop database).

componentProperty.name: poolMaxSize
componentProperty.description: Maximum number of references to keep for each table in the HTable pool. The default value is 10.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared configuration

uriParameter.name: rowMapping
uriParameter.description: To map the key/values from the Map to a HBaseRow. The following keys is supported: rowId - The id of the row. This has limited use as the row usually changes per Exchange. rowType - The type to covert row id to. Supported operations: CamelHBaseScan. family - The column family. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns. qualifier - The column qualifier. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns. value - The value. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns valueType - The value type. Supports a number suffix for referring to more than one columns. Supported operations: CamelHBaseGet and CamelHBaseScan.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: filters
uriParameter.description: A list of filters to use.

uriParameter.name: removeHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HBaseRemoveHandler that is executed when a row is to be removed.

uriParameter.name: mappingStrategyName
uriParameter.description: The strategy to use for mapping Camel messages to HBase columns. Supported values: header or body.

uriParameter.name: remove
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true Camel HBase Consumer will remove the rows which it processes.

uriParameter.name: tableName
uriParameter.description: The name of the table

uriParameter.name: cellMappingStrategyFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom CellMappingStrategyFactory that is responsible for mapping cells.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: rowModel
uriParameter.description: An instance of org.apache.camel.component.hbase.model.HBaseRow which describes how each row should be modeled

uriParameter.name: maxResults
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The maximum number of rows to scan.

uriParameter.name: userGroupInformation
uriParameter.description: Defines privileges to communicate with HBase such as using kerberos.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Gets the maximum number of messages as a limit to poll at each polling. Is default unlimited but use 0 or negative number to disable it as unlimited.

uriParameter.name: mappingStrategyClassName
uriParameter.description: The class name of a custom mapping strategy implementation.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The HBase operation to perform

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Netty
component.description: Socket level networking using TCP or UDP with the Netty 3.x library.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the NettyConfiguration as configuration when creating endpoints.

componentProperty.name: maximumPoolSize
componentProperty.description: The core pool size for the ordered thread pool if its in use. The default value is 16.

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to disconnect(close) from Netty Channel right after use. Can be used for both consumer and producer.

uriParameter.name: enabledProtocols
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Which protocols to enable when using SSL

uriParameter.name: maxChannelMemorySize
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The maximum total size of the queued events per channel when using orderedThreadPoolExecutor. Specify 0 to disable.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: keyStoreFormat
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Keystore format to be used for payload encryption. Defaults to JKS if not set

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMinIdle
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the minimum number of instances allowed in the producer pool before the evictor thread (if active) spawns new objects.

uriParameter.name: ssl
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Setting to specify whether SSL encryption is applied to this endpoint

uriParameter.name: protocol
uriParameter.description: The protocol to use which can be tcp or udp.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: securityProvider
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Security provider to be used for payload encryption. Defaults to SunX509 if not set.

uriParameter.name: delimiter
uriParameter.description: The delimiter to use for the textline codec. Possible values are LINE and NULL.

uriParameter.name: bossPool
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a explicit org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.BossPool as the boss thread pool. For example to share a thread pool with multiple consumers. By default each consumer has their own boss pool with 1 core thread.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The hostname. For the consumer the hostname is localhost or 0.0.0.0 For the producer the hostname is the remote host to connect to

uriParameter.name: connectTimeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Time to wait for a socket connection to be available. Value is in millis.

uriParameter.name: options
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to configure additional netty options using option. as prefix. For example option.child.keepAlive=false to set the netty option child.keepAlive=false. See the Netty documentation for possible options that can be used.

uriParameter.name: textline
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP. If no codec is specified you can use this flag to indicate a text line based codec; if not specified or the value is false then Object Serialization is assumed over TCP.

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMinEvictableIdle
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the minimum amount of time (value in millis) an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor.

uriParameter.name: tcpNoDelay
uriParameter.description: Setting to improve TCP protocol performance

uriParameter.name: udpConnectionlessSending
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: This option supports connection less udp sending which is a real fire and forget. A connected udp send receive the PortUnreachableException if no one is listen on the receiving port.

uriParameter.name: needClientAuth
uriParameter.label: consumer,security
uriParameter.description: Configures whether the server needs client authentication when using SSL.

uriParameter.name: sslHandler
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Reference to a class that could be used to return an SSL Handler

uriParameter.name: encoders
uriParameter.description: A list of encoders to be used. You can use a String which have values separated by comma and have the values be looked up in the Registry. Just remember to prefix the value with so Camel knows it should lookup.

uriParameter.name: keyStoreFile
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Client side certificate keystore to be used for encryption

uriParameter.name: decoders
uriParameter.description: A list of decoders to be used. You can use a String which have values separated by comma and have the values be looked up in the Registry. Just remember to prefix the value with so Camel knows it should lookup.

uriParameter.name: decoder
uriParameter.description: A custom ChannelHandler class that can be used to perform special marshalling of inbound payloads. Must override org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelUpStreamHandler.

uriParameter.name: reuseAddress
uriParameter.description: Setting to facilitate socket multiplexing

uriParameter.name: encoding
uriParameter.description: The encoding (a charset name) to use for the textline codec. If not provided Camel will use the JVM default Charset.

uriParameter.name: workerPool
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a explicit org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio.WorkerPool as the worker thread pool. For example to share a thread pool with multiple consumers. By default each consumer has their own worker pool with 2 x cpu count core threads.

uriParameter.name: encoder
uriParameter.description: A custom ChannelHandler class that can be used to perform special marshalling of outbound payloads. Must override org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelDownStreamHandler.

uriParameter.name: sync
uriParameter.description: Setting to set endpoint as one-way or request-response

uriParameter.name: workerCount
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When netty works on nio mode it uses default workerCount parameter from Netty which is cpu_core_threads2. User can use this operation to override the default workerCount from Netty

uriParameter.name: backlog
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to configure a backlog for netty consumer (server). Note the backlog is just a best effort depending on the OS. Setting this option to a value such as 200 500 or 1000 tells the TCP stack how long the accept queue can be If this option is not configured then the backlog depends on OS setting.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The host port number

uriParameter.name: networkInterface
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When using UDP then this option can be used to specify a network interface by its name such as eth0 to join a multicast group.

uriParameter.name: allowDefaultCodec
uriParameter.description: The netty component installs a default codec if both encoder/deocder is null and textline is false. Setting allowDefaultCodec to false prevents the netty component from installing a default codec as the first element in the filter chain.

uriParameter.name: passphrase
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Password setting to use in order to encrypt/decrypt payloads sent using SSH

uriParameter.name: decoderMaxLineLength
uriParameter.description: The max line length to use for the textline codec.

uriParameter.name: clientMode
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the clientMode is true netty consumer will connect the address as a TCP client.

uriParameter.name: nettyServerBootstrapFactory
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom NettyServerBootstrapFactory

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: broadcast
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Setting to choose Multicast over UDP

uriParameter.name: trustStoreResource
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Server side certificate keystore to be used for encryption. Is loaded by default from classpath but you can prefix with classpath: file: or http: to load the resource from different systems.

uriParameter.name: bossCount
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When netty works on nio mode it uses default bossCount parameter from Netty which is 1. User can use this operation to override the default bossCount from Netty

uriParameter.name: sslClientCertHeaders
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: When enabled and in SSL mode then the Netty consumer will enrich the Camel Message with headers having information about the client certificate such as subject name issuer name serial number and the valid date range.

uriParameter.name: disconnectOnNoReply
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If sync is enabled then this option dictates NettyConsumer if it should disconnect where there is no reply to send back.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: keyStoreResource
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Client side certificate keystore to be used for encryption. Is loaded by default from classpath but you can prefix with classpath: file: or http: to load the resource from different systems.

uriParameter.name: autoAppendDelimiter
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to auto append missing end delimiter when sending using the textline codec.

uriParameter.name: serverPipelineFactory
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom ServerPipelineFactory

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMaxIdle
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the cap on the number of idle instances in the pool.

uriParameter.name: maxTotalMemorySize
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The maximum total size of the queued events for this pool when using orderedThreadPoolExecutor. Specify 0 to disable.

uriParameter.name: producerPoolEnabled
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether producer pool is enabled or not. Important: Do not turn this off as the pooling is needed for handling concurrency and reliable request/reply.

uriParameter.name: trustStoreFile
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Server side certificate keystore to be used for encryption

uriParameter.name: noReplyLogLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If sync is enabled this option dictates NettyConsumer which logging level to use when logging a there is no reply to send back.

uriParameter.name: transferExchange
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP. You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body. The following fields are transferred: In body Out body fault body In headers Out headers fault headers exchange properties exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level.

uriParameter.name: useChannelBuffer
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If the useChannelBuffer is true netty producer will turn the message body into ChannelBuffer before sending it out.

uriParameter.name: requestTimeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Allows to use a timeout for the Netty producer when calling a remote server. By default no timeout is in use. The value is in milli seconds so eg 30000 is 30 seconds. The requestTimeout is using Netty's ReadTimeoutHandler to trigger the timeout.

uriParameter.name: clientPipelineFactory
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom ClientPipelineFactory

uriParameter.name: receiveBufferSizePredictor
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures the buffer size predictor. See details at Jetty documentation and this mail thread.

uriParameter.name: keepAlive
uriParameter.description: Setting to ensure socket is not closed due to inactivity

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMaxActive
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the cap on the number of objects that can be allocated by the pool (checked out to clients or idle awaiting checkout) at a given time. Use a negative value for no limit.

uriParameter.name: sendBufferSize
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The TCP/UDP buffer sizes to be used during outbound communication. Size is bytes.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: lazyChannelCreation
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Channels can be lazily created to avoid exceptions if the remote server is not up and running when the Camel producer is started.

uriParameter.name: channelGroup
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a explicit ChannelGroup.

uriParameter.name: orderedThreadPoolExecutor
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to use ordered thread pool to ensure events are processed orderly on the same channel. See details at the netty javadoc of org.jboss.netty.handler.execution.OrderedMemoryAwareThreadPoolExecutor for more details.

uriParameter.name: bootstrapConfiguration
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom configured NettyServerBootstrapConfiguration for configuring this endpoint.

uriParameter.name: receiveBufferSize
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The TCP/UDP buffer sizes to be used during inbound communication. Size is bytes.

uriParameter.name: serverClosedChannelExceptionCaughtLogLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If the server (NettyConsumer) catches an java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException then its logged using this logging level. This is used to avoid logging the closed channel exceptions as clients can disconnect abruptly and then cause a flood of closed exceptions in the Netty server.

uriParameter.name: serverExceptionCaughtLogLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If the server (NettyConsumer) catches an exception then its logged using this logging level.

component.title: Spring Integration
component.description: Bridges Camel with Spring Integration.

uriParameter.name: inOut
uriParameter.description: The exchange pattern that the Spring integration endpoint should use. If inOut=true then a reply channel is expected either from the Spring Integration Message header or configured on the endpoint.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: outputChannel
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Spring integration output channel name that is used to send messages to Spring integration.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: defaultChannel
uriParameter.description: The default channel name which is used by the Spring Integration Spring context. It will equal to the inputChannel name for the Spring Integration consumer and the outputChannel name for the Spring Integration provider.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: inputChannel
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The Spring integration input channel name that this endpoint wants to consume from Spring integration.

component.title: Netty4
component.description: Socket level networking using TCP or UDP with the Netty 4.x library.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use the NettyConfiguration as configuration when creating endpoints.

componentProperty.name: executorService
componentProperty.description: To use the given EventExecutorGroup

componentProperty.name: maximumPoolSize
componentProperty.description: The thread pool size for the EventExecutorGroup if its in use. The default value is 16.

uriParameter.name: usingExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to use ordered thread pool to ensure events are processed orderly on the same channel.

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to disconnect(close) from Netty Channel right after use. Can be used for both consumer and producer.

uriParameter.name: enabledProtocols
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Which protocols to enable when using SSL

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: keyStoreFormat
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Keystore format to be used for payload encryption. Defaults to JKS if not set

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMinIdle
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the minimum number of instances allowed in the producer pool before the evictor thread (if active) spawns new objects.

uriParameter.name: ssl
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Setting to specify whether SSL encryption is applied to this endpoint

uriParameter.name: bossGroup
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Set the BossGroup which could be used for handling the new connection of the server side across the NettyEndpoint

uriParameter.name: protocol
uriParameter.description: The protocol to use which can be tcp or udp.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: securityProvider
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Security provider to be used for payload encryption. Defaults to SunX509 if not set.

uriParameter.name: delimiter
uriParameter.description: The delimiter to use for the textline codec. Possible values are LINE and NULL.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The hostname. For the consumer the hostname is localhost or 0.0.0.0 For the producer the hostname is the remote host to connect to

uriParameter.name: connectTimeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Time to wait for a socket connection to be available. Value is in millis.

uriParameter.name: options
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to configure additional netty options using option. as prefix. For example option.child.keepAlive=false to set the netty option child.keepAlive=false. See the Netty documentation for possible options that can be used.

uriParameter.name: textline
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP. If no codec is specified you can use this flag to indicate a text line based codec; if not specified or the value is false then Object Serialization is assumed over TCP.

uriParameter.name: workerGroup
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a explicit EventLoopGroup as the boss thread pool. For example to share a thread pool with multiple consumers. By default each consumer has their own boss pool with 1 core thread.

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMinEvictableIdle
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the minimum amount of time (value in millis) an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor.

uriParameter.name: tcpNoDelay
uriParameter.description: Setting to improve TCP protocol performance

uriParameter.name: udpConnectionlessSending
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: This option supports connection less udp sending which is a real fire and forget. A connected udp send receive the PortUnreachableException if no one is listen on the receiving port.

uriParameter.name: needClientAuth
uriParameter.label: consumer,security
uriParameter.description: Configures whether the server needs client authentication when using SSL.

uriParameter.name: sslHandler
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Reference to a class that could be used to return an SSL Handler

uriParameter.name: encoders
uriParameter.description: A list of encoders to be used. You can use a String which have values separated by comma and have the values be looked up in the Registry. Just remember to prefix the value with so Camel knows it should lookup.

uriParameter.name: keyStoreFile
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Client side certificate keystore to be used for encryption

uriParameter.name: decoders
uriParameter.description: A list of decoders to be used. You can use a String which have values separated by comma and have the values be looked up in the Registry. Just remember to prefix the value with so Camel knows it should lookup.

uriParameter.name: decoder
uriParameter.description: A custom ChannelHandler class that can be used to perform special marshalling of inbound payloads.

uriParameter.name: reuseAddress
uriParameter.description: Setting to facilitate socket multiplexing

uriParameter.name: encoding
uriParameter.description: The encoding (a charset name) to use for the textline codec. If not provided Camel will use the JVM default Charset.

uriParameter.name: encoder
uriParameter.description: A custom ChannelHandler class that can be used to perform special marshalling of outbound payloads.

uriParameter.name: sync
uriParameter.description: Setting to set endpoint as one-way or request-response

uriParameter.name: workerCount
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When netty works on nio mode it uses default workerCount parameter from Netty which is cpu_core_threads2. User can use this operation to override the default workerCount from Netty

uriParameter.name: backlog
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to configure a backlog for netty consumer (server). Note the backlog is just a best effort depending on the OS. Setting this option to a value such as 200 500 or 1000 tells the TCP stack how long the accept queue can be If this option is not configured then the backlog depends on OS setting.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The host port number

uriParameter.name: networkInterface
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When using UDP then this option can be used to specify a network interface by its name such as eth0 to join a multicast group.

uriParameter.name: allowDefaultCodec
uriParameter.description: The netty component installs a default codec if both encoder/deocder is null and textline is false. Setting allowDefaultCodec to false prevents the netty component from installing a default codec as the first element in the filter chain.

uriParameter.name: passphrase
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Password setting to use in order to encrypt/decrypt payloads sent using SSH

uriParameter.name: decoderMaxLineLength
uriParameter.description: The max line length to use for the textline codec.

uriParameter.name: clientMode
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the clientMode is true netty consumer will connect the address as a TCP client.

uriParameter.name: nettyServerBootstrapFactory
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom NettyServerBootstrapFactory

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: broadcast
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Setting to choose Multicast over UDP

uriParameter.name: trustStoreResource
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Server side certificate keystore to be used for encryption. Is loaded by default from classpath but you can prefix with classpath: file: or http: to load the resource from different systems.

uriParameter.name: bossCount
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When netty works on nio mode it uses default bossCount parameter from Netty which is 1. User can use this operation to override the default bossCount from Netty

uriParameter.name: serverInitializerFactory
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom ServerInitializerFactory

uriParameter.name: sslClientCertHeaders
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: When enabled and in SSL mode then the Netty consumer will enrich the Camel Message with headers having information about the client certificate such as subject name issuer name serial number and the valid date range.

uriParameter.name: disconnectOnNoReply
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If sync is enabled then this option dictates NettyConsumer if it should disconnect where there is no reply to send back.

uriParameter.name: useByteBuf
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If the useByteBuf is true netty producer will turn the message body into ByteBuf before sending it out.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: keyStoreResource
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Client side certificate keystore to be used for encryption. Is loaded by default from classpath but you can prefix with classpath: file: or http: to load the resource from different systems.

uriParameter.name: autoAppendDelimiter
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to auto append missing end delimiter when sending using the textline codec.

uriParameter.name: reuseChannel
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: This option allows producers to reuse the same Netty Channel for the lifecycle of processing the Exchange. This is useable if you need to call a server multiple times in a Camel route and want to use the same network connection. When using this the channel is not returned to the connection pool until the Exchange is done; or disconnected if the disconnect option is set to true. The reused Channel is stored on the Exchange as an exchange property with the key link NettyConstantsNETTY_CHANNEL which allows you to obtain the channel during routing and use it as well.

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMaxIdle
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the cap on the number of idle instances in the pool.

uriParameter.name: reconnect
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Used only in clientMode in consumer the consumer will attempt to reconnect on disconnection if this is enabled

uriParameter.name: producerPoolEnabled
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether producer pool is enabled or not. Important: Do not turn this off as the pooling is needed for handling concurrency and reliable request/reply.

uriParameter.name: trustStoreFile
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Server side certificate keystore to be used for encryption

uriParameter.name: noReplyLogLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If sync is enabled this option dictates NettyConsumer which logging level to use when logging a there is no reply to send back.

uriParameter.name: transferExchange
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Only used for TCP. You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body. The following fields are transferred: In body Out body fault body In headers Out headers fault headers exchange properties exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level.

uriParameter.name: requestTimeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Allows to use a timeout for the Netty producer when calling a remote server. By default no timeout is in use. The value is in milli seconds so eg 30000 is 30 seconds. The requestTimeout is using Netty's ReadTimeoutHandler to trigger the timeout.

uriParameter.name: receiveBufferSizePredictor
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures the buffer size predictor. See details at Jetty documentation and this mail thread.

uriParameter.name: keepAlive
uriParameter.description: Setting to ensure socket is not closed due to inactivity

uriParameter.name: producerPoolMaxActive
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the cap on the number of objects that can be allocated by the pool (checked out to clients or idle awaiting checkout) at a given time. Use a negative value for no limit.

uriParameter.name: clientInitializerFactory
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom ClientInitializerFactory

uriParameter.name: sendBufferSize
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The TCP/UDP buffer sizes to be used during outbound communication. Size is bytes.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: reconnectInterval
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Used if reconnect and clientMode is enabled. The interval in milli seconds to attempt reconnection

uriParameter.name: lazyChannelCreation
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Channels can be lazily created to avoid exceptions if the remote server is not up and running when the Camel producer is started.

uriParameter.name: channelGroup
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a explicit ChannelGroup.

uriParameter.name: bootstrapConfiguration
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom configured NettyServerBootstrapConfiguration for configuring this endpoint.

uriParameter.name: receiveBufferSize
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The TCP/UDP buffer sizes to be used during inbound communication. Size is bytes.

uriParameter.name: serverClosedChannelExceptionCaughtLogLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If the server (NettyConsumer) catches an java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException then its logged using this logging level. This is used to avoid logging the closed channel exceptions as clients can disconnect abruptly and then cause a flood of closed exceptions in the Netty server.

uriParameter.name: udpByteArrayCodec
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: For UDP only. If enabled the using byte array codec instead of Java serialization protocol.

uriParameter.name: serverExceptionCaughtLogLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If the server (NettyConsumer) catches an exception then its logged using this logging level.

component.title: SIP
component.description: To send and receive messages using the SIP protocol (used in telco and mobile).

uriParameter.name: addressFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom AddressFactory

uriParameter.name: messageFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom MessageFactory

uriParameter.name: contentTypeHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message content details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ContentTypeHeader

uriParameter.name: presenceAgent
uriParameter.description: This setting is used to distinguish between a Presence Agent & a consumer. This is due to the fact that the SIP Camel component ships with a basic Presence Agent (for testing purposes only). Consumers have to set this flag to true.

uriParameter.name: eventHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing event details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.EventHeader

uriParameter.name: fromPort
uriParameter.description: Port of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: fromUser
uriParameter.description: Username of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based custom FromHeader is specified.

uriParameter.name: viaHeaders
uriParameter.description: List of custom Header objects of the type javax.sip.header.ViaHeader. Each ViaHeader containing a proxy address for request forwarding. (Note this header is automatically updated by each proxy when the request arrives at its listener)

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: stackName
uriParameter.description: Name of the SIP Stack instance associated with an SIP Endpoint.

uriParameter.name: receiveTimeoutMillis
uriParameter.description: Setting for specifying amount of time to wait for a Response and/or Acknowledgement can be received from another SIP stack

uriParameter.name: sipUri
uriParameter.description: To use a custom SipURI. If none configured then the SipUri fallback to use the options toUser toHost:toPort

uriParameter.name: implementationServerLogFile
uriParameter.description: Name of server log file to use for logging

uriParameter.name: listeningPoint
uriParameter.description: To use a custom ListeningPoint implementation

uriParameter.name: toUser
uriParameter.description: Username of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based custom ToHeader is specified.

uriParameter.name: msgExpiration
uriParameter.description: The amount of time a message received at an endpoint is considered valid

uriParameter.name: eventHeaderName
uriParameter.description: Setting for a String based event Id. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: extensionHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing user/application specific details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ExtensionHeader

uriParameter.name: expiresHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message expiration details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ExpiresHeader

uriParameter.name: maxMessageSize
uriParameter.description: Setting for maximum allowed Message size in bytes.

uriParameter.name: useRouterForAllUris
uriParameter.description: This setting is used when requests are sent to the Presence Agent via a proxy.

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.description: Setting for contentType can be set to any valid MimeType.

uriParameter.name: toHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message receiver settings. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ToHeader

uriParameter.name: consumer
uriParameter.description: This setting is used to determine whether the kind of header (FromHeaderToHeader etc) that needs to be created for this endpoint

uriParameter.name: contactHeader
uriParameter.description: An optional custom Header object containing verbose contact details (email phone number etc). Must implement the type javax.sip.header.ContactHeader

uriParameter.name: implementationDebugLogFile
uriParameter.description: Name of client debug log file to use for logging

uriParameter.name: eventId
uriParameter.description: Setting for a String based event Id. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: automaticDialogSupport
uriParameter.description: Setting to specify whether every communication should be associated with a dialog.

uriParameter.name: maxForwards
uriParameter.description: Number of maximum proxy forwards

uriParameter.name: maxForwardsHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing details on maximum proxy forwards. This header places a limit on the viaHeaders possible. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.MaxForwardsHeader

uriParameter.name: cacheConnections
uriParameter.description: Should connections be cached by the SipStack to reduce cost of connection creation. This is useful if the connection is used for long running conversations.

uriParameter.name: sipFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom SipFactory to create the SipStack to be used

uriParameter.name: fromHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing message originator settings. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.FromHeader

uriParameter.name: toPort
uriParameter.description: Portname of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based ToHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: transport
uriParameter.description: Setting for choice of transport protocol. Valid choices are tcp or udp.

uriParameter.name: contentSubType
uriParameter.description: Setting for contentSubType can be set to any valid MimeSubType.

uriParameter.name: uri
uriParameter.description: URI of the SIP server to connect to (the username and password can be included such as: john:secretmyserver:9999)

uriParameter.name: headerFactory
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFactory

uriParameter.name: sipStack
uriParameter.description: To use a custom SipStack

uriParameter.name: toHost
uriParameter.description: Hostname of the message receiver. Mandatory setting unless a registry based ToHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: implementationTraceLevel
uriParameter.description: Logging level for tracing

uriParameter.name: callIdHeader
uriParameter.description: A custom Header object containing call details. Must implement the type javax.sip.header.CallIdHeader

uriParameter.name: fromHost
uriParameter.description: Hostname of the message originator. Mandatory setting unless a registry based FromHeader is specified

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: POP3S
component.description: To send or receive emails using imap/pop3 or stmp protocols.

componentProperty.name: contentTypeResolver
componentProperty.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: Sets the Mail configuration

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should disconnect after polling. If enabled this forces Camel to connect on each poll.

uriParameter.name: contentTypeResolver
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

uriParameter.name: subject
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: copyTo
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing a mail message it can be copied to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value with a header with the key copyTo allowing you to copy messages to folder names configured at runtime.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The password for login

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: searchTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: Refers to a javax.mail.search.SearchTerm which allows to filter mails based on search criteria such as subject body from sent after a certain date etc.

uriParameter.name: alternativeBodyHeader
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The mail server host name

uriParameter.name: skipFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to skip the message and move on to retrieve the next mail message. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of messages to gather per poll. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid downloading thousands of files when the server starts up. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable this option.

uriParameter.name: from
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The from email address

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

uriParameter.name: postProcessAction
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to an MailBoxPostProcessAction for doing post processing tasks on the mailbox once the normal processing ended.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: sortTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,sort
uriParameter.description: Sorting order for messages. Only natively supported for IMAP. Emulated to some degree when using POP3 or when IMAP server does not have the SORT capability.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: When using idempotent repository then when the mail message has been successfully processed and is committed should the message id be removed from the idempotent repository (default) or be kept in the repository. By default its assumed the message id is unique and has no value to be kept in the repository because the mail message will be marked as seen/moved or deleted to prevent it from being consumed again. And therefore having the message id stored in the idempotent repository has little value. However this option allows to store the message id for whatever reason you may have.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The port number of the mail server

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: dummyTrustManager
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To use a dummy security setting for trusting all certificates. Should only be used for development mode and not production.

uriParameter.name: replyTo
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.

uriParameter.name: mailUidGenerator
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable MailUidGenerator that allows to use custom logic to generate UUID of the mail message.

uriParameter.name: folderName
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The folder to poll.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: debugMode
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: bcc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: session
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource such as a JavaEE container. If this is not specified Camel automatically creates the mail session for you.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters.

uriParameter.name: mapMailMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether Camel should map the received mail message to Camel body/headers. If set to true the body of the mail message is mapped to the body of the Camel IN message and the mail headers are mapped to IN headers. If this option is set to false then the IN message contains a raw javax.mail.Message. You can retrieve this raw message by calling exchange.getIn().getBody(javax.mail.Message.class).

uriParameter.name: delete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Deletes the messages after they have been processed. This is done by setting the DELETED flag on the mail message. If false the SEEN flag is set instead. As of Camel 2.10 you can override this configuration option by setting a header with the key delete to determine if the mail should be deleted or not.

uriParameter.name: handleFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to handle the caused exception by the consumer's error handler. By enable the bridge error handler on the consumer then the Camel routing error handler can handle the exception instead. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: closeFolder
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should close the folder after polling. Setting this option to false and having disconnect=false as well then the consumer keep the folder open between polls.

uriParameter.name: additionalJavaMailProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets additional java mail properties that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: connectionTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: cc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: fetchSize
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to consume during a poll. This can be used to avoid overloading a mail server if a mailbox folder contains a lot of messages. Default value of -1 means no fetch size and all messages will be consumed. Setting the value to 0 is a special corner case where Camel will not consume any messages at all.

uriParameter.name: javaMailSender
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.

uriParameter.name: useInlineAttachments
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepository
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: A pluggable repository org.apache.camel.spi.IdempotentRepository which allows to cluster consuming from the same mailbox and let the repository coordinate whether a mail message is valid for the consumer to process. By default no repository is in use.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: ignoreUnsupportedCharset
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: ignoreUriScheme
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: peek
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Will mark the javax.mail.Message as peeked before processing the mail message. This applies to IMAPMessage messages types only. By using peek the mail will not be eager marked as SEEN on the mail server which allows us to rollback the mail message if there is an error processing in Camel.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: to
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: unseen
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to limit by unseen mails only.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The username for login

component.title: JavaSpace
component.description: Sending and receiving messages through JavaSpace.

uriParameter.name: spaceName
uriParameter.description: Specifies the JavaSpace name.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: transactionTimeout
uriParameter.description: Specifies the transaction timeout in millis. By default there is no timeout.

uriParameter.name: verb
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the verb for getting JavaSpace entries.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: templateId
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If present this option specifies the Spring bean ID of the template to use for reading/taking entries.

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the number of concurrent consumers getting entries from the JavaSpace.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: url
uriParameter.description: The URL to the JavaSpace server

uriParameter.name: transactional
uriParameter.description: If true sending and receiving entries is performed within a transaction.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: textProcessingFactory
uriParameter.description: Text processing to use. autoFormatting: Text is getting sliced by words then max amount of words that fits in the line will be written into pdf document. With this strategy all words that doesn't fit in the line will be moved to the new line. lineTermination: Builds set of classes for line-termination writing strategy. Text getting sliced by line termination symbol and then it will be written regardless it fits in the line or not.

uriParameter.name: pageSize
