component.title: Atmosphere Websocket
component.description: To exchange data with external Websocket clients using Atmosphere.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: httpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

componentProperty.name: servletName
componentProperty.description: Default name of servlet to use. The default name is CamelServlet.

componentProperty.name: httpRegistry
componentProperty.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.servlet.HttpRegistry.

componentProperty.name: httpConfiguration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration.

uriParameter.name: authMethodPriority
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Authentication method for proxy either as Basic Digest or NTLM.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: sendToAll
uriParameter.description: Whether to send to all (broadcast) or send to a single receiver.

uriParameter.name: ignoreResponseBody
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true The http producer won't read response body and cache the input stream

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageBody
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.

uriParameter.name: servletName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Name of the servlet to use

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy port number

uriParameter.name: useStreaming
uriParameter.description: To enable streaming to send data as multiple text fragments.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: copyHeaders
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the HttpProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: eagerCheckContentAvailable
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to eager check whether the HTTP requests has content if the content-length header is 0 or not present. This can be turned on in case HTTP clients do not send streamed data.

uriParameter.name: httpMethodRestrict
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Used to only allow consuming if the HttpMethod matches such as GET/POST/PUT etc. Multiple methods can be specified separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: httpBinding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: matchOnUriPrefix
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether or not the consumer should try to find a target consumer by matching the URI prefix if no exact match is found.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: chunked
uriParameter.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether a Connection Close header must be added to HTTP Request. By default connectionClose is false.

uriParameter.name: okStatusCodeRange
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The status codes which is considered a success response. The values are inclusive. The range must be defined as from-to with the dash included.

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy host name

uriParameter.name: responseBufferSize
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom buffer size on the javax.servlet.ServletResponse.

uriParameter.name: preserveHostHeader
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service

uriParameter.name: disableStreamCache
uriParameter.label: common
uriParameter.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http/http4 producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.

uriParameter.name: servicePath
uriParameter.description: Name of websocket endpoint

uriParameter.name: optionsEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP OPTIONS for this Servlet consumer. By default OPTIONS is turned off.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.

uriParameter.name: traceEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to enable HTTP TRACE for this Servlet consumer. By default TRACE is turned off.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: urlRewrite
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to a custom org.apache.camel.component.http.UrlRewrite which allows you to rewrite urls when you bridge/proxy endpoints. See more details at http://camel.apache.org/urlrewrite.html

componentProperty.name: jAASConfiguration

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: hostName
uriParameter.description: HDFS host to use

uriParameter.name: checkIdleInterval
uriParameter.description: How often (time in millis) in to run the idle checker background task. This option is only in use if the splitter strategy is IDLE.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: pattern

uriParameter.description: The pattern used for scanning the directory

uriParameter.name: compressionType
uriParameter.description: The compression type to use (is default not in use)

uriParameter.description: For the consumer how much to wait (milliseconds) before to start scanning the directory.

uriParameter.name: fileSystemType
uriParameter.description: Set to LOCAL to not use HDFS but local java.io.File instead.

uriParameter.name: scheduler

uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: path
uriParameter.description: The directory path to use

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: valueType
uriParameter.description: The type for the key in case of sequence or map files

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: keyType
uriParameter.description: The type for the key in case of sequence or map files.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: overwrite
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether to overwrite existing files with the same name

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: owner
uriParameter.description: The file owner must match this owner for the consumer to pickup the file. Otherwise the file is skipped.

uriParameter.name: replication
uriParameter.description: The HDFS replication factor

uriParameter.name: connectOnStartup
uriParameter.description: Whether to connect to the HDFS file system on starting the producer/consumer. If false then the connection is created on-demand. Notice that HDFS may take up till 15 minutes to establish a connection as it has hardcoded 45 x 20 sec redelivery. By setting this option to false allows your application to startup and not block for up till 15 minutes.

uriParameter.name: chunkSize
uriParameter.description: When reading a normal file this is split into chunks producing a message per chunk.

uriParameter.name: openedSuffix
uriParameter.description: When a file is opened for reading/writing the file is renamed with this suffix to avoid to read it during the writing phase.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: blockSize
uriParameter.description: The size of the HDFS blocks

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The interval (milliseconds) between the directory scans.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: HDFS port to use

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: splitStrategy
uriParameter.description: In the current version of Hadoop opening a file in append mode is disabled since it's not very reliable. So for the moment it's only possible to create new files. The Camel HDFS endpoint tries to solve this problem in this way: If the split strategy option has been defined the hdfs path will be used as a directory and files will be created using the configured UuidGenerator. Every time a splitting condition is met a new file is created. The splitStrategy option is defined as a string with the following syntax: splitStrategy=ST:valueST:value... where ST can be: BYTES a new file is created and the old is closed when the number of written bytes is more than value MESSAGES a new file is created and the old is closed when the number of written messages is more than value IDLE a new file is created and the old is closed when no writing happened in the last value milliseconds

uriParameter.name: compressionCodec
uriParameter.description: The compression codec to use

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: fileType
uriParameter.description: The file type to use. For more details see Hadoop HDFS documentation about the various files types.

uriParameter.name: append
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Append to existing file. Notice that not all HDFS file systems support the append option.

uriParameter.name: bufferSize
uriParameter.description: The buffer size used by HDFS

uriParameter.name: readSuffix
uriParameter.description: Once the file has been read is renamed with this suffix to avoid to read it again.

uriParameter.description: The policy to use on child workflows when terminating a workflow.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.label: producer,workflow
uriParameter.description: Workflow operation

uriParameter.name: workflowList
uriParameter.label: consumer,workflow
uriParameter.description: The list name to consume workflows from.

component.title: Binding
component.description: The binding component is used for as a of wrapping an Endpoint in a contract with a data format.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: delegateUri
uriParameter.description: Uri of the delegate endpoint.

uriParameter.name: bindingName
uriParameter.description: Name of the binding to lookup in the Camel registry.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Disruptor
component.description: The disruptor component provides asynchronous SEDA behavior using LMAX Disruptor.

componentProperty.name: defaultConcurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: To configure the default number of concurrent consumers

componentProperty.name: defaultWaitStrategy
componentProperty.description: To configure the default value for DisruptorWaitStrategy The default value is Blocking.

componentProperty.name: queueSize
componentProperty.description: To configure the ring buffer size

componentProperty.name: defaultBlockWhenFull
componentProperty.description: To configure the default value for block when full The default value is true.

componentProperty.name: defaultMultipleConsumers
componentProperty.description: To configure the default value for multiple consumers

componentProperty.name: defaultProducerType
componentProperty.description: To configure the default value for DisruptorProducerType The default value is Multi.

componentProperty.name: bufferSize
componentProperty.description: To configure the ring buffer size

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: waitForTaskToComplete
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to specify whether the caller should wait for the async task to complete or not before continuing. The following three options are supported: Always Never or IfReplyExpected. The first two values are self-explanatory. The last value IfReplyExpected will only wait if the message is Request Reply based.

uriParameter.name: blockWhenFull
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether a thread that sends messages to a full Disruptor will block until the ringbuffer's capacity is no longer exhausted. By default the calling thread will block and wait until the message can be accepted. By disabling this option an exception will be thrown stating that the queue is full.

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Number of concurrent threads processing exchanges.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) before a producer will stop waiting for an asynchronous task to complete. You can disable timeout by using 0 or a negative value.

uriParameter.name: waitStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Defines the strategy used by consumer threads to wait on new exchanges to be published. The options allowed are:Blocking Sleeping BusySpin and Yielding.

uriParameter.name: producerType
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Defines the producers allowed on the Disruptor. The options allowed are: Multi to allow multiple producers and Single to enable certain optimizations only allowed when one concurrent producer (on one thread or otherwise synchronized) is active.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: size
uriParameter.description: The maximum capacity of the Disruptors ringbuffer Will be effectively increased to the nearest power of two. Notice: Mind if you use this option then its the first endpoint being created with the queue name that determines the size. To make sure all endpoints use same size then configure the size option on all of them or the first endpoint being created.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name of queue

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: multipleConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether multiple consumers are allowed. If enabled you can use Disruptor for Publish-Subscribe messaging. That is you can send a message to the queue and have each consumer receive a copy of the message. When enabled this option should be specified on every consumer endpoint.

component.title: Jing
component.description: Validates the payload of a message using RelaxNG Syntax using Jing library.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: URL to a local resource on the classpath or a full URL to a remote resource or resource on the file system which contains the schema to validate against.

uriParameter.name: compactSyntax
uriParameter.description: Whether to validate using RelaxNG compact syntax or not. By default this is false for using RelaxNG XML Syntax (rng) And true is for using RelaxNG Compact Syntax (rnc)

component.title: SNMP
component.description: The snmp component gives you the ability to poll SNMP capable devices or receiving traps.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: privacyPassphrase
uriParameter.description: The privacy passphrase. If not null privacyProtocol must also be not null. RFC3414 11.2 requires passphrases to have a minimum length of 8 bytes. If the length of authenticationPassphrase is less than 8 bytes an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

uriParameter.name: securityName
uriParameter.description: Sets the security name to be used with this target.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: authenticationPassphrase
uriParameter.description: The authentication passphrase. If not null authenticationProtocol must also be not null. RFC3414 11.2 requires passphrases to have a minimum length of 8 bytes. If the length of authenticationPassphrase is less than 8 bytes an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: type
uriParameter.description: Which operation to perform such as poll trap etc.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: Sets the timeout value for the request in millis.

uriParameter.name: securityLevel
uriParameter.description: Sets the security level for this target. The supplied security level must be supported by the security model dependent information associated with the security name set for this target. The value 1 means: No authentication and no encryption. Anyone can create and read messages with this security level The value 2 means: Authentication and no encryption. Only the one with the right authentication key can create messages with this security level but anyone can read the contents of the message. The value 3 means: Authentication and encryption. Only the one with the right authentication key can create messages with this security level and only the one with the right encryption/decryption key can read the contents of the message.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: protocol
uriParameter.description: Here you can select which protocol to use. You can use either udp or tcp.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: Hostname of the SNMP enabled device

uriParameter.name: snmpContextName
uriParameter.description: Sets the context name field of this scoped PDU.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: oids
uriParameter.description: Defines which values you are interested in. Please have a look at the Wikipedia to get a better understanding. You may provide a single OID or a coma separated list of OIDs. Example: oids=1.3.6.1.2.1.1.3.01.3.6.1.2.1.25.3.2.1.5.11.3.6.1.2.1.25.3.5.1.1.11.3.6.1.2.1.43.5.1.1.11.1

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: snmpCommunity
uriParameter.description: Sets the community octet string for the snmp request.

uriParameter.name: snmpVersion
uriParameter.description: Sets the snmp version for the request. The value 0 means SNMPv1 1 means SNMPv2c and the value 3 means SNMPv3

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: snmpContextEngineId
uriParameter.description: Sets the context engine ID field of the scoped PDU.

uriParameter.name: authenticationProtocol
uriParameter.description: Authentication protocol to use if security level is set to enable authentication The possible values are: MD5 SHA1

uriParameter.name: privacyProtocol
uriParameter.description: The privacy protocol ID to be associated with this user. If set to null this user only supports unencrypted messages.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: retries
uriParameter.description: Defines how often a retry is made before canceling the request.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets update rate in seconds

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Port number of the SNMP enabled device

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Twitter
component.description: This component integrates with Twitter to send tweets or search for tweets and more.

componentProperty.name: consumerSecret

componentProperty.name: httpProxyHost
componentProperty.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter.

componentProperty.name: httpProxyPort
componentProperty.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter.

componentProperty.name: accessToken
componentProperty.description: The access token

componentProperty.name: consumerKey
componentProperty.description: The consumer key

componentProperty.name: accessTokenSecret
componentProperty.description: The access token secret

componentProperty.name: httpProxyUser
componentProperty.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter.

componentProperty.name: httpProxyPassword
componentProperty.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: keywords
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: Can be used for search and streaming/filter. Multiple values can be separated with comma.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: latitude
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by latitude. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

uriParameter.name: httpProxyHost
uriParameter.label: proxy
uriParameter.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: type
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Endpoint type to use. Only streaming supports event type.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: consumerSecret
uriParameter.description: The consumer secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: numberOfPages
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: The number of pages result which you want camel-twitter to consume.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: userIds
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: To filter by user ids for streaming/filter. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: distanceMetric
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by radius using the configured metrics. The unit can either be mi for miles or km for kilometers. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

uriParameter.name: consumerKey
uriParameter.description: The consumer key. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: radius
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by radius. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: lang
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: The lang string ISO_639-1 which will be used for searching

uriParameter.name: longitude
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by longitude. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: sinceId
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: The last tweet id which will be used for pulling the tweets. It is useful when the camel route is restarted after a long running.

uriParameter.name: kind
uriParameter.description: What polling mode to use direct polling or event based. The event mode is only supported when the endpoint kind is event based.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: count
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: Limiting number of results per page.

uriParameter.name: httpProxyPort
uriParameter.label: proxy
uriParameter.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: accessToken
uriParameter.description: The access token. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: accessTokenSecret
uriParameter.description: The access secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: httpProxyPassword
uriParameter.label: proxy
uriParameter.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

uriParameter.name: twitterStream
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom instance of TwitterStream

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: filterOld
uriParameter.label: filter
uriParameter.description: Filter out old tweets that has previously been polled. This state is stored in memory only and based on last tweet id.

uriParameter.name: locations
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Bounding boxes created by pairs of lat/lons. Can be used for streaming/filter. A pair is defined as latlon. And multiple paris can be separated by semi colon.

uriParameter.name: user
uriParameter.description: Username used for user timeline consumption direct message production etc.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: httpProxyUser
uriParameter.label: proxy
uriParameter.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

component.title: Elasticsearch
component.description: The elasticsearch component is used for interfacing with ElasticSearch server.

componentProperty.name: client
componentProperty.description: To use an existing configured Elasticsearch client instead of creating a client per endpoint.

uriParameter.name: transportAddresses
uriParameter.description: Comma separated list with ip:port formatted remote transport addresses to use. The ip and port options must be left blank for transportAddresses to be considered instead.

uriParameter.name: data
uriParameter.description: Is the node going to be allowed to allocate data (shards) to it or not. This setting map to the node.data setting.

uriParameter.name: indexName
uriParameter.description: The name of the index to act against

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: ip
uriParameter.description: The TransportClient remote host ip to use

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: pathHome
uriParameter.description: The path.home property of ElasticSearch configuration. You need to provide a valid path otherwise the default $user.home/.elasticsearch will be used.

uriParameter.name: indexType
uriParameter.description: The type of the index to act against

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The TransportClient remote port to use (defaults to 9300)

uriParameter.name: clusterName
uriParameter.description: Name of cluster or use local for local mode

uriParameter.name: consistencyLevel
uriParameter.description: The write consistency level to use with INDEX and BULK operations (can be any of ONE QUORUM ALL or DEFAULT)

uriParameter.name: clientTransportSniff
uriParameter.description: Is the client allowed to sniff the rest of the cluster or not (default true). This setting map to the client.transport.sniff setting.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.description: What operation to perform

component.title: MQTT
component.description: Component for communicating with MQTT M2M message brokers using FuseSource MQTT Client.

componentProperty.name: password
componentProperty.description: Password to be used for authentication against the MQTT broker

componentProperty.name: host
componentProperty.description: The URI of the MQTT broker to connect too - this component also supports SSL - e.g. ssl://127.0.0.1:8883

componentProperty.name: userName
componentProperty.description: Username to be used for authentication against the MQTT broker

uriParameter.name: publishTopicName
uriParameter.description: The default Topic to publish messages on

uriParameter.name: connectWaitInSeconds
uriParameter.description: Delay in seconds the Component will wait for a connection to be established to the MQTT broker

uriParameter.name: mqttQosPropertyName
uriParameter.description: The property name to look for on an Exchange for an individual published message. If this is set (one of AtMostOnce AtLeastOnce or ExactlyOnce ) - then that QoS will be set on the message sent to the MQTT message broker.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: reconnectAttemptsMax
uriParameter.description: The maximum number of reconnect attempts before an error is reported back to the client after a server connection had previously been established. Set to -1 to use unlimited attempts. Defaults to -1.

uriParameter.name: maxWriteRate
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum bytes per second that this transport will send data at. This setting throttles writes so that the rate is not exceeded. Defaults to 0 which disables throttling.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: connectAttemptsMax
uriParameter.description: The maximum number of reconnect attempts before an error is reported back to the client on the first attempt by the client to connect to a server. Set to -1 to use unlimited attempts. Defaults to -1.

uriParameter.name: willTopic
uriParameter.description: If set the server will publish the client's Will message to the specified topics if the client has an unexpected disconnection.

uriParameter.name: mqttRetainPropertyName
uriParameter.description: The property name to look for on an Exchange for an individual published message. If this is set (expects a Boolean value) - then the retain property will be set on the message sent to the MQTT message broker.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The URI of the MQTT broker to connect too - this component also supports SSL - e.g. ssl://127.0.0.1:8883

uriParameter.name: subscribeTopicName
uriParameter.description: These are set on the Endpoint - together with properties inherited from MQTT

uriParameter.name: trafficClass
uriParameter.description: Sets traffic class or type-of-service octet in the IP header for packets sent from the transport. Defaults to 8 which means the traffic should be optimized for throughput.

uriParameter.name: qualityOfService
uriParameter.description: Quality of service level to use for topics.

uriParameter.name: clientId
uriParameter.description: Use to set the client Id of the session. This is what an MQTT server uses to identify a session where setCleanSession(false); is being used. The id must be 23 characters or less. Defaults to auto generated id (based on your socket address port and timestamp).

uriParameter.name: keepAlive
uriParameter.description: Configures the Keep Alive timer in seconds. Defines the maximum time interval between messages received from a client. It enables the server to detect that the network connection to a client has dropped without having to wait for the long TCP/IP timeout.

uriParameter.name: reconnectDelayMax
uriParameter.description: The maximum amount of time in ms to wait between reconnect attempts. Defaults to 30000.

uriParameter.name: sendWaitInSeconds
uriParameter.description: The maximum time the Component will wait for a receipt from the MQTT broker to acknowledge a published message before throwing an exception

uriParameter.name: disconnectWaitInSeconds
uriParameter.description: The number of seconds the Component will wait for a valid disconnect on stop() from the MQTT broker

uriParameter.name: sendBufferSize
uriParameter.description: Sets the size of the internal socket send buffer. Defaults to 65536 (64k)

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sslContext
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContext configuration

uriParameter.name: blockingExecutor
uriParameter.description: SSL connections perform blocking operations against internal thread pool unless you call the setBlockingExecutor method to configure that executor they will use instead.

uriParameter.name: reconnectDelay
uriParameter.description: How long to wait in ms before the first reconnect attempt. Defaults to 10.

uriParameter.name: cleanSession
uriParameter.description: Set to false if you want the MQTT server to persist topic subscriptions and ack positions across client sessions. Defaults to true.

uriParameter.name: version
uriParameter.description: Set to 3.1.1 to use MQTT version 3.1.1. Otherwise defaults to the 3.1 protocol version.

uriParameter.name: willRetain
uriParameter.description: Set to true if you want the Will to be published with the retain option.

uriParameter.name: maxReadRate
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum bytes per second that this transport will receive data at. This setting throttles reads so that the rate is not exceeded. Defaults to 0 which disables throttling.

uriParameter.name: receiveBufferSize
uriParameter.description: Sets the size of the internal socket receive buffer. Defaults to 65536 (64k)

uriParameter.name: willQos
uriParameter.description: Sets the quality of service to use for the Will message. Defaults to AT_MOST_ONCE.

uriParameter.name: localAddress
uriParameter.description: The local InetAddress and port to use

uriParameter.name: mqttTopicPropertyName
uriParameter.description: These a properties that are looked for in an Exchange - to publish to

uriParameter.name: reconnectBackOffMultiplier
uriParameter.description: The Exponential backoff be used between reconnect attempts. Set to 1 to disable exponential backoff. Defaults to 2.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: A logical name to use which is not the topic name.

uriParameter.name: subscribeTopicNames
uriParameter.description: A comma-delimited list of Topics to subscribe to for messages. Note that each item of this list can contain MQTT wildcards ( and/or ) in order to subscribe to topics matching a certain pattern within a hierarchy. For example is a wildcard for all topics at a level within the hierarchy so if a broker has topics topics/one and topics/two then topics/ can be used to subscribe to both. A caveat to consider here is that if the broker adds topics/three the route would also begin to receive messages from that topic.

uriParameter.name: byDefaultRetain
uriParameter.description: The default retain policy to be used on messages sent to the MQTT broker

uriParameter.name: willMessage
uriParameter.description: The Will message to send. Defaults to a zero length message.

uriParameter.name: dispatchQueue
uriParameter.description: A HawtDispatch dispatch queue is used to synchronize access to the connection. If an explicit queue is not configured via the setDispatchQueue method then a new queue will be created for the connection. Setting an explicit queue might be handy if you want multiple connection to share the same queue for synchronization.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Slack
component.description: The slack component allows you to send messages to Slack.

componentProperty.name: webhookUrl
componentProperty.description: The incoming webhook URL

uriParameter.name: iconEmoji
uriParameter.description: Use a Slack emoji as an avatar

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: channel
uriParameter.description: The channel name (syntax name) or slackuser (syntax userName) to send a message directly to an user.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: iconUrl
uriParameter.description: The avatar that the component will use when sending message to a channel or user.

uriParameter.name: webhookUrl
uriParameter.description: The incoming webhook URL

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.description: This is the username that the bot will have when sending messages to a channel or user.

component.title: Camel Context
component.description: The context component allows to send/receive messages between Camel routes in a black box way.

uriParameter.name: localEndpointUrl
uriParameter.description: Can be a valid Camel URI evaluated within the black box CamelContext. Or it can be a logical name which is mapped to any local endpoints. For example if you locally have endpoints like direct:invoices and seda:purchaseOrders inside a CamelContext of id supplyChain then you can just use the URIs supplyChain:invoices or supplyChain:purchaseOrders to omit the physical endpoint kind and use pure logical URIs.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: contextId
uriParameter.description: Is the ID you used to register the CamelContext into the Registry.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Weather
component.description: Polls the weather information from Open Weather Map.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: lon
uriParameter.description: Longitude of location. You can use lat and lon options instead of location.

uriParameter.name: units
uriParameter.description: The units for temperature measurement.

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: mode
uriParameter.description: The output format of the weather data.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: lat
uriParameter.description: Latitude of location. You can use lat and lon options instead of location.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: period
uriParameter.description: If null the current weather will be returned else use values of 5 7 14 days. Only the numeric value for the forecast period is actually parsed so spelling capitalisation of the time period is up to you (its ignored)

uriParameter.name: headerName
uriParameter.description: To store the weather result in this header instead of the message body. This is useable if you want to keep current message body as-is.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: appid
uriParameter.description: APPID ID used to authenticate the user connected to the API Server

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: The name value is not used.

uriParameter.name: location
uriParameter.description: If null Camel will try and determine your current location using the geolocation of your ip address else specify the citycountry. For well known city names Open Weather Map will determine the best fit but multiple results may be returned. Hence specifying and country as well will return more accurate data. If you specify current as the location then the component will try to get the current latitude and longitude and use that to get the weather details. You can use lat and lon options instead of location.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: HTTPS
component.description: For calling out to external HTTP servers using Apache HTTP Client 3.x.

componentProperty.name: httpClientConfigurer
componentProperty.description: To use the custom HttpClientConfigurer to perform configuration of the HttpClient that will be used.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: httpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

componentProperty.name: httpConnectionManager
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpConnectionManager to manage connections

componentProperty.name: httpConfiguration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration.

uriParameter.name: authMethodPriority
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Authentication method for proxy either as Basic Digest or NTLM.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: ignoreResponseBody
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true The http producer won't read response body and cache the input stream

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageBody
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy port number

uriParameter.name: httpUri
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The url of the HTTP endpoint to call.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: copyHeaders
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).

uriParameter.name: httpConnectionManagerOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the HttpConnectionManager using the key/values from the Map.

uriParameter.name: httpConnectionManager
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpConnectionManager to manage connections

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the HttpProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: httpBinding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: chunked
uriParameter.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

uriParameter.name: httpClientOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the HttpClient using the key/values from the Map.

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether a Connection Close header must be added to HTTP Request. By default connectionClose is false.

uriParameter.name: okStatusCodeRange
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The status codes which is considered a success response. The values are inclusive. The range must be defined as from-to with the dash included.

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy host name

uriParameter.name: preserveHostHeader
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service

uriParameter.name: httpClientConfigurer
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Register a custom configuration strategy for new HttpClient instances created by producers or consumers such as to configure authentication mechanisms etc

uriParameter.name: disableStreamCache
uriParameter.label: common
uriParameter.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http/http4 producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.

uriParameter.name: urlRewrite
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to a custom org.apache.camel.component.http.UrlRewrite which allows you to rewrite urls when you bridge/proxy endpoints. See more details at http://camel.apache.org/urlrewrite.html

component.title: AHC
component.description: To call external HTTP services using Async Http Client.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.util.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

componentProperty.name: client
componentProperty.description: To use a custom AsyncHttpClient

componentProperty.name: binding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

componentProperty.name: clientConfig
componentProperty.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

uriParameter.name: clientConfigOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClientConfig using the key/values from the Map.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the AhcOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: Reference to a org.apache.camel.util.jsse.SSLContextParameters in the Registry. This reference overrides any configured SSLContextParameters at the component level. See Using the JSSE Configuration Utility. Note that configuring this option will override any SSL/TLS configuration options provided through the clientConfig option at the endpoint or component level.

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom AhcBinding which allows to control how to bind between AHC and Camel.

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Define if the Connection Close header has to be added to HTTP Request. This parameter is false by default

uriParameter.name: clientConfig
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To configure the AsyncHttpClient to use a custom com.ning.http.client.AsyncHttpClientConfig instance.

uriParameter.name: httpUri
uriParameter.description: The URI to use such as http://hostname:port/path

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type (for example using Jetty or Servlet Camel components). On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the AhcOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.description: If the option is true then the Exchange.HTTP_URI header is ignored and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the AhcProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: bufferSize
uriParameter.description: The initial in-memory buffer size used when transferring data between Camel and AHC Client.
