componentProperty.description: To use the given Guava EventBus instance

componentProperty.name: listenerInterface
componentProperty.description: The interface with method(s) marked with the Subscribe annotation. Dynamic proxy will be created over the interface so it could be registered as the EventBus listener. Particularly useful when creating multi-event listeners and for handling DeadEvent properly. This option cannot be used together with eventClass option.

uriParameter.name: eventBusRef
uriParameter.description: To lookup the Guava EventBus from the registry with the given name

uriParameter.name: eventClass
uriParameter.description: If used on the consumer side of the route will filter events received from the EventBus to the instances of the class and superclasses of eventClass. Null value of this option is equal to setting it to the java.lang.Object i.e. the consumer will capture all messages incoming to the event bus. This option cannot be used together with listenerInterface option.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: listenerInterface
uriParameter.description: The interface with method(s) marked with the Subscribe annotation. Dynamic proxy will be created over the interface so it could be registered as the EventBus listener. Particularly useful when creating multi-event listeners and for handling DeadEvent properly. This option cannot be used together with eventClass option.

component.title: ServiceNow
component.description: Represents a ServiceNow endpoint.

uriParameter.name: models
uriParameter.description: Defines the default model to use for a table

uriParameter.name: oauthClientId
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: OAuth2 ClientID

uriParameter.name: oauthTokenUrl
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: OAuth token Url

uriParameter.name: instanceName
uriParameter.description: The ServiceNow instance name

uriParameter.name: resource
uriParameter.description: The default resource can be overridden by header CamelServiceNowResource

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: inputDisplayValue
uriParameter.description: True to set raw value of input fields (default: false)

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: oauthClientSecret
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: OAuth2 ClientSecret

uriParameter.name: mapper
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets Jackson's ObjectMapper to use for request/reply

uriParameter.name: userName
uriParameter.description: ServiceNow user account name MUST be provided

uriParameter.name: displayValue
uriParameter.description: Return the display value (true) actual value (false) or both (all) for reference fields (default: false)

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: ServiceNow account password MUST be provided

uriParameter.name: apiUrl
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The ServiceNow REST API url

uriParameter.name: excludeReferenceLink
uriParameter.description: True to exclude Table API links for reference fields (default: false)

uriParameter.name: suppressAutoSysField
uriParameter.description: True to suppress auto generation of system fields (default: false)

uriParameter.name: table
uriParameter.description: The default table can be overridden by header CamelServiceNowTable

component.title: Kafka
component.description: The kafka component allows messages to be sent to (or consumed from) Apache Kafka brokers.

componentProperty.name: workerPool
componentProperty.description: To use a shared custom worker pool for continue routing Exchange after kafka server has acknowledge the message that was sent to it from KafkaProducer using asynchronous non-blocking processing. If using this option then you must handle the lifecycle of the thread pool to shut the pool down when no longer needed.

uriParameter.name: consumerRequestTimeoutMs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The configuration controls the maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request. If the response is not received before the timeout elapses the client will resend the request if necessary or fail the request if retries are exhausted.

uriParameter.name: kerberosInitCmd
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Kerberos kinit command path. Default is /usr/bin/kinit

uriParameter.name: workerPoolMaxSize
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Maximum number of threads for the worker pool for continue routing Exchange after kafka server has acknowledge the message that was sent to it from KafkaProducer using asynchronous non-blocking processing.

uriParameter.name: reconnectBackoffMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The amount of time to wait before attempting to reconnect to a given host. This avoids repeatedly connecting to a host in a tight loop. This backoff applies to all requests sent by the consumer to the broker.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: groupId
uriParameter.description: A string that uniquely identifies the group of consumer processes to which this consumer belongs. By setting the same group id multiple processes indicate that they are all part of the same consumer group.

uriParameter.name: queueBufferingMaxMessages
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The maximum number of unsent messages that can be queued up the producer when using async mode before either the producer must be blocked or data must be dropped.

uriParameter.name: kerberosRenewJitter
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Percentage of random jitter added to the renewal time.

uriParameter.name: consumersCount
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The number of consumers that connect to kafka server

uriParameter.name: sslProvider
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. Default value is the default security provider of the JVM.

uriParameter.name: receiveBufferBytes
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The size of the TCP receive buffer (SO_RCVBUF) to use when reading data.

uriParameter.name: barrierAwaitTimeoutMs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the BatchingConsumerTask processes exchange exceed the batchSize it will wait for barrierAwaitTimeoutMs.

uriParameter.name: serializerClass
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The serializer class for messages. The default encoder takes a byte and returns the same byte. The default class is kafka.serializer.DefaultEncoder

uriParameter.name: valueDeserializer
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Deserializer class for value that implements the Deserializer interface.

uriParameter.name: saslKerberosServiceName
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as. This can be defined either in Kafka's JAAS config or in Kafka's config.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: metricReporters
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: A list of classes to use as metrics reporters. Implementing the MetricReporter interface allows plugging in classes that will be notified of new metric creation. The JmxReporter is always included to register JMX statistics.

uriParameter.name: sslTruststoreType
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The file format of the trust store file. Default value is JKS.

uriParameter.name: sendBufferBytes
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Socket write buffer size

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.description: If the option is true then KafkaProducer will ignore the KafkaConstants.TOPIC header setting of the inbound message.

uriParameter.name: heartbeatIntervalMs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The expected time between heartbeats to the consumer coordinator when using Kafka's group management facilities. Heartbeats are used to ensure that the consumer's session stays active and to facilitate rebalancing when new consumers join or leave the group. The value must be set lower than session.timeout.ms but typically should be set no higher than 1/3 of that value. It can be adjusted even lower to control the expected time for normal rebalances.

uriParameter.name: consumerStreams
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Number of concurrent consumers on the consumer

uriParameter.name: consumerId
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Generated automatically if not set.

uriParameter.name: sslKeystoreType
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The file format of the key store file. This is optional for client. Default value is JKS

uriParameter.name: keySerializerClass
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The serializer class for keys (defaults to the same as for messages if nothing is given).

uriParameter.name: requestRequiredAcks
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The number of acknowledgments the producer requires the leader to have received before considering a request complete. This controls the durability of records that are sent. The following settings are common: acks=0 If set to zero then the producer will not wait for any acknowledgment from the server at all. The record will be immediately added to the socket buffer and considered sent. No guarantee can be made that the server has received the record in this case and the retries configuration will not take effect (as the client won't generally know of any failures). The offset given back for each record will always be set to -1. acks=1 This will mean the leader will write the record to its local log but will respond without awaiting full acknowledgement from all followers. In this case should the leader fail immediately after acknowledging the record but before the followers have replicated it then the record will be lost. acks=all This means the leader will wait for the full set of in-sync replicas to acknowledge the record. This guarantees that the record will not be lost as long as at least one in-sync replica remains alive. This is the strongest available guarantee.

uriParameter.name: workerPool
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom worker pool for continue routing Exchange after kafka server has acknowledge the message that was sent to it from KafkaProducer using asynchronous non-blocking processing.

uriParameter.name: fetchWaitMaxMs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The maximum amount of time the server will block before answering the fetch request if there isn't sufficient data to immediately satisfy fetch.min.bytes

uriParameter.name: retries
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Setting a value greater than zero will cause the client to resend any record whose send fails with a potentially transient error. Note that this retry is no different than if the client resent the record upon receiving the error. Allowing retries will potentially change the ordering of records because if two records are sent to a single partition and the first fails and is retried but the second succeeds then the second record may appear first.

uriParameter.name: sslKeystorePassword
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The store password for the key store file.This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.

uriParameter.name: sslEndpointAlgorithm
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate server hostname using server certificate.

uriParameter.name: topic
uriParameter.description: Name of the topic to use.

uriParameter.name: sslProtocol
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. Default setting is TLS which is fine for most cases. Allowed values in recent JVMs are TLS TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. SSL SSLv2 and SSLv3 may be supported in older JVMs but their usage is discouraged due to known security vulnerabilities.

uriParameter.name: keyDeserializer
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Deserializer class for key that implements the Deserializer interface.

uriParameter.name: sslKeymanagerAlgorithm
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The algorithm used by key manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: maxBlockMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The configuration controls how long sending to kafka will block. These methods can be blocked for multiple reasons. For e.g: buffer full metadata unavailable.This configuration imposes maximum limit on the total time spent in fetching metadata serialization of key and value partitioning and allocation of buffer memory when doing a send(). In case of partitionsFor() this configuration imposes a maximum time threshold on waiting for metadata

uriParameter.name: kerberosBeforeReloginMinTime
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Login thread sleep time between refresh attempts.

uriParameter.name: bufferMemorySize
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The total bytes of memory the producer can use to buffer records waiting to be sent to the server. If records are sent faster than they can be delivered to the server the producer will either block or throw an exception based on the preference specified by block.on.buffer.full.This setting should correspond roughly to the total memory the producer will use but is not a hard bound since not all memory the producer uses is used for buffering. Some additional memory will be used for compression (if compression is enabled) as well as for maintaining in-flight requests.

uriParameter.name: producerBatchSize
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The producer will attempt to batch records together into fewer requests whenever multiple records are being sent to the same partition. This helps performance on both the client and the server. This configuration controls the default batch size in bytes. No attempt will be made to batch records larger than this size.Requests sent to brokers will contain multiple batches one for each partition with data available to be sent.A small batch size will make batching less common and may reduce throughput (a batch size of zero will disable batching entirely). A very large batch size may use memory a bit more wastefully as we will always allocate a buffer of the specified batch size in anticipation of additional records.

uriParameter.name: retryBackoffMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Before each retry the producer refreshes the metadata of relevant topics to see if a new leader has been elected. Since leader election takes a bit of time this property specifies the amount of time that the producer waits before refreshing the metadata.

uriParameter.name: brokers
uriParameter.description: This is for bootstrapping and the producer will only use it for getting metadata (topics partitions and replicas). The socket connections for sending the actual data will be established based on the broker information returned in the metadata. The format is host1:port1host2:port2 and the list can be a subset of brokers or a VIP pointing to a subset of brokers. This option is known as metadata.broker.list in the Kafka documentation.

uriParameter.name: metadataMaxAgeMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The period of time in milliseconds after which we force a refresh of metadata even if we haven't seen any partition leadership changes to proactively discover any new brokers or partitions.

uriParameter.name: sslCipherSuites
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: A list of cipher suites. This is a named combination of authentication encryption MAC and key exchange algorithm used to negotiate the security settings for a network connection using TLS or SSL network protocol.By default all the available cipher suites are supported.

uriParameter.name: metricsSampleWindowMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

uriParameter.name: fetchMinBytes
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The minimum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request. If insufficient data is available the request will wait for that much data to accumulate before answering the request.

uriParameter.name: sslKeyPassword
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The password of the private key in the key store file. This is optional for client.

uriParameter.name: noOfMetricsSample
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

uriParameter.name: connectionMaxIdleMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Close idle connections after the number of milliseconds specified by this config.

uriParameter.name: maxPartitionFetchBytes
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The maximum amount of data per-partition the server will return. The maximum total memory used for a request will be partitions max.partition.fetch.bytes. This size must be at least as large as the maximum message size the server allows or else it is possible for the producer to send messages larger than the consumer can fetch. If that happens the consumer can get stuck trying to fetch a large message on a certain partition.

uriParameter.name: kerberosRenewWindowFactor
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Login thread will sleep until the specified window factor of time from last refresh to ticket's expiry has been reached at which time it will try to renew the ticket.

uriParameter.name: lingerMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The producer groups together any records that arrive in between request transmissions into a single batched request. Normally this occurs only under load when records arrive faster than they can be sent out. However in some circumstances the client may want to reduce the number of requests even under moderate load. This setting accomplishes this by adding a small amount of artificial delaythat is rather than immediately sending out a record the producer will wait for up to the given delay to allow other records to be sent so that the sends can be batched together. This can be thought of as analogous to Nagle's algorithm in TCP. This setting gives the upper bound on the delay for batching: once we get batch.size worth of records for a partition it will be sent immediately regardless of this setting however if we have fewer than this many bytes accumulated for this partition we will 'linger' for the specified time waiting for more records to show up. This setting defaults to 0 (i.e. no delay). Setting linger.ms=5 for example would have the effect of reducing the number of requests sent but would add up to 5ms of latency to records sent in the absense of load.

uriParameter.name: securityProtocol
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. Currently only PLAINTEXT and SSL are supported.

uriParameter.name: autoCommitIntervalMs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The frequency in ms that the consumer offsets are committed to zookeeper.

uriParameter.name: sslTruststorePassword
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The password for the trust store file.

uriParameter.name: partitioner
uriParameter.description: The partitioner class for partitioning messages amongst sub-topics. The default partitioner is based on the hash of the key.

uriParameter.name: sslEnabledProtocols
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. TLSv1.2 TLSv1.1 and TLSv1 are enabled by default.

uriParameter.name: sessionTimeoutMs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The timeout used to detect failures when using Kafka's group management facilities.

uriParameter.name: sslKeystoreLocation
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.

uriParameter.name: sslTruststoreLocation
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The location of the trust store file.

uriParameter.name: maxInFlightRequest
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests the client will send on a single connection before blocking. Note that if this setting is set to be greater than 1 and there are failed sends there is a risk of message re-ordering due to retries (i.e. if retries are enabled).

uriParameter.name: clientId
uriParameter.description: The client id is a user-specified string sent in each request to help trace calls. It should logically identify the application making the request.

uriParameter.name: maxRequestSize
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The maximum size of a request. This is also effectively a cap on the maximum record size. Note that the server has its own cap on record size which may be different from this. This setting will limit the number of record batches the producer will send in a single request to avoid sending huge requests.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sslTrustmanagerAlgorithm
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The algorithm used by trust manager factory for SSL connections. Default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.

uriParameter.name: autoOffsetReset
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: What to do when there is no initial offset in ZooKeeper or if an offset is out of range: smallest : automatically reset the offset to the smallest offset largest : automatically reset the offset to the largest offset fail: throw exception to the consumer

uriParameter.name: requestTimeoutMs
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The amount of time the broker will wait trying to meet the request.required.acks requirement before sending back an error to the client.

uriParameter.name: compressionCodec
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: This parameter allows you to specify the compression codec for all data generated by this producer. Valid values are none gzip and snappy.

uriParameter.name: workerPoolCoreSize
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Number of core threads for the worker pool for continue routing Exchange after kafka server has acknowledge the message that was sent to it from KafkaProducer using asynchronous non-blocking processing.

uriParameter.name: batchSize
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The batchSize that the BatchingConsumerTask processes once.

uriParameter.name: autoCommitEnable
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If true periodically commit to ZooKeeper the offset of messages already fetched by the consumer. This committed offset will be used when the process fails as the position from which the new consumer will begin.

uriParameter.name: checkCrcs
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Automatically check the CRC32 of the records consumed. This ensures no on-the-wire or on-disk corruption to the messages occurred. This check adds some overhead so it may be disabled in cases seeking extreme performance.

uriParameter.name: partitionAssignor
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The class name of the partition assignment strategy that the client will use to distribute partition ownership amongst consumer instances when group management is used

component.title: CXF-RS
component.description: The cxfrs component is used for JAX-RS REST services using Apache CXF.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: bindingStyle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets how requests and responses will be mapped to/from Camel. Two values are possible: SimpleConsumer: This binding style processes request parameters multiparts etc. and maps them to IN headers IN attachments and to the message body. It aims to eliminate low-level processing of org.apache.cxf.message.MessageContentsList. It also also adds more flexibility and simplicity to the response mapping. Only available for consumers. Default: The default style. For consumers this passes on a MessageContentsList to the route requiring low-level processing in the route. This is the traditional binding style which simply dumps the org.apache.cxf.message.MessageContentsList coming in from the CXF stack onto the IN message body. The user is then responsible for processing it according to the contract defined by the JAX-RS method signature. Custom: allows you to specify a custom binding through the binding option.

uriParameter.name: bus
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom configured CXF Bus.

uriParameter.name: resourceClasses
uriParameter.description: The resource classes which you want to export as REST service. Multiple classes can be separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: httpClientAPI
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If it is true the CxfRsProducer will use the HttpClientAPI to invoke the service. If it is false the CxfRsProducer will use the ProxyClientAPI to invoke the service

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom CxfBinding to control the binding between Camel Message and CXF Message.

uriParameter.name: schemaLocations
uriParameter.description: Sets the locations of the schema(s) which can be used to validate the incoming XML or JAXB-driven JSON.

uriParameter.name: defaultBus
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Will set the default bus when CXF endpoint create a bus by itself

uriParameter.name: features
uriParameter.description: Set the feature list to the CxfRs endpoint.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: loggingSizeLimit
uriParameter.description: To limit the total size of number of bytes the logger will output when logging feature has been enabled.

uriParameter.name: beanId
uriParameter.description: To lookup an existing configured CxfRsEndpoint. Must used bean: as prefix.

uriParameter.name: ignoreDeleteMethodMessageBody
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: This option is used to tell CxfRsProducer to ignore the message body of the DELETE method when using HTTP API.

uriParameter.name: performInvocation
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: When the option is true Camel will perform the invocation of the resource class instance and put the response object into the exchange for further processing.

uriParameter.name: address
uriParameter.description: The service publish address.

uriParameter.name: skipFaultLogging
uriParameter.description: This option controls whether the PhaseInterceptorChain skips logging the Fault that it catches.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: This option tells the CxfRsProducer to inspect return codes and will generate an Exception if the return code is larger than 207.

uriParameter.name: propagateContexts
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: When the option is true JAXRS UriInfo HttpHeaders Request and SecurityContext contexts will be available to custom CXFRS processors as typed Camel exchange properties. These contexts can be used to analyze the current requests using JAX-RS API.

uriParameter.name: continuationTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: This option is used to set the CXF continuation timeout which could be used in CxfConsumer by default when the CXF server is using Jetty or Servlet transport.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: loggingFeatureEnabled
uriParameter.description: This option enables CXF Logging Feature which writes inbound and outbound REST messages to log.

uriParameter.name: modelRef
uriParameter.description: This option is used to specify the model file which is useful for the resource class without annotation. When using this option then the service class can be omitted to emulate document-only endpoints

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: providers
uriParameter.description: Set custom JAX-RS provider(s) list to the CxfRs endpoint. You can specify a string with a list of providers to lookup in the registy separated by comma.

uriParameter.name: maxClientCacheSize
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: This option allows you to configure the maximum size of the cache. The implementation caches CXF clients or ClientFactoryBean in CxfProvider and CxfRsProvider.

component.title: CMIS
component.description: The cmis component uses the Apache Chemistry client API and allows you to add/read nodes to/from a CMIS compliant content repositories.

uriParameter.name: queryMode
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If true will execute the cmis query from the message body and return result otherwise will create a node in the cmis repository

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: url
uriParameter.description: the cmis url

component.title: Browse
component.description: The browse component is used for viewsing the messages received on endpoints that supports BrowsableEndpoint.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: A name which can be any string to uniquely identify the endpoint

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Google mail
component.description: The gmail component is used for sending emails to GAE.

uriParameter.name: cc
uriParameter.description: Cc-receiver of the email. This can be a single receiver or a comma-separated list of receivers.

uriParameter.name: bcc
uriParameter.description: Bcc-receiver of the email. This can be a single receiver or a comma-separated list of receivers.

uriParameter.name: sender
uriParameter.description: The email of the sender

uriParameter.name: subject
uriParameter.description: Subject of the email.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: to
uriParameter.description: To-receiver of the email. This can be a single receiver or a comma-separated list of receivers.

component.title: PostgresSQL Event
component.description: The pgevent component allows for producing/consuming PostgreSQL events related to the LISTEN/NOTIFY commands.

uriParameter.name: database
uriParameter.description: The database name

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: To connect using hostname and port to the database.

uriParameter.name: pass
uriParameter.description: Password for login

uriParameter.name: datasource
uriParameter.description: To connect using the given javax.sql.DataSource instead of using hostname and port.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: To connect using hostname and port to the database.

uriParameter.name: channel
uriParameter.description: The channel name

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: user
uriParameter.description: Username for login

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Nats
component.description: Camel Components

uriParameter.name: pingInterval
uriParameter.description: Ping interval to be aware if connection is still alive (in milliseconds)

uriParameter.name: noRandomizeServers
uriParameter.description: Whether or not randomizing the order of servers for the connection attempts

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: maxMessages
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Stop receiving messages from a topic we are subscribing to after maxMessages

uriParameter.name: poolSize
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Consumer pool size

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: ssl
uriParameter.description: Whether or not using SSL

uriParameter.name: verbose
uriParameter.description: Whether or not running in verbose mode

uriParameter.name: servers
uriParameter.description: URLs to one or more NAT servers. Use comma to separate URLs when specifying multiple servers.

uriParameter.name: reconnect
uriParameter.description: Whether or not using reconnection feature

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: queueName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The Queue name if we are using nats for a queue configuration

uriParameter.name: maxReconnectAttempts
uriParameter.description: Max reconnection attempts

uriParameter.name: topic
uriParameter.description: The name of topic we want to use

uriParameter.name: pedantic
uriParameter.description: Whether or not running in pedantic mode (this affects performace)

uriParameter.name: reconnectTimeWait
uriParameter.description: Waiting time before attempts reconnection (in milliseconds)

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Log
component.description: The log component logs message exchanges to the underlying logging mechanism.

componentProperty.name: exchangeFormatter
componentProperty.description: Sets a custom ExchangeFormatter to convert the Exchange to a String suitable for logging. If not specified we default to DefaultExchangeFormatter.

uriParameter.name: showProperties
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Show the exchange properties.

uriParameter.name: showStreams
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Whether Camel should show stream bodies or not (eg such as java.io.InputStream). Beware if you enable this option then you may not be able later to access the message body as the stream have already been read by this logger. To remedy this you will have to use Stream Caching.

uriParameter.name: showHeaders
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Show the message headers.

uriParameter.name: showException
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: If the exchange has an exception show the exception message (no stacktrace)

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: showExchangeId
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Show the unique exchange ID.

uriParameter.name: groupActiveOnly
uriParameter.description: If true will hide stats when no new messages have been received for a time interval if false show stats regardless of message traffic.

uriParameter.name: showFiles
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: If enabled Camel will output files

uriParameter.name: showAll
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Quick option for turning all options on. (multiline maxChars has to be manually set if to be used)

uriParameter.name: maxChars
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Limits the number of characters logged per line.

uriParameter.name: loggerName
uriParameter.description: The logger name to use

uriParameter.name: level
uriParameter.description: Logging level to use. The default value is INFO.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: showOut
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: If the exchange has an out message show the out message.

uriParameter.name: groupDelay
uriParameter.description: Set the initial delay for stats (in millis)

uriParameter.name: showExchangePattern
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Shows the Message Exchange Pattern (or MEP for short).

uriParameter.name: showBodyType
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Show the body Java type.

uriParameter.name: showFuture
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: If enabled Camel will on Future objects wait for it to complete to obtain the payload to be logged.

uriParameter.name: showCaughtException
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: f the exchange has a caught exception show the exception message (no stack trace). A caught exception is stored as a property on the exchange (using the key link org.apache.camel.ExchangeEXCEPTION_CAUGHT and for instance a doCatch can catch exceptions.

uriParameter.name: showStackTrace
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Show the stack trace if an exchange has an exception. Only effective if one of showAll showException or showCaughtException are enabled.

uriParameter.name: skipBodyLineSeparator
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Whether to skip line separators when logging the message body. This allows to log the message body in one line setting this option to false will preserve any line separators from the body which then will log the body as is.

uriParameter.name: marker
uriParameter.description: An optional Marker name to use.

uriParameter.name: multiline
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: If enabled then each information is outputted on a newline.

uriParameter.name: groupSize
uriParameter.description: An integer that specifies a group size for throughput logging.

uriParameter.name: showBody
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Show the message body.

uriParameter.name: style
uriParameter.label: formatting
uriParameter.description: Sets the outputs style to use.

uriParameter.name: groupInterval
uriParameter.description: If specified will group message stats by this time interval (in millis)

component.title: Nagios
component.description: To send passive checks to Nagios using JSendNSCA.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use a shared NagiosConfiguration

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: Password to be authenticated when sending checks to Nagios.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The port number of the host.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: This is the address of the Nagios host where checks should be send.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sendSync
uriParameter.description: Whether or not to use synchronous when sending a passive check. Setting it to false will allow Camel to continue routing the message and the passive check message will be send asynchronously.

uriParameter.name: connectionTimeout
uriParameter.description: Connection timeout in millis.

uriParameter.name: encryptionMethod
uriParameter.description: To specify an encryption method.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: Sending timeout in millis.

component.title: OpenShift
component.description: To manage your Openshift 2.x applications.

componentProperty.name: server
componentProperty.description: Url to the openshift server. If not specified then the default value from the local openshift configuration file /.openshift/express.conf is used. And if that fails as well then openshift.redhat.com is used.

componentProperty.name: password
componentProperty.description: The password for login to openshift server.

componentProperty.name: domain
componentProperty.description: Domain name. If not specified then the default domain is used.

componentProperty.name: username
componentProperty.description: The username to login to openshift server.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: server
uriParameter.description: Url to the openshift server. If not specified then the default value from the local openshift configuration file /.openshift/express.conf is used. And if that fails as well then openshift.redhat.com is used.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: mode
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether to output the message body as a pojo or json. For pojo the message is a List type.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: The password for login to openshift server.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: clientId
uriParameter.description: The client id

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: application
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The application name to start stop restart or get the state.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: domain
uriParameter.description: Domain name. If not specified then the default domain is used.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The operation to perform which can be: list start stop restart and state. The list operation returns information about all the applications in json format. The state operation returns the state such as: started stopped etc. The other operations does not return any value.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.description: The username to login to openshift server.

component.title: Direct
component.description: The direct component provides direct synchronous call to another endpoint from the same CamelContext.

componentProperty.name: block
componentProperty.description: If sending a message to a direct endpoint which has no active consumer then we can tell the producer to block and wait for the consumer to become active.

componentProperty.name: timeout
componentProperty.description: The timeout value to use if block is enabled.

uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: failIfNoConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether the producer should fail by throwing an exception when sending to a DIRECT endpoint with no active consumers.

uriParameter.name: block
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If sending a message to a direct endpoint which has no active consumer then we can tell the producer to block and wait for the consumer to become active.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The timeout value to use if block is enabled.

componentProperty.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

componentProperty.name: sslKeyPassword
componentProperty.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

componentProperty.name: securityPolicy

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: jsonCommented
uriParameter.description: If true the server will accept JSON wrapped in a comment and will generate JSON wrapped in a comment. This is a defence against Ajax Hijacking.

uriParameter.name: maxInterval
uriParameter.description: The max client side poll timeout in milliseconds. A client will be removed if a connection is not received in this time.

uriParameter.name: timeout
uriParameter.description: The server side poll timeout in milliseconds. This is how long the server will hold a reconnect request before responding.

uriParameter.name: filterPath
uriParameter.description: The filterPath will be used by the CrossOriginFilter if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

uriParameter.name: baseResource
uriParameter.description: The root directory for the web resources or classpath. Use the protocol file: or classpath: depending if you want that the component loads the resource from file system or classpath. Classpath is required for OSGI deployment where the resources are packaged in the jar

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: disconnectLocalSession
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether to disconnect local sessions after publishing a message to its channel. Disconnecting local session is needed as they are not swept by default by CometD and therefore you can run out of memory.

uriParameter.name: allowedOrigins
uriParameter.description: The origins domain that support to cross if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

uriParameter.name: crossOriginFilterOn
uriParameter.description: If true the server will support for cross-domain filtering

uriParameter.name: logLevel
uriParameter.description: Logging level. 0=none 1=info 2=debug.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Host port number

uriParameter.name: channelName
uriParameter.description: The channelName represents a topic that can be subscribed to by the Camel endpoints.

uriParameter.name: interval
uriParameter.description: The client side poll timeout in milliseconds. How long a client will wait between reconnects

uriParameter.name: multiFrameInterval
uriParameter.description: The client side poll timeout if multiple connections are detected from the same browser.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: sessionHeadersEnabled
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to include the server session headers in the Camel message when creating a Camel Message for incoming requests.
