uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: Specifies the host of the cache on Infinispan instance

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: queryBuilder
uriParameter.description: Specifies the query builder.

component.title: QuickFix
component.description: The quickfix component allows to send Financial Interchange (FIX) messages to the QuickFix engine.

componentProperty.name: lazyCreateEngines
componentProperty.description: If set to true the engines will be created and started when needed (when first message is send)

componentProperty.name: messageFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the given MessageFactory

componentProperty.name: logFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the given LogFactory

componentProperty.name: messageStoreFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the given MessageStoreFactory

componentProperty.name: configurations
componentProperty.description: To use the given map of pre configured QuickFix configurations mapped to the key

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: lazyCreateEngine
uriParameter.description: This option allows to create QuickFIX/J engine on demand. Value true means the engine is started when first message is send or there's consumer configured in route definition. When false value is used the engine is started at the endpoint creation. When this parameter is missing the value of component's property lazyCreateEngines is being used.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: configurationName
uriParameter.description: The configFile is the name of the QuickFIX/J configuration to use for the FIX engine (located as a resource found in your classpath).

uriParameter.name: sessionID
uriParameter.description: The optional sessionID identifies a specific FIX session. The format of the sessionID is: (BeginString):(SenderCompID)/(SenderSubID)/(SenderLocationID)-(TargetCompID)/(TargetSubID)/(TargetLocationID)

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: IMAPS
component.description: To send or receive emails using imap/pop3 or stmp protocols.

componentProperty.name: contentTypeResolver
componentProperty.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: Sets the Mail configuration

uriParameter.name: disconnect
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should disconnect after polling. If enabled this forces Camel to connect on each poll.

uriParameter.name: contentTypeResolver
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Resolver to determine Content-Type for file attachments.

uriParameter.name: subject
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Subject of the message being sent. Note: Setting the subject in the header takes precedence over this option.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: binding
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the binding used to convert from a Camel message to and from a Mail message

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: copyTo
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing a mail message it can be copied to a mail folder with the given name. You can override this configuration value with a header with the key copyTo allowing you to copy messages to folder names configured at runtime.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The password for login

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: searchTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: Refers to a javax.mail.search.SearchTerm which allows to filter mails based on search criteria such as subject body from sent after a certain date etc.

uriParameter.name: alternativeBodyHeader
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the key to an IN message header that contains an alternative email body. For example if you send emails in text/html format and want to provide an alternative mail body for non-HTML email clients set the alternative mail body with this key as a header.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The mail server host name

uriParameter.name: skipFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to skip the message and move on to retrieve the next mail message. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of messages to gather per poll. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid downloading thousands of files when the server starts up. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable this option.

uriParameter.name: from
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The from email address

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The mail message content type. Use text/html for HTML mails.

uriParameter.name: postProcessAction
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to an MailBoxPostProcessAction for doing post processing tasks on the mailbox once the normal processing ended.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: sortTerm
uriParameter.label: consumer,sort
uriParameter.description: Sorting order for messages. Only natively supported for IMAP. Emulated to some degree when using POP3 or when IMAP server does not have the SORT capability.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepositoryRemoveOnCommit
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: When using idempotent repository then when the mail message has been successfully processed and is committed should the message id be removed from the idempotent repository (default) or be kept in the repository. By default its assumed the message id is unique and has no value to be kept in the repository because the mail message will be marked as seen/moved or deleted to prevent it from being consumed again. And therefore having the message id stored in the idempotent repository has little value. However this option allows to store the message id for whatever reason you may have.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The port number of the mail server

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: dummyTrustManager
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To use a dummy security setting for trusting all certificates. Should only be used for development mode and not production.

uriParameter.name: replyTo
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Reply-To recipients (the receivers of the response mail). Separate multiple email addresses with a comma.

uriParameter.name: mailUidGenerator
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable MailUidGenerator that allows to use custom logic to generate UUID of the mail message.

uriParameter.name: folderName
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The folder to poll.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: debugMode
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Enable debug mode on the underlying mail framework. The SUN Mail framework logs the debug messages to System.out by default.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: bcc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the BCC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: session
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the mail session that camel should use for all mail interactions. Useful in scenarios where mail sessions are created and managed by some other resource such as a JavaEE container. If this is not specified Camel automatically creates the mail session for you.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters.

uriParameter.name: mapMailMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether Camel should map the received mail message to Camel body/headers. If set to true the body of the mail message is mapped to the body of the Camel IN message and the mail headers are mapped to IN headers. If this option is set to false then the IN message contains a raw javax.mail.Message. You can retrieve this raw message by calling exchange.getIn().getBody(javax.mail.Message.class).

uriParameter.name: delete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Deletes the messages after they have been processed. This is done by setting the DELETED flag on the mail message. If false the SEEN flag is set instead. As of Camel 2.10 you can override this configuration option by setting a header with the key delete to determine if the mail should be deleted or not.

uriParameter.name: handleFailedMessage
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the mail consumer cannot retrieve a given mail message then this option allows to handle the caused exception by the consumer's error handler. By enable the bridge error handler on the consumer then the Camel routing error handler can handle the exception instead. The default behavior would be the consumer throws an exception and no mails from the batch would be able to be routed by Camel.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: closeFolder
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the consumer should close the folder after polling. Setting this option to false and having disconnect=false as well then the consumer keep the folder open between polls.

uriParameter.name: additionalJavaMailProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets additional java mail properties that will append/override any default properties that is set based on all the other options. This is useful if you need to add some special options but want to keep the others as is.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter headers.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: connectionTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: cc
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the CC email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: fetchSize
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to consume during a poll. This can be used to avoid overloading a mail server if a mailbox folder contains a lot of messages. Default value of -1 means no fetch size and all messages will be consumed. Setting the value to 0 is a special corner case where Camel will not consume any messages at all.

uriParameter.name: javaMailSender
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.mail.JavaMailSender for sending emails.

uriParameter.name: useInlineAttachments
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to use disposition inline or attachment.

uriParameter.name: idempotentRepository
uriParameter.label: consumer,filter
uriParameter.description: A pluggable repository org.apache.camel.spi.IdempotentRepository which allows to cluster consuming from the same mailbox and let the repository coordinate whether a mail message is valid for the consumer to process. By default no repository is in use.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: ignoreUnsupportedCharset
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: ignoreUriScheme
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Option to let Camel ignore unsupported charset in the local JVM when sending mails. If the charset is unsupported then charset=XXX (where XXX represents the unsupported charset) is removed from the content-type and it relies on the platform default instead.

uriParameter.name: peek
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Will mark the javax.mail.Message as peeked before processing the mail message. This applies to IMAPMessage messages types only. By using peek the mail will not be eager marked as SEEN on the mail server which allows us to rollback the mail message if there is an error processing in Camel.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: to
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Sets the To email address. Separate multiple email addresses with comma.

uriParameter.name: unseen
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to limit by unseen mails only.

uriParameter.name: username
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: The username for login

component.title: Atom
component.description: The atom component is used for consuming Atom RSS feeds.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: Sets the password to be used for basic authentication when polling from a HTTP feed

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: throttleEntries
uriParameter.description: Sets whether all entries identified in a single feed poll should be delivered immediately. If true only one entry is processed per consumer.delay. Only applicable when splitEntries = true.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: splitEntries
uriParameter.description: Sets whether or not entries should be sent individually or whether the entire feed should be sent as a single message

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: sortEntries
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to sort entries by published date. Only works when splitEntries = true.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern

uriParameter.name: feedHeader

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: filter
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to use filtering or not of the entries.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: lastUpdate
uriParameter.description: Sets the timestamp to be used for filtering entries from the atom feeds. This options is only in conjunction with the splitEntries.

uriParameter.name: feedUri
uriParameter.description: The URI to the feed to poll.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: uris

component.title: Google Mail

componentProperty.name: clientFactory

uriParameter.name: apiName
uriParameter.description: What kind of operation to perform

uriParameter.name: clientId

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: methodName
uriParameter.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

uriParameter.name: accessToken

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler

By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: clientSecret

uriParameter.name: inBody

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler

component.title: Direct VM

componentProperty.name: timeout

component.title: Dozer
component.description: The dozer component provides the ability to map between Java beans using the Dozer mapping library.

uriParameter.name: mappingFile
uriParameter.description: The location of a Dozer configuration file. The file is loaded from the classpath by default but you can use file: classpath: or http: to load the configuration from a specific location.

uriParameter.name: unmarshalId
uriParameter.description: The id of a dataFormat defined within the Camel Context to use for unmarshalling the mapping input from a non-Java type.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: targetModel
uriParameter.description: Fully-qualified class name for the target type used in the mapping.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: A human readable name of the mapping.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: marshalId
uriParameter.description: The id of a dataFormat defined within the Camel Context to use for marshalling the mapping output to a non-Java type.

uriParameter.name: sourceModel
uriParameter.description: Fully-qualified class name for the source type used in the mapping. If specified the input to the mapping is converted to the specified type before being mapped with Dozer.

uriParameter.name: mappingConfiguration
uriParameter.description: The name of a DozerBeanMapperConfiguration bean in the Camel registry which should be used for configuring the Dozer mapping. This is an alternative to the mappingFile option that can be used for fine-grained control over how Dozer is configured. Remember to use a prefix in the value to indicate that the bean is in the Camel registry (e.g. myDozerConfig).

component.title: iBatis
component.description: Performs a query poll insert update or delete in a relational database using Apache iBATIS.

componentProperty.name: sqlMapConfig
componentProperty.description: Location of iBatis xml configuration file. The default value is: SqlMapConfig.xml loaded from the classpath

componentProperty.name: useTransactions
componentProperty.description: Whether to use transactions. This option is by default true.

componentProperty.name: sqlMapClient

uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: onConsume
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Statement to run after data has been processed in the route

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: useIterator
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Process resultset individually or as a list

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: statement
uriParameter.description: The statement name in the iBatis XML mapping file which maps to the query insert update or delete operation you wish to evaluate.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: This option is intended to split results returned by the database pool into the batches and deliver them in multiple exchanges. This integer defines the maximum messages to deliver in single exchange. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to set a limit of e.g. 1000 to avoid when starting up the server that there are thousands of files. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable it.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: useTransactions
uriParameter.description: Whether to use transactions. This option is by default true.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: isolation
uriParameter.description: Transaction isolation level

uriParameter.name: routeEmptyResultSet
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether allow empty resultset to be routed to the next hop

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: statementType
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Mandatory to specify for the producer to control which kind of operation to invoke.

uriParameter.name: strategy
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows to plugin a custom IBatisProcessingStrategy to use by the consumer.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Google Task
component.description: The gtask component is used for sending messages to GAE task queue service.

componentProperty.name: allowJavaSerializedObject
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: httpBinding
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

componentProperty.name: servletName
componentProperty.description: Default name of servlet to use. The default name is CamelServlet.

componentProperty.name: httpRegistry
componentProperty.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.servlet.HttpRegistry.

componentProperty.name: httpConfiguration
componentProperty.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration.

uriParameter.name: authMethodPriority
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Authentication method for proxy either as Basic Digest or NTLM.

uriParameter.name: throwExceptionOnFailure
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

uriParameter.name: httpBinding
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: chunked
uriParameter.description: If this option is false the Servlet will disable the HTTP streaming and set the content-length header on the response

uriParameter.name: ignoreResponseBody
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true The http producer won't read response body and cache the input stream

uriParameter.name: connectionClose
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether a Connection Close header must be added to HTTP Request. By default connectionClose is false.

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageBody
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Body of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP body. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP mapping.

uriParameter.name: okStatusCodeRange
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The status codes which is considered a success response. The values are inclusive. The range must be defined as from-to with the dash included.

uriParameter.name: proxyHost
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy host name

uriParameter.name: outboundBindingRef
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Reference to an OutboundBinding in the Registry for customizing the binding of an Exchange to the task queueing service.

uriParameter.name: proxyPort
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The proxy port number

uriParameter.name: preserveHostHeader
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will set the Host header to the value contained in the current exchange Host header useful in reverse proxy applications where you want the Host header received by the downstream server to reflect the URL called by the upstream client this allows applications which use the Host header to generate accurate URL's for a proxied service

uriParameter.name: queueName
uriParameter.description: Name of queue

uriParameter.name: disableStreamCache
uriParameter.label: common
uriParameter.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream from Servlet is cached or not (Camel will read the stream into a in memory/overflow to file Stream caching) cache. By default Camel will cache the Servlet input stream to support reading it multiple times to ensure it Camel can retrieve all data from the stream. However you can set this option to true when you for example need to access the raw stream such as streaming it directly to a file or other persistent store. DefaultHttpBinding will copy the request input stream into a stream cache and put it into message body if this option is false to support reading the stream multiple times. If you use Servlet to bridge/proxy an endpoint then consider enabling this option to improve performance in case you do not need to read the message payload multiple times. The http/http4 producer will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is as the message body.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side and if the caused Exception was send back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is instead of the HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

uriParameter.name: copyHeaders
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange headers will be copied to OUT exchange headers according to copy strategy. Setting this to false allows to only include the headers from the HTTP response (not propagating IN headers).

uriParameter.name: workerRoot
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The servlet mapping for callback handlers. By default this component requires a callback servlet mapping of /worker/. If another servlet mapping is used e.g. /myworker/ it must be set as option on the producer side: to(gtask:myqueueworkerRoot=myworker).

uriParameter.name: mapHttpMessageHeaders
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If this option is true then IN exchange Headers of the exchange will be mapped to HTTP headers. Setting this to false will avoid the HTTP Headers mapping.

uriParameter.name: bridgeEndpoint
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If the option is true HttpProducer will ignore the Exchange.HTTP_URI header and use the endpoint's URI for request. You may also set the option throwExceptionOnFailure to be false to let the HttpProducer send all the fault response back.

uriParameter.name: urlRewrite
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Refers to a custom org.apache.camel.component.http.UrlRewrite which allows you to rewrite urls when you bridge/proxy endpoints. See more details at http://camel.apache.org/urlrewrite.html

component.title: XMPP
component.description: To send and receive messages from a XMPP (chat) server.

uriParameter.name: resource
uriParameter.description: XMPP resource. The default is Camel.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: createAccount
uriParameter.description: If true an attempt to create an account will be made. Default is false.

uriParameter.name: login
uriParameter.description: Whether to login the user.

uriParameter.name: serviceName
uriParameter.description: The name of the service you are connecting to. For Google Talk this would be gmail.com.

uriParameter.name: participant
uriParameter.description: JID (Jabber ID) of person to receive messages. room parameter has precedence over participant.

uriParameter.name: room
uriParameter.description: If this option is specified the component will connect to MUC (Multi User Chat). Usually the domain name for MUC is different from the login domain. For example if you are supermanjabber.org and want to join the krypton room then the room URL is kryptonconference.jabber.org. Note the conference part. It is not a requirement to provide the full room JID. If the room parameter does not contain the symbol the domain part will be discovered and added by Camel

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.description: Password for login

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Port number for the chat server

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: testConnectionOnStartup
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to test the connection on startup. This is used to ensure that the XMPP client has a valid connection to the XMPP server when the route starts. Camel throws an exception on startup if a connection cannot be established. When this option is set to false Camel will attempt to establish a lazy connection when needed by a producer and will poll for a consumer connection until the connection is established. Default is true.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: Hostname for the chat server

uriParameter.name: nickname
uriParameter.description: Use nickname when joining room. If room is specified and nickname is not user will be used for the nickname.

uriParameter.name: doc
uriParameter.description: Set a doc header on the IN message containing a Document form of the incoming packet; default is true if presence or pubsub are true otherwise false

uriParameter.name: user
uriParameter.description: User name (without server name). If not specified anonymous login will be attempted.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: connectionPollDelay
uriParameter.description: The amount of time in seconds between polls (in seconds) to verify the health of the XMPP connection or between attempts to establish an initial consumer connection. Camel will try to re-establish a connection if it has become inactive. Default is 10 seconds.

uriParameter.name: pubsub
uriParameter.description: Accept pubsub packets on input default is false

component.title: RMI
component.description: The rmi component is for invoking Java RMI beans from Camel.

uriParameter.name: hostname
uriParameter.description: Hostname of RMI server

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: method
uriParameter.description: You can set the name of the method to invoke.

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: Port number of RMI server

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: remoteInterfaces
uriParameter.description: To specific the remote interfaces.

uriParameter.name: name
uriParameter.description: Name to use when binding to RMI server

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Salesforce
component.description: The salesforce component is used for integrating Camel with the massive Salesforce API.

componentProperty.name: loginConfig
componentProperty.description: To use the shared SalesforceLoginConfig as login configuration

componentProperty.name: isHttpProxySocks4
componentProperty.description: Enable for Socks4 proxy false by default

componentProperty.name: httpProxyExcludedAddresses
componentProperty.description: HTTP proxy excluded addresses

componentProperty.name: isHttpProxySecure
componentProperty.description: Enable for TLS connections true by default

componentProperty.name: httpProxyIncludedAddresses
componentProperty.description: HTTP proxy included addresses

componentProperty.name: httpProxyHost
componentProperty.description: To configure HTTP proxy host

componentProperty.name: httpProxyRealm
componentProperty.description: HTTP proxy authentication realm

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

componentProperty.name: httpProxyPort
componentProperty.description: To configure HTTP proxy port

componentProperty.name: packages
componentProperty.description: Package names to scan for DTO classes (multiple packages can be separated by comma).

componentProperty.name: httpProxyPassword
componentProperty.description: To configure HTTP proxy password

componentProperty.name: httpProxyUsername
componentProperty.description: To configure HTTP proxy username

componentProperty.name: httpProxyAuthUri
componentProperty.description: HTTP proxy authentication URI

componentProperty.name: httpProxyUseDigestAuth
componentProperty.description: Use HTTP proxy Digest authentication false by default

componentProperty.name: config
componentProperty.description: To use the shared SalesforceLoginConfig as configuration

componentProperty.name: httpClientProperties
componentProperty.description: Used for configuring HTTP client properties as key/value pairs

uriParameter.name: notifyForOperations
uriParameter.description: Notify for operations options are ALL CREATE EXTENDED UPDATE (API version 29.0)

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: sObjectQuery
uriParameter.description: Salesforce SOQL query string

uriParameter.name: notifyForOperationCreate
uriParameter.description: Notify for create operation defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

uriParameter.name: batchId
uriParameter.description: Bulk API Batch ID

uriParameter.name: notifyForOperationUndelete
uriParameter.description: Notify for un-delete operation defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

uriParameter.name: sObjectClass
uriParameter.description: Fully qualified SObject class name usually generated using camel-salesforce-maven-plugin

uriParameter.name: apexUrl
uriParameter.description: APEX method URL

uriParameter.name: apexMethod
uriParameter.description: APEX method name

uriParameter.name: updateTopic
uriParameter.description: Whether to update an existing Push Topic when using the Streaming API defaults to false

uriParameter.name: apiVersion
uriParameter.description: Salesforce API version defaults to SalesforceEndpointConfig.DEFAULT_VERSION

uriParameter.name: instanceId
uriParameter.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report execution instance ID

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: notifyForFields
uriParameter.description: Notify for fields options are ALL REFERENCED SELECT WHERE

uriParameter.name: sObjectIdValue
uriParameter.description: SObject external ID field value

uriParameter.name: reportMetadata
uriParameter.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report metadata for filtering

uriParameter.name: apexQueryParams
uriParameter.description: Query params for APEX method

uriParameter.name: contentType
uriParameter.description: Bulk API content type one of XML CSV ZIP_XML ZIP_CSV

uriParameter.name: includeDetails
uriParameter.description: Include details in Salesforce1 Analytics report defaults to false.

uriParameter.name: sObjectFields
uriParameter.description: SObject fields to retrieve

uriParameter.name: sObjectName
uriParameter.description: SObject name if required or supported by API

uriParameter.name: httpClient
uriParameter.description: Custom Jetty Http Client to use to connect to Salesforce.

uriParameter.name: sObjectBlobFieldName
uriParameter.description: SObject blob field name

uriParameter.name: reportId
uriParameter.description: Salesforce1 Analytics report Id

uriParameter.name: resultId
uriParameter.description: Bulk API Result ID

uriParameter.name: format
uriParameter.description: Payload format to use for Salesforce API calls either JSON or XML defaults to JSON

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: sObjectId
uriParameter.description: SObject ID if required by API

uriParameter.name: jobId
uriParameter.description: Bulk API Job ID

uriParameter.name: sObjectSearch
uriParameter.description: Salesforce SOSL search string

uriParameter.name: notifyForOperationUpdate
uriParameter.description: Notify for update operation defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

uriParameter.name: sObjectIdName
uriParameter.description: SObject external ID field name

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: notifyForOperationDelete
uriParameter.description: Notify for delete operation defaults to false (API version = 29.0)

component.title: JMS
component.description: The jms component allows messages to be sent to (or consumed from) a JMS Queue or Topic.

componentProperty.name: includeSentJMSMessageID
componentProperty.description: Only applicable when sending to JMS destination using InOnly (eg fire and forget). Enabling this option will enrich the Camel Exchange with the actual JMSMessageID that was used by the JMS client when the message was sent to the JMS destination.

componentProperty.name: asyncConsumer
componentProperty.description: Whether the JmsConsumer processes the Exchange asynchronously. If enabled then the JmsConsumer may pickup the next message from the JMS queue while the previous message is being processed asynchronously (by the Asynchronous Routing Engine). This means that messages may be processed not 100 strictly in order. If disabled (as default) then the Exchange is fully processed before the JmsConsumer will pickup the next message from the JMS queue. Note if transacted has been enabled then asyncConsumer=true does not run asynchronously as transaction must be executed synchronously (Camel 3.0 may support async transactions).

componentProperty.name: mapJmsMessage
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether Camel should auto map the received JMS message to a suited payload type such as javax.jms.TextMessage to a String etc. See section about how mapping works below for more details.

componentProperty.name: requestTimeoutCheckerInterval
componentProperty.description: Configures how often Camel should check for timed out Exchanges when doing request/reply over JMS. By default Camel checks once per second. But if you must react faster when a timeout occurs then you can lower this interval to check more frequently. The timeout is determined by the option requestTimeout.

componentProperty.name: includeAllJMSXProperties
componentProperty.description: Whether to include all JMSXxxx properties when mapping from JMS to Camel Message. Setting this to true will include properties such as JMSXAppID and JMSXUserID etc. Note: If you are using a custom headerFilterStrategy then this option does not apply.

componentProperty.name: cacheLevel
componentProperty.description: Sets the cache level by ID for the underlying JMS resources. See cacheLevelName option for more details.

componentProperty.name: errorHandlerLogStackTrace
componentProperty.description: Allows to control whether stacktraces should be logged or not by the default errorHandler.

componentProperty.name: eagerLoadingOfProperties
componentProperty.description: Enables eager loading of JMS properties as soon as a message is loaded which generally is inefficient as the JMS properties may not be required but sometimes can catch early any issues with the underlying JMS provider and the use of JMS properties

componentProperty.name: timeToLive
componentProperty.description: When sending messages specifies the time-to-live of the message (in milliseconds).

componentProperty.name: replyToMaxConcurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent consumers when using request/reply over JMS. See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads.

componentProperty.name: deliveryMode
componentProperty.description: Specifies the delivery mode to be used. Possible values are Possibles values are those defined by javax.jms.DeliveryMode. NON_PERSISTENT = 1 and PERSISTENT = 2.

componentProperty.name: transferException
componentProperty.description: If enabled and you are using Request Reply messaging (InOut) and an Exchange failed on the consumer side then the caused Exception will be send back in response as a javax.jms.ObjectMessage. If the client is Camel the returned Exception is rethrown. This allows you to use Camel JMS as a bridge in your routing - for example using persistent queues to enable robust routing. Notice that if you also have transferExchange enabled this option takes precedence. The caught exception is required to be serializable. The original Exception on the consumer side can be wrapped in an outer exception such as org.apache.camel.RuntimeCamelException when returned to the producer.

componentProperty.name: exceptionListener
componentProperty.description: Specifies the JMS Exception Listener that is to be notified of any underlying JMS exceptions.

componentProperty.name: asyncStartListener
componentProperty.description: Whether to startup the JmsConsumer message listener asynchronously when starting a route. For example if a JmsConsumer cannot get a connection to a remote JMS broker then it may block while retrying and/or failover. This will cause Camel to block while starting routes. By setting this option to true you will let routes startup while the JmsConsumer connects to the JMS broker using a dedicated thread in asynchronous mode. If this option is used then beware that if the connection could not be established then an exception is logged at WARN level and the consumer will not be able to receive messages; You can then restart the route to retry.

componentProperty.name: transactionManager
componentProperty.description: The Spring transaction manager to use.

componentProperty.name: alwaysCopyMessage
componentProperty.description: If true Camel will always make a JMS message copy of the message when it is passed to the producer for sending. Copying the message is needed in some situations such as when a replyToDestinationSelectorName is set (incidentally Camel will set the alwaysCopyMessage option to true if a replyToDestinationSelectorName is set)

componentProperty.name: replyToConcurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Specifies the default number of concurrent consumers when doing request/reply over JMS. See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads.

componentProperty.name: maxConcurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent consumers when consuming from JMS (not for request/reply over JMS). See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads. When doing request/reply over JMS then the option replyToMaxConcurrentConsumers is used to control number of concurrent consumers on the reply message listener.

componentProperty.name: taskExecutor
componentProperty.description: Allows you to specify a custom task executor for consuming messages.

componentProperty.name: deliveryPersistent
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether persistent delivery is used by default.

componentProperty.name: priority
componentProperty.description: Values greater than 1 specify the message priority when sending (where 0 is the lowest priority and 9 is the highest). The explicitQosEnabled option must also be enabled in order for this option to have any effect.

componentProperty.name: concurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Specifies the default number of concurrent consumers when consuming from JMS (not for request/reply over JMS). See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads. When doing request/reply over JMS then the option replyToConcurrentConsumers is used to control number of concurrent consumers on the reply message listener.

componentProperty.name: acceptMessagesWhileStopping
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether the consumer accept messages while it is stopping. You may consider enabling this option if you start and stop JMS routes at runtime while there are still messages enqued on the queue. If this option is false and you stop the JMS route then messages may be rejected and the JMS broker would have to attempt redeliveries which yet again may be rejected and eventually the message may be moved at a dead letter queue on the JMS broker. To avoid this its recommended to enable this option.

componentProperty.name: acknowledgementMode
componentProperty.description: The JMS acknowledgement mode defined as an Integer. Allows you to set vendor-specific extensions to the acknowledgment mode. For the regular modes it is preferable to use the acknowledgementModeName instead.

componentProperty.name: jmsOperations
componentProperty.description: Allows you to use your own implementation of the org.springframework.jms.core.JmsOperations interface. Camel uses JmsTemplate as default. Can be used for testing purpose but not used much as stated in the spring API docs.

componentProperty.name: acknowledgementModeName
componentProperty.description: The JMS acknowledgement name which is one of: SESSION_TRANSACTED CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE

componentProperty.name: exposeListenerSession
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether the listener session should be exposed when consuming messages.

componentProperty.name: receiveTimeout
componentProperty.description: The timeout for receiving messages (in milliseconds).

componentProperty.name: applicationContext
componentProperty.description: Sets the Spring ApplicationContext to use

componentProperty.name: subscriptionDurable
componentProperty.description: Deprecated: Enabled by default if you specify a durableSubscriptionName and a clientId.

componentProperty.name: destinationResolver
componentProperty.description: A pluggable org.springframework.jms.support.destination.DestinationResolver that allows you to use your own resolver (for example to lookup the real destination in a JNDI registry).

componentProperty.name: errorHandlerLoggingLevel
componentProperty.description: Allows to configure the default errorHandler logging level for logging uncaught exceptions.

componentProperty.name: errorHandler
componentProperty.description: Specifies a org.springframework.util.ErrorHandler to be invoked in case of any uncaught exceptions thrown while processing a Message. By default these exceptions will be logged at the WARN level if no errorHandler has been configured. You can configure logging level and whether stack traces should be logged using errorHandlerLoggingLevel and errorHandlerLogStackTrace options. This makes it much easier to configure than having to code a custom errorHandler.

componentProperty.name: allowReplyManagerQuickStop
componentProperty.description: Whether the DefaultMessageListenerContainer used in the reply managers for request-reply messaging allow the DefaultMessageListenerContainer.runningAllowed flag to quick stop in case JmsConfigurationisAcceptMessagesWhileStopping is enabled and org.apache.camel.CamelContext is currently being stopped. This quick stop ability is enabled by default in the regular JMS consumers but to enable for reply managers you must enable this flag.

componentProperty.name: idleConsumerLimit
componentProperty.description: Specify the limit for the number of consumers that are allowed to be idle at any given time.

componentProperty.name: configuration
componentProperty.description: To use a shared JMS configuration

componentProperty.name: explicitQosEnabled
componentProperty.description: Set if the deliveryMode priority or timeToLive qualities of service should be used when sending messages. This option is based on Spring's JmsTemplate. The deliveryMode priority and timeToLive options are applied to the current endpoint. This contrasts with the preserveMessageQos option which operates at message granularity reading QoS properties exclusively from the Camel In message headers.

componentProperty.name: messageConverter
componentProperty.description: To use a custom Spring org.springframework.jms.support.converter.MessageConverter so you can be in control how to map to/from a javax.jms.Message.

componentProperty.name: maxMessagesPerTask
componentProperty.description: The number of messages per task. -1 is unlimited. If you use a range for concurrent consumers (eg min max) then this option can be used to set a value to eg 100 to control how fast the consumers will shrink when less work is required.

componentProperty.name: transacted
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether to use transacted mode

componentProperty.name: transactionName
componentProperty.description: The name of the transaction to use.

componentProperty.name: autoStartup
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether the consumer container should auto-startup.

componentProperty.name: messageTimestampEnabled
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether timestamps should be enabled by default on sending messages.

componentProperty.name: replyOnTimeoutToMaxConcurrentConsumers
componentProperty.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent consumers for continue routing when timeout occurred when using request/reply over JMS.

componentProperty.name: jmsKeyFormatStrategy
componentProperty.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides two implementations out of the box: default and passthrough. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). The passthrough strategy leaves the key as is. Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the notation.

componentProperty.name: headerFilterStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

componentProperty.name: lazyCreateTransactionManager
componentProperty.description: If true Camel will create a JmsTransactionManager if there is no transactionManager injected when option transacted=true.

componentProperty.name: messageCreatedStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

componentProperty.name: asyncStopListener
componentProperty.description: Whether to stop the JmsConsumer message listener asynchronously when stopping a route.

componentProperty.name: transferExchange
componentProperty.description: You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body and headers. The following fields are transferred: In body Out body Fault body In headers Out headers Fault headers exchange properties exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level. You must enable this option on both the producer and consumer side so Camel knows the payloads is an Exchange and not a regular payload.

componentProperty.name: requestTimeout
componentProperty.description: The timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds). The default is 20 seconds. You can include the header CamelJmsRequestTimeout to override this endpoint configured timeout value and thus have per message individual timeout values. See also the requestTimeoutCheckerInterval option.

componentProperty.name: allowNullBody
componentProperty.description: Whether to allow sending messages with no body. If this option is false and the message body is null then an JMSException is thrown.

componentProperty.name: clientId
componentProperty.description: Sets the JMS client ID to use. Note that this value if specified must be unique and can only be used by a single JMS connection instance. It is typically only required for durable topic subscriptions. If using Apache ActiveMQ you may prefer to use Virtual Topics instead.

componentProperty.name: recoveryInterval
componentProperty.description: Specifies the interval between recovery attempts i.e. when a connection is being refreshed in milliseconds. The default is 5000 ms that is 5 seconds.

componentProperty.name: replyToCacheLevelName
componentProperty.description: Sets the cache level by name for the reply consumer when doing request/reply over JMS. This option only applies when using fixed reply queues (not temporary). Camel will by default use: CACHE_CONSUMER for exclusive or shared w/ replyToSelectorName. And CACHE_SESSION for shared without replyToSelectorName. Some JMS brokers such as IBM WebSphere may require to set the replyToCacheLevelName=CACHE_NONE to work. Note: If using temporary queues then CACHE_NONE is not allowed and you must use a higher value such as CACHE_CONSUMER or CACHE_SESSION.

componentProperty.name: messageIdEnabled
componentProperty.description: When sending specifies whether message IDs should be added.

componentProperty.name: pubSubNoLocal
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether to inhibit the delivery of messages published by its own connection.

componentProperty.name: queueBrowseStrategy
componentProperty.description: To use a custom QueueBrowseStrategy when browsing queues

componentProperty.name: forceSendOriginalMessage
componentProperty.description: When using mapJmsMessage=false Camel will create a new JMS message to send to a new JMS destination if you touch the headers (get or set) during the route. Set this option to true to force Camel to send the original JMS message that was received.

componentProperty.name: preserveMessageQos
componentProperty.description: Set to true if you want to send message using the QoS settings specified on the message instead of the QoS settings on the JMS endpoint. The following three headers are considered JMSPriority JMSDeliveryMode and JMSExpiration. You can provide all or only some of them. If not provided Camel will fall back to use the values from the endpoint instead. So when using this option the headers override the values from the endpoint. The explicitQosEnabled option by contrast will only use options set on the endpoint and not values from the message header.

componentProperty.name: replyToType
componentProperty.description: Allows for explicitly specifying which kind of strategy to use for replyTo queues when doing request/reply over JMS. Possible values are: Temporary Shared or Exclusive. By default Camel will use temporary queues. However if replyTo has been configured then Shared is used by default. This option allows you to use exclusive queues instead of shared ones. See Camel JMS documentation for more details and especially the notes about the implications if running in a clustered environment and the fact that Shared reply queues has lower performance than its alternatives Temporary and Exclusive.

componentProperty.name: connectionFactory
componentProperty.description: Sets the default connection factory to be use

componentProperty.name: testConnectionOnStartup
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether to test the connection on startup. This ensures that when Camel starts that all the JMS consumers have a valid connection to the JMS broker. If a connection cannot be granted then Camel throws an exception on startup. This ensures that Camel is not started with failed connections. The JMS producers is tested as well.

componentProperty.name: useMessageIDAsCorrelationID
componentProperty.description: Specifies whether JMSMessageID should always be used as JMSCorrelationID for InOut messages.

componentProperty.name: transactionTimeout
componentProperty.description: The timeout value of the transaction (in seconds) if using transacted mode.

componentProperty.name: durableSubscriptionName
componentProperty.description: The durable subscriber name for specifying durable topic subscriptions. The clientId option must be configured as well.

componentProperty.name: defaultTaskExecutorType
componentProperty.description: Specifies what default TaskExecutor type to use in the DefaultMessageListenerContainer for both consumer endpoints and the ReplyTo consumer of producer endpoints. Possible values: SimpleAsync (uses Spring's SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor) or ThreadPool (uses Spring's ThreadPoolTaskExecutor with optimal values - cached threadpool-like). If not set it defaults to the previous behaviour which uses a cached thread pool for consumer endpoints and SimpleAsync for reply consumers. The use of ThreadPool is recommended to reduce thread trash in elastic configurations with dynamically increasing and decreasing concurrent consumers.

componentProperty.name: cacheLevelName
componentProperty.description: Sets the cache level by name for the underlying JMS resources. Possible values are: CACHE_AUTO CACHE_CONNECTION CACHE_CONSUMER CACHE_NONE and CACHE_SESSION. The default setting is CACHE_AUTO. See the Spring documentation and Transactions Cache Levels for more information.

componentProperty.name: transferFault
componentProperty.description: If enabled and you are using Request Reply messaging (InOut) and an Exchange failed with a SOAP fault (not exception) on the consumer side then the fault flag on link org.apache.camel.MessageisFault() will be send back in the response as a JMS header with the key link JmsConstantsJMS_TRANSFER_FAULT. If the client is Camel the returned fault flag will be set on the link org.apache.camel.MessagesetFault(boolean). You may want to enable this when using Camel components that support faults such as SOAP based such as cxf or spring-ws.

componentProperty.name: idleTaskExecutionLimit
componentProperty.description: Specifies the limit for idle executions of a receive task not having received any message within its execution. If this limit is reached the task will shut down and leave receiving to other executing tasks (in the case of dynamic scheduling; see the maxConcurrentConsumers setting). There is additional doc available from Spring.

uriParameter.name: includeSentJMSMessageID
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Only applicable when sending to JMS destination using InOnly (eg fire and forget). Enabling this option will enrich the Camel Exchange with the actual JMSMessageID that was used by the JMS client when the message was sent to the JMS destination.

uriParameter.name: asyncConsumer
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether the JmsConsumer processes the Exchange asynchronously. If enabled then the JmsConsumer may pickup the next message from the JMS queue while the previous message is being processed asynchronously (by the Asynchronous Routing Engine). This means that messages may be processed not 100 strictly in order. If disabled (as default) then the Exchange is fully processed before the JmsConsumer will pickup the next message from the JMS queue. Note if transacted has been enabled then asyncConsumer=true does not run asynchronously as transaction must be executed synchronously (Camel 3.0 may support async transactions).

uriParameter.name: mapJmsMessage
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether Camel should auto map the received JMS message to a suited payload type such as javax.jms.TextMessage to a String etc.

uriParameter.name: messageListenerContainerFactory
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Registry ID of the MessageListenerContainerFactory used to determine what org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer to use to consume messages. Setting this will automatically set consumerType to Custom.

uriParameter.name: requestTimeoutCheckerInterval
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures how often Camel should check for timed out Exchanges when doing request/reply over JMS. By default Camel checks once per second. But if you must react faster when a timeout occurs then you can lower this interval to check more frequently. The timeout is determined by the option requestTimeout.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: includeAllJMSXProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to include all JMSXxxx properties when mapping from JMS to Camel Message. Setting this to true will include properties such as JMSXAppID and JMSXUserID etc. Note: If you are using a custom headerFilterStrategy then this option does not apply.

uriParameter.name: errorHandlerLogStackTrace
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to control whether stacktraces should be logged or not by the default errorHandler.

uriParameter.name: eagerLoadingOfProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Enables eager loading of JMS properties as soon as a message is loaded which generally is inefficient as the JMS properties may not be required but sometimes can catch early any issues with the underlying JMS provider and the use of JMS properties

uriParameter.name: timeToLive
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: When sending messages specifies the time-to-live of the message (in milliseconds).

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: replyToMaxConcurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent consumers when using request/reply over JMS. See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads.

uriParameter.name: deliveryMode
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the delivery mode to be used. Possibles values are those defined by javax.jms.DeliveryMode. NON_PERSISTENT = 1 and PERSISTENT = 2.

uriParameter.name: transferException
uriParameter.label: advanced
