uriParameter.description: If enabled and you are using Request Reply messaging (InOut) and an Exchange failed on the consumer side then the caused Exception will be send back in response as a javax.jms.ObjectMessage. If the client is Camel the returned Exception is rethrown. This allows you to use Camel JMS as a bridge in your routing - for example using persistent queues to enable robust routing. Notice that if you also have transferExchange enabled this option takes precedence. The caught exception is required to be serializable. The original Exception on the consumer side can be wrapped in an outer exception such as org.apache.camel.RuntimeCamelException when returned to the producer.

uriParameter.name: exceptionListener
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the JMS Exception Listener that is to be notified of any underlying JMS exceptions.

uriParameter.name: destinationType
uriParameter.description: The kind of destination to use

uriParameter.name: asyncStartListener
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to startup the JmsConsumer message listener asynchronously when starting a route. For example if a JmsConsumer cannot get a connection to a remote JMS broker then it may block while retrying and/or failover. This will cause Camel to block while starting routes. By setting this option to true you will let routes startup while the JmsConsumer connects to the JMS broker using a dedicated thread in asynchronous mode. If this option is used then beware that if the connection could not be established then an exception is logged at WARN level and the consumer will not be able to receive messages; You can then restart the route to retry.

uriParameter.name: transactionManager
uriParameter.label: transaction,advanced
uriParameter.description: The Spring transaction manager to use.

uriParameter.name: alwaysCopyMessage
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If true Camel will always make a JMS message copy of the message when it is passed to the producer for sending. Copying the message is needed in some situations such as when a replyToDestinationSelectorName is set (incidentally Camel will set the alwaysCopyMessage option to true if a replyToDestinationSelectorName is set)

uriParameter.name: replyToConcurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the default number of concurrent consumers when doing request/reply over JMS. See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads.

uriParameter.name: replyToDestinationSelectorName
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the JMS Selector using the fixed name to be used so you can filter out your own replies from the others when using a shared queue (that is if you are not using a temporary reply queue).

uriParameter.name: maxConcurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent consumers when consuming from JMS (not for request/reply over JMS). See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads. When doing request/reply over JMS then the option replyToMaxConcurrentConsumers is used to control number of concurrent consumers on the reply message listener.

uriParameter.name: disableTimeToLive
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Use this option to force disabling time to live. For example when you do request/reply over JMS then Camel will by default use the requestTimeout value as time to live on the message being sent. The problem is that the sender and receiver systems have to have their clocks synchronized so they are in sync. This is not always so easy to archive. So you can use disableTimeToLive=true to not set a time to live value on the sent message. Then the message will not expire on the receiver system. See below in section About time to live for more details.

uriParameter.name: deliveryPersistent
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether persistent delivery is used by default.

uriParameter.name: priority
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Values greater than 1 specify the message priority when sending (where 0 is the lowest priority and 9 is the highest). The explicitQosEnabled option must also be enabled in order for this option to have any effect.

uriParameter.name: concurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the default number of concurrent consumers when consuming from JMS (not for request/reply over JMS). See also the maxMessagesPerTask option to control dynamic scaling up/down of threads. When doing request/reply over JMS then the option replyToConcurrentConsumers is used to control number of concurrent consumers on the reply message listener.

uriParameter.name: acceptMessagesWhileStopping
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether the consumer accept messages while it is stopping. You may consider enabling this option if you start and stop JMS routes at runtime while there are still messages enqued on the queue. If this option is false and you stop the JMS route then messages may be rejected and the JMS broker would have to attempt redeliveries which yet again may be rejected and eventually the message may be moved at a dead letter queue on the JMS broker. To avoid this its recommended to enable this option.

uriParameter.name: consumerType
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: The consumer type to use which can be one of: Simple Default or Custom. The consumer type determines which Spring JMS listener to use. Default will use org.springframework.jms.listener.DefaultMessageListenerContainer Simple will use org.springframework.jms.listener.SimpleMessageListenerContainer. When Custom is specified the MessageListenerContainerFactory defined by the messageListenerContainerFactory option will determine what org.springframework.jms.listener.AbstractMessageListenerContainer to use.

uriParameter.name: acknowledgementModeName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The JMS acknowledgement name which is one of: SESSION_TRANSACTED CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE

uriParameter.name: exposeListenerSession
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether the listener session should be exposed when consuming messages.

uriParameter.name: receiveTimeout
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The timeout for receiving messages (in milliseconds).

uriParameter.name: replyTo
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Provides an explicit ReplyTo destination which overrides any incoming value of Message.getJMSReplyTo().

uriParameter.name: replyToOverride
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Provides an explicit ReplyTo destination in the JMS message which overrides the setting of replyTo. It is useful if you want to forward the message to a remote Queue and receive the reply message from the ReplyTo destination.

uriParameter.name: errorHandlerLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to configure the default errorHandler logging level for logging uncaught exceptions.

uriParameter.name: errorHandler
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies a org.springframework.util.ErrorHandler to be invoked in case of any uncaught exceptions thrown while processing a Message. By default these exceptions will be logged at the WARN level if no errorHandler has been configured. You can configure logging level and whether stack traces should be logged using errorHandlerLoggingLevel and errorHandlerLogStackTrace options. This makes it much easier to configure than having to code a custom errorHandler.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: allowReplyManagerQuickStop
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether the DefaultMessageListenerContainer used in the reply managers for request-reply messaging allow the DefaultMessageListenerContainer.runningAllowed flag to quick stop in case link JmsConfigurationisAcceptMessagesWhileStopping() is enabled and org.apache.camel.CamelContext is currently being stopped. This quick stop ability is enabled by default in the regular JMS consumers but to enable for reply managers you must enable this flag.

uriParameter.name: idleConsumerLimit
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specify the limit for the number of consumers that are allowed to be idle at any given time.

uriParameter.name: replyToOnTimeoutMaxConcurrentConsumers
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent consumers for continue routing when timeout occurred when using request/reply over JMS.

uriParameter.name: explicitQosEnabled
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Set if the deliveryMode priority or timeToLive qualities of service should be used when sending messages. This option is based on Spring's JmsTemplate. The deliveryMode priority and timeToLive options are applied to the current endpoint. This contrasts with the preserveMessageQos option which operates at message granularity reading QoS properties exclusively from the Camel In message headers.

uriParameter.name: messageConverter
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom Spring org.springframework.jms.support.converter.MessageConverter so you can be in control how to map to/from a javax.jms.Message.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerTask
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The number of messages per task. -1 is unlimited. If you use a range for concurrent consumers (eg min max) then this option can be used to set a value to eg 100 to control how fast the consumers will shrink when less work is required.

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.label: transaction
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to use transacted mode

uriParameter.name: transactionName
uriParameter.label: transaction,advanced
uriParameter.description: The name of the transaction to use.

uriParameter.name: autoStartup
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether the consumer container should auto-startup.

uriParameter.name: messageTimestampEnabled
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether timestamps should be enabled by default on sending messages. This is just an hint to the JMS Broker. If the JMS provider accepts this hint these messages must have the timestamp set to zero; if the provider ignores the hint the timestamp must be set to its normal value

uriParameter.name: jmsKeyFormatStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides two implementations out of the box: default and passthrough. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). The passthrough strategy leaves the key as is. Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the notation.

uriParameter.name: headerFilterStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

uriParameter.name: lazyCreateTransactionManager
uriParameter.label: transaction,advanced
uriParameter.description: If true Camel will create a JmsTransactionManager if there is no transactionManager injected when option transacted=true.

uriParameter.name: destinationName
uriParameter.description: Name of the queue or topic to use as destination

uriParameter.name: messageCreatedStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

uriParameter.name: asyncStopListener
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to stop the JmsConsumer message listener asynchronously when stopping a route.

uriParameter.name: transferExchange
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: You can transfer the exchange over the wire instead of just the body and headers. The following fields are transferred: In body Out body Fault body In headers Out headers Fault headers exchange properties exchange exception. This requires that the objects are serializable. Camel will exclude any non-serializable objects and log it at WARN level. You must enable this option on both the producer and consumer side so Camel knows the payloads is an Exchange and not a regular payload.

uriParameter.name: selector
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the JMS selector to use

uriParameter.name: requestTimeout
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds). The default is 20 seconds. You can include the header CamelJmsRequestTimeout to override this endpoint configured timeout value and thus have per message individual timeout values. See also the requestTimeoutCheckerInterval option.

uriParameter.name: allowNullBody
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether to allow sending messages with no body. If this option is false and the message body is null then an JMSException is thrown.

uriParameter.name: replyToDeliveryPersistent
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to use persistent delivery by default for replies.

uriParameter.name: disableReplyTo
uriParameter.description: If true a producer will behave like a InOnly exchange with the exception that JMSReplyTo header is sent out and not be suppressed like in the case of InOnly. Like InOnly the producer will not wait for a reply. A consumer with this flag will behave like InOnly. This feature can be used to bridge InOut requests to another queue so that a route on the other queue will send its response directly back to the original JMSReplyTo.

uriParameter.name: clientId
uriParameter.description: Sets the JMS client ID to use. Note that this value if specified must be unique and can only be used by a single JMS connection instance. It is typically only required for durable topic subscriptions. If using Apache ActiveMQ you may prefer to use Virtual Topics instead.

uriParameter.name: recoveryInterval
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the interval between recovery attempts i.e. when a connection is being refreshed in milliseconds. The default is 5000 ms that is 5 seconds.

uriParameter.name: replyToCacheLevelName
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the cache level by name for the reply consumer when doing request/reply over JMS. This option only applies when using fixed reply queues (not temporary). Camel will by default use: CACHE_CONSUMER for exclusive or shared w/ replyToSelectorName. And CACHE_SESSION for shared without replyToSelectorName. Some JMS brokers such as IBM WebSphere may require to set the replyToCacheLevelName=CACHE_NONE to work. Note: If using temporary queues then CACHE_NONE is not allowed and you must use a higher value such as CACHE_CONSUMER or CACHE_SESSION.

uriParameter.name: messageIdEnabled
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: When sending specifies whether message IDs should be added. This is just an hint to the JMS Broker. If the JMS provider accepts this hint these messages must have the message ID set to null; if the provider ignores the hint the message ID must be set to its normal unique value

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: pubSubNoLocal
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to inhibit the delivery of messages published by its own connection.

uriParameter.name: preserveMessageQos
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Set to true if you want to send message using the QoS settings specified on the message instead of the QoS settings on the JMS endpoint. The following three headers are considered JMSPriority JMSDeliveryMode and JMSExpiration. You can provide all or only some of them. If not provided Camel will fall back to use the values from the endpoint instead. So when using this option the headers override the values from the endpoint. The explicitQosEnabled option by contrast will only use options set on the endpoint and not values from the message header.

uriParameter.name: forceSendOriginalMessage
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: When using mapJmsMessage=false Camel will create a new JMS message to send to a new JMS destination if you touch the headers (get or set) during the route. Set this option to true to force Camel to send the original JMS message that was received.

uriParameter.name: replyToType
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Allows for explicitly specifying which kind of strategy to use for replyTo queues when doing request/reply over JMS. Possible values are: Temporary Shared or Exclusive. By default Camel will use temporary queues. However if replyTo has been configured then Shared is used by default. This option allows you to use exclusive queues instead of shared ones. See Camel JMS documentation for more details and especially the notes about the implications if running in a clustered environment and the fact that Shared reply queues has lower performance than its alternatives Temporary and Exclusive.

uriParameter.name: testConnectionOnStartup
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether to test the connection on startup. This ensures that when Camel starts that all the JMS consumers have a valid connection to the JMS broker. If a connection cannot be granted then Camel throws an exception on startup. This ensures that Camel is not started with failed connections. The JMS producers is tested as well.

uriParameter.name: useMessageIDAsCorrelationID
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether JMSMessageID should always be used as JMSCorrelationID for InOut messages.

uriParameter.name: transactionTimeout
uriParameter.label: transaction,advanced
uriParameter.description: The timeout value of the transaction (in seconds) if using transacted mode.

uriParameter.name: durableSubscriptionName
uriParameter.description: The durable subscriber name for specifying durable topic subscriptions. The clientId option must be configured as well.

uriParameter.name: replyToSameDestinationAllowed
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether a JMS consumer is allowed to send a reply message to the same destination that the consumer is using to consume from. This prevents an endless loop by consuming and sending back the same message to itself.

uriParameter.name: jmsMessageType
uriParameter.description: Allows you to force the use of a specific javax.jms.Message implementation for sending JMS messages. Possible values are: Bytes Map Object Stream Text. By default Camel would determine which JMS message type to use from the In body type. This option allows you to specify it.

uriParameter.name: defaultTaskExecutorType
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies what default TaskExecutor type to use in the DefaultMessageListenerContainer for both consumer endpoints and the ReplyTo consumer of producer endpoints. Possible values: SimpleAsync (uses Spring's SimpleAsyncTaskExecutor) or ThreadPool (uses Spring's ThreadPoolTaskExecutor with optimal values - cached threadpool-like). If not set it defaults to the previous behaviour which uses a cached thread pool for consumer endpoints and SimpleAsync for reply consumers. The use of ThreadPool is recommended to reduce thread trash in elastic configurations with dynamically increasing and decreasing concurrent consumers.

uriParameter.name: cacheLevelName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the cache level by name for the underlying JMS resources. Possible values are: CACHE_AUTO CACHE_CONNECTION CACHE_CONSUMER CACHE_NONE and CACHE_SESSION. The default setting is CACHE_AUTO. See the Spring documentation and Transactions Cache Levels for more information.

uriParameter.name: transferFault
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: If enabled and you are using Request Reply messaging (InOut) and an Exchange failed with a SOAP fault (not exception) on the consumer side then the fault flag on link org.apache.camel.MessageisFault() will be send back in the response as a JMS header with the key link JmsConstantsJMS_TRANSFER_FAULT. If the client is Camel the returned fault flag will be set on the link org.apache.camel.MessagesetFault(boolean). You may want to enable this when using Camel components that support faults such as SOAP based such as cxf or spring-ws.

uriParameter.name: idleTaskExecutionLimit
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies the limit for idle executions of a receive task not having received any message within its execution. If this limit is reached the task will shut down and leave receiving to other executing tasks (in the case of dynamic scheduling; see the maxConcurrentConsumers setting). There is additional doc available from Spring.

component.title: MSV
component.description: Validates the payload of a message using the MSV Library.

componentProperty.name: schemaFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the javax.xml.validation.SchemaFactory.

componentProperty.name: resourceResolverFactory
componentProperty.label: advanced
componentProperty.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver which depends on a dynamic endpoint resource URI

uriParameter.name: headerName
uriParameter.description: To validate against a header instead of the message body.

uriParameter.name: schemaFactory
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom javax.xml.validation.SchemaFactory

uriParameter.name: failOnNullHeader
uriParameter.description: Whether to fail if no header exists when validating against a header.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: URL to a local resource on the classpath or a reference to lookup a bean in the Registry or a full URL to a remote resource or resource on the file system which contains the XSD to validate against.

uriParameter.name: schemaLanguage
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures the W3C XML Schema Namespace URI.

uriParameter.name: resourceResolverFactory
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver which depends on a dynamic endpoint resource URI. The default resource resolver factory resturns a resource resolver which can read files from the class path and file system. Do not use together with resourceResolver.

uriParameter.name: useDom
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether DOMSource/DOMResult or SaxSource/SaxResult should be used by the validator.

uriParameter.name: resourceResolver
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom LSResourceResolver. Do not use together with resourceResolverFactory

uriParameter.name: useSharedSchema
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Whether the Schema instance should be shared or not. This option is introduced to work around a JDK 1.6.x bug. Xerces should not have this issue.

uriParameter.name: failOnNullBody
uriParameter.description: Whether to fail if no body exists.

uriParameter.name: errorHandler
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.processor.validation.ValidatorErrorHandler. The default error handler captures the errors and throws an exception.

component.title: JMX
component.description: The jmx component allows to receive JMX notifications.

uriParameter.name: initThreshold
uriParameter.label: counter
uriParameter.description: URI Property: counter monitor only Initial threshold for the monitor. The value must exceed this before notifications are fired.

uriParameter.name: notifyHigh
uriParameter.label: gauge
uriParameter.description: URI Property: gauge monitor only If true the gauge will fire a notification when the high threshold is exceeded

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: handback
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: URI Property: Value to handback to the listener when a notification is received. This value will be put in the message header with the key jmx.handback

uriParameter.name: reconnectOnConnectionFailure
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: URI Property: If true the consumer will attempt to reconnect to the JMX server when any connection failure occurs. The consumer will attempt to re-establish the JMX connection every 'x' seconds until the connection is made-- where 'x' is the configured reconnectionDelay

uriParameter.name: granularityPeriod
uriParameter.description: URI Property: monitor types only The frequency to poll the bean to check the monitor.

uriParameter.name: monitorType
uriParameter.description: URI Property: monitor types only The type of monitor to create. One of string gauge counter.

uriParameter.name: password
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: URI Property: credentials for making a remote connection

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: notifyLow
uriParameter.label: gauge
uriParameter.description: URI Property: gauge monitor only If true the gauge will fire a notification when the low threshold is exceeded

uriParameter.name: stringToCompare
uriParameter.label: string
uriParameter.description: URI Property: string monitor only Value for the string monitor's string to compare.

uriParameter.name: serverURL
uriParameter.description: server url comes from the remaining endpoint

uriParameter.name: objectDomain
uriParameter.description: URI Property: The domain for the mbean you're connecting to

uriParameter.name: observedAttribute
uriParameter.description: URI Property: monitor types only The attribute to observe for the monitor bean.

uriParameter.name: modulus
uriParameter.label: counter
uriParameter.description: URI Property: counter monitor only The value at which the counter is reset to zero

uriParameter.name: differenceMode
uriParameter.label: counter,gauge
uriParameter.description: URI Property: counter gauge monitor only If true then the value reported in the notification is the difference from the threshold as opposed to the value itself.

uriParameter.name: offset
uriParameter.label: counter
uriParameter.description: URI Property: counter monitor only The amount to increment the threshold after it's been exceeded.

uriParameter.name: notifyMatch
uriParameter.label: string
uriParameter.description: URI Property: string monitor only If true the string monitor will fire a notification when the string attribute matches the string to compare.

uriParameter.name: format
uriParameter.description: URI Property: Format for the message body. Either xml or raw. If xml the notification is serialized to xml. If raw then the raw java object is set as the body.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: objectProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: URI Property: properties for the object name. These values will be used if the objectName param is not set

uriParameter.name: reconnectDelay
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: URI Property: The number of seconds to wait before attempting to retry establishment of the initial connection or attempt to reconnect a lost connection

uriParameter.name: testConnectionOnStartup
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: URI Property: If true the consumer will throw an exception if unable to establish the JMX connection upon startup. If false the consumer will attempt to establish the JMX connection every 'x' seconds until the connection is made -- where 'x' is the configured reconnectionDelay

uriParameter.name: objectName
uriParameter.description: URI Property: The name key for the mbean you're connecting to. This value is mutually exclusive with the object properties that get passed.

uriParameter.name: notificationFilter
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: URI Property: Reference to a bean that implements the NotificationFilter.

uriParameter.name: notifyDiffer
uriParameter.label: string
uriParameter.description: URI Property: string monitor only If true the string monitor will fire a notification when the string attribute differs from the string to compare.

uriParameter.name: thresholdHigh
uriParameter.label: gauge
uriParameter.description: URI Property: gauge monitor only Value for the gauge's high threshold

uriParameter.name: thresholdLow
uriParameter.label: gauge
uriParameter.description: URI Property: gauge monitor only Value for the gauge's low threshold

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: user
uriParameter.label: security
uriParameter.description: URI Property: credentials for making a remote connection

component.title: AWS DynamoDB Streams
component.description: The aws-ddbstream component is used for working with Amazon DynamoDB Streams.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: iteratorType
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Defines where in the DynaboDB stream to start getting records. Note that using TRIM_HORIZON can cause a significant delay before the stream has caught up to real-time. if ATAFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER are used then a sequenceNumberProvider MUST be supplied.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: amazonDynamoDbStreamsClient
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Amazon DynamoDB client to use for all requests for this endpoint

uriParameter.name: sequenceNumberProvider
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Provider for the sequence number when using one of the two ShardIteratorType.ATAFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER iterator types. Can be a registry reference or a literal sequence number.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: tableName
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Name of the dynamodb table

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxResultsPerRequest
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Maximum number of records that will be fetched in each poll

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

component.title: LDAP
component.description: The ldap component allows you to perform searches in LDAP servers using filters as the message payload.

uriParameter.name: returnedAttributes
uriParameter.description: Comma-separated list of attributes that should be set in each entry of the result

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: scope
uriParameter.description: Specifies how deeply to search the tree of entries starting at the base DN.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: pageSize
uriParameter.description: When specified the ldap module uses paging to retrieve all results (most LDAP Servers throw an exception when trying to retrieve more than 1000 entries in one query). To be able to use this a LdapContext (subclass of DirContext) has to be passed in as ldapServerBean (otherwise an exception is thrown)

uriParameter.name: dirContextName
uriParameter.description: Name of javax.naming.directory.DirContext bean to lookup in the registry.

uriParameter.name: base
uriParameter.description: The base DN for searches.

component.title: Jetty Websocket
component.description: The websocket component provides websocket endpoints for communicating with clients using websocket.

componentProperty.name: staticResources
componentProperty.description: Set a resource path for static resources (such as .html files etc). The resources can be loaded from classpath if you prefix with classpath: otherwise the resources is loaded from file system or from JAR files. For example to load from root classpath use classpath:. or classpath:WEB-INF/static If not configured (eg null) then no static resource is in use.

componentProperty.name: port
componentProperty.description: The port number. The default value is 9292

componentProperty.name: sslKeystore
componentProperty.description: The path to the keystore.

componentProperty.name: minThreads
componentProperty.description: To set a value for minimum number of threads in server thread pool. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9. The default values for minThreads is 1.

componentProperty.name: socketFactory
componentProperty.description: To configure a map which contains custom WebSocketFactory for sub protocols. The key in the map is the sub protocol. The default key is reserved for the default implementation.

componentProperty.name: host
componentProperty.description: The hostname. The default value is 0.0.0.0

componentProperty.name: sslContextParameters
componentProperty.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

componentProperty.name: sslPassword
componentProperty.description: The password when using SSL.

componentProperty.name: sslKeyPassword
componentProperty.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

componentProperty.name: enableJmx
componentProperty.description: If this option is true Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.

componentProperty.name: threadPool
componentProperty.description: To use a custom thread pool for the server.

componentProperty.name: maxThreads
componentProperty.description: To set a value for maximum number of threads in server thread pool. MaxThreads/minThreads or threadPool fields are required due to switch to Jetty9. The default values for maxThreads is 1 2 noCores.

uriParameter.name: minVersion
uriParameter.description: Can be used to set the minimum protocol version accepted for the websocketServlet. (Default 13 - the RFC6455 version)

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: sendToAll
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: To send to all websocket subscribers. Can be used to configure on endpoint level instead of having to use the WebsocketConstants.SEND_TO_ALL header on the message.

uriParameter.name: sslContextParameters
uriParameter.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: maxIdleTime
uriParameter.description: Set the time in ms that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be idle before closing. (default is 300000)

uriParameter.name: resourceUri
uriParameter.description: Name of the websocket channel to use

uriParameter.name: enableJmx
uriParameter.description: If this option is true Jetty JMX support will be enabled for this endpoint. See Jetty JMX support for more details.

uriParameter.name: sessionSupport
uriParameter.description: Whether to enable session support which enables HttpSession for each http request.

uriParameter.name: staticResources
uriParameter.description: Set a resource path for static resources (such as .html files etc). The resources can be loaded from classpath if you prefix with classpath: otherwise the resources is loaded from file system or from JAR files. For example to load from root classpath use classpath:. or classpath:WEB-INF/static If not configured (eg null) then no static resource is in use.

uriParameter.name: filterPath
uriParameter.description: Context path for filtering CORS

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: allowedOrigins
uriParameter.description: The CORS allowed origins. Use to allow all.

uriParameter.name: crossOriginFilterOn
uriParameter.description: Whether to enable CORS

uriParameter.name: port
uriParameter.description: The port number. The default value is 9292. Setting this option on the component will use the component configured value as default.

uriParameter.name: maxTextMessageSize
uriParameter.description: Can be used to set the size in characters that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be accept before closing.

uriParameter.name: host
uriParameter.description: The hostname. The default value is 0.0.0.0. Setting this option on the component will use the component configured value as default.

uriParameter.name: maxBinaryMessageSize
uriParameter.description: Can be used to set the size in bytes that the websocket created by the websocketServlet may be accept before closing. (Default is -1 - or unlimited)

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: bufferSize
uriParameter.description: Set the buffer size of the websocketServlet which is also the max frame byte size (default 8192)

uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: systemName
uriParameter.description: Returns the name of the AS/400 system.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: outputFieldsLengthArray
uriParameter.description: Specifies the fields (program parameters) length as in the AS/400 program definition.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: guiAvailable
uriParameter.description: Sets whether AS/400 prompting is enabled in the environment running Camel.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: searchType
uriParameter.description: Search type such as EQ for equal etc.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: format
uriParameter.description: Sets the data format for sending messages.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: searchKey
uriParameter.description: Search key for keyed data queues.

uriParameter.name: keyed
uriParameter.description: Whether to use keyed or non-keyed data queues.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: outputFieldsIdxArray
uriParameter.description: Specifies which fields (program parameters) are output parameters.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: secured
uriParameter.description: Whether connections to AS/400 are secured with SSL.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: JClouds
component.description: For interacting with cloud compute & blobstore service via jclouds.

componentProperty.name: blobStores

uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: hardwareId
uriParameter.label: producer,compute
uriParameter.description: The hardware that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

uriParameter.name: nodeState

uriParameter.name: providerId
uriParameter.description: The name of the cloud provider that provides the target service (e.g. aws-s3 or aws_ec2).

uriParameter.name: locationId
uriParameter.label: producer,compute
uriParameter.description: The location that will be used for creating a node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: nodeId
uriParameter.label: producer,compute
uriParameter.description: The id of the node that will run the script or destroyed.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.label: producer,compute
uriParameter.description: Specifies the type of operation that will be performed to the blobstore.

uriParameter.name: user
uriParameter.label: producer,compute
uriParameter.description: The user on the target node that will run the script.

uriParameter.name: group
uriParameter.label: producer,compute
uriParameter.description: The group that will be assigned to the newly created node. Values depend on the actual cloud provider.

uriParameter.description: What kind of operation to perform

uriParameter.name: clientFactory
uriParameter.description: To use the GoogleCalendarClientFactory as factory for creating the client. Will by default use BatchGoogleDriveClientFactory

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: methodName
uriParameter.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

uriParameter.name: accessToken
uriParameter.description: OAuth 2 access token. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: clientSecret
uriParameter.description: Client secret of the drive application

uriParameter.name: scopes
uriParameter.description: Specifies the level of permissions you want a drive application to have to a user account. See https://developers.google.com/drive/web/scopes for more info.

uriParameter.name: inBody
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: applicationName
uriParameter.description: Google drive application name. Example would be camel-google-drive/1.0
