componentProperty.description: To use the shared configuration

uriParameter.name: redirectUri
uriParameter.description: Application redirect URI although the component never redirects to this page to avoid having to have a functioning redirect server. So for testing one could use https://localhost

uriParameter.name: apiName
uriParameter.description: What kind of operation to perform

uriParameter.name: userPassword
uriParameter.description: LinkedIn account password

uriParameter.name: clientId
uriParameter.description: LinkedIn application client ID

uriParameter.name: httpParams
uriParameter.description: Custom HTTP params for example proxy host and port use constants from AllClientPNames

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: secureStorage
uriParameter.description: Callback interface for providing an OAuth token or to store the token generated by the component. The callback should return null on the first call and then save the created token in the saveToken() callback. If the callback returns null the first time a userPassword MUST be provided

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: methodName
uriParameter.description: What sub operation to use for the selected operation

uriParameter.name: userName
uriParameter.description: LinkedIn user account name MUST be provided

uriParameter.name: lazyAuth
uriParameter.description: Flag to enable/disable lazy OAuth default is true. when enabled OAuth token retrieval or generation is not done until the first REST call

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: clientSecret
uriParameter.description: LinkedIn application client secret

uriParameter.name: scopes
uriParameter.description: List of LinkedIn scopes as specified at https://developer.linkedin.com/documents/authenticationgranting

uriParameter.name: inBody
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of a parameter to be passed in the exchange In Body

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: SQL
component.description: The sql component can be used to perform SQL query to a database.

componentProperty.name: dataSource
componentProperty.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database.

componentProperty.name: usePlaceholder
componentProperty.description: Sets whether to use placeholder and replace all placeholder characters with sign in the SQL queries. This option is default true

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: breakBatchOnConsumeFail
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to break batch if onConsume failed.

uriParameter.name: onConsume
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed if the Exchange was processed successfully for example to mark the row as processed. The query can have parameter.

uriParameter.name: onConsumeFailed
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing each row then this query can be executed if the Exchange failed for example to mark the row as failed. The query can have parameter.

uriParameter.name: useMessageBodyForSql
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Whether to use the message body as the SQL and then headers for parameters. If this option is enabled then the SQL in the uri is not used.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: dataSourceRef
uriParameter.description: Sets the reference to a DataSource to lookup from the registry to use for communicating with the database.

uriParameter.name: outputType
uriParameter.description: Make the output of consumer or producer to SelectList as List of Map or SelectOne as single Java object in the following way: a) If the query has only single column then that JDBC Column object is returned. (such as SELECT COUNT( ) FROM PROJECT will return a Long object. b) If the query has more than one column then it will return a Map of that result. c) If the outputClass is set then it will convert the query result into an Java bean object by calling all the setters that match the column names. It will assume your class has a default constructor to create instance with. d) If the query resulted in more than one rows it throws an non-unique result exception.

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Enables or disables transaction. If enabled then if processing an exchange failed then the consumer break out processing any further exchanges to cause a rollback eager

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: useIterator
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets how resultset should be delivered to route. Indicates delivery as either a list or individual object. defaults to true.

uriParameter.name: allowNamedParameters
uriParameter.description: Whether to allow using named parameters in the queries.

uriParameter.name: usePlaceholder
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether to use placeholder and replace all placeholder characters with sign in the SQL queries. This option is default true

uriParameter.name: parametersCount
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If set greater than zero then Camel will use this count value of parameters to replace instead of querying via JDBC metadata API. This is useful if the JDBC vendor could not return correct parameters count then user may override instead.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: noop
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If set will ignore the results of the SQL query and use the existing IN message as the OUT message for the continuation of processing

uriParameter.name: templateOptions
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configures the Spring JdbcTemplate with the key/values from the Map

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets the maximum number of messages to poll

uriParameter.name: placeholder
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies a character that will be replaced to in SQL query. Notice that it is simple String.replaceAll() operation and no SQL parsing is involved (quoted strings will also change).

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: query
uriParameter.description: Sets the SQL query to perform. You can externalize the query by using file: or classpath: as prefix and specify the location of the file.

uriParameter.name: onConsumeBatchComplete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: After processing the entire batch this query can be executed to bulk update rows etc. The query cannot have parameters.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: batch
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Enables or disables batch mode

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: routeEmptyResultSet
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets whether empty resultset should be allowed to be sent to the next hop. Defaults to false. So the empty resultset will be filtered out.

uriParameter.name: alwaysPopulateStatement
uriParameter.label: producer,advanced
uriParameter.description: If enabled then the populateStatement method from org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy is always invoked also if there is no expected parameters to be prepared. When this is false then the populateStatement is only invoked if there is 1 or more expected parameters to be set; for example this avoids reading the message body/headers for SQL queries with no parameters.

uriParameter.name: separator
uriParameter.description: The separator to use when parameter values is taken from message body (if the body is a String type) to be inserted at placeholders. Notice if you use named parameters then a Map type is used instead. The default value is comma.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: processingStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlProcessingStrategy to execute queries when the consumer has processed the rows/batch.

uriParameter.name: prepareStatementStrategy
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows to plugin to use a custom org.apache.camel.component.sql.SqlPrepareStatementStrategy to control preparation of the query and prepared statement.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: outputHeader
uriParameter.description: Store the query result in a header instead of the message body. By default outputHeader == null and the query result is stored in the message body any existing content in the message body is discarded. If outputHeader is set the value is used as the name of the header to store the query result and the original message body is preserved.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: expectedUpdateCount
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Sets an expected update count to validate when using onConsume.

uriParameter.name: outputClass
uriParameter.description: Specify the full package and class name to use as conversion when outputType=SelectOne.

uriParameter.name: dataSource
uriParameter.description: Sets the DataSource to use to communicate with the database.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: Timer
component.description: The timer component is used for generating message exchanges when a timer fires.

uriParameter.name: period
uriParameter.description: If greater than 0 generate periodic events every period milliseconds. The default value is 1000.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange.

uriParameter.name: pattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Allows you to specify a custom Date pattern to use for setting the time option using URI syntax.

uriParameter.name: daemon
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether or not the thread associated with the timer endpoint runs as a daemon. The default value is true.

uriParameter.name: timer
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: To use a custom Timer

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before the first event is generated. Should not be used in conjunction with the time option. The default value is 1000.

uriParameter.name: fixedRate
uriParameter.description: Events take place at approximately regular intervals separated by the specified period.

uriParameter.name: timerName
uriParameter.description: The name of the timer

uriParameter.name: time
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: A java.util.Date the first event should be generated. If using the URI the pattern expected is: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss or yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: repeatCount
uriParameter.description: Specifies a maximum limit of number of fires. So if you set it to 1 the timer will only fire once. If you set it to 5 it will only fire five times. A value of zero or negative means fire forever.

component.title: Krati
component.description: The krati allows the use krati datastores and datasets inside Camel.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: hashFunction
uriParameter.description: The hash function to use.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: initialCapacity
uriParameter.description: The inital capcity of the store.

uriParameter.name: segmentFileSize
uriParameter.description: Data store segments size in MB.

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: keySerializer
uriParameter.description: The serializer that will be used to serialize the key.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: path
uriParameter.description: Path of the datastore is the relative path of the folder that krati will use for its datastore.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: The maximum number of messages which can be received in one poll. This can be used to avoid reading in too much data and taking up too much memory.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: value
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The Value.

uriParameter.name: key
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: The key.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: valueSerializer
uriParameter.description: The serializer that will be used to serialize the value.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: segmentFactory
uriParameter.description: Sets the segment factory of the target store.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Specifies the type of operation that will be performed to the datastore.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern

uriParameter.name: storeByValue
uriParameter.description: If cache should use store-by-value or store-by-reference semantics

uriParameter.description: The fully qualified class name of the javax.cache.spi.CachingProvider

uriParameter.name: cacheConfigurationProperties

uriParameter.description: The Properties for the javax.cache.spi.CachingProvider to create the CacheManager

uriParameter.description: The CacheEntryEventFilter. If using eventFilters option then filteredEvents one will be ignored

uriParameter.name: cacheConfiguration
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: A Configuration for the Cache

uriParameter.name: cacheName
uriParameter.description: the cache name

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: oldValueRequired
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: if the old value is required for events

uriParameter.name: cacheLoaderFactory
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: The CacheLoader factory

uriParameter.name: action
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: To configure using a cache operation by default. If an operation in the message header then the operation from the header takes precedence.

uriParameter.name: createCacheIfNotExists
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Configure if a cache need to be created if it does exist or can't be pre-configured.

uriParameter.name: readThrough
uriParameter.description: If read-through caching should be used

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

component.title: JPA
component.description: The jpa component enables you to store and retrieve Java objects from databases using JPA.

componentProperty.name: entityManagerFactory
componentProperty.description: To use the EntityManagerFactory. This is strongly recommended to configure.

componentProperty.name: joinTransaction
componentProperty.description: The camel-jpa component will join transaction by default. You can use this option to turn this off for example if you use LOCAL_RESOURCE and join transaction doesn't work with your JPA provider. This option can also be set globally on the JpaComponent instead of having to set it on all endpoints.

componentProperty.name: transactionManager
componentProperty.description: To use the PlatformTransactionManager for managing transactions.

componentProperty.name: sharedEntityManager
componentProperty.description: Whether to use Spring's SharedEntityManager for the consumer/producer. Note in most cases joinTransaction should be set to false as this is not an EXTENDED EntityManager.

uriParameter.name: maximumResults
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Set the maximum number of results to retrieve on the Query.

uriParameter.name: preDeleteHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom Pre-DeleteHandler to delete the row after the consumer has read the entity.

uriParameter.name: backoffMultiplier
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: deleteHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom DeleteHandler to delete the row after the consumer is done processing the exchange

uriParameter.name: transacted
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Whether to run the consumer in transacted mode by which all messages will either commit or rollback when the entire batch has been processed. The default behavior (false) is to commit all the previously successfully processed messages and only rollback the last failed message.

uriParameter.name: initialDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts.

uriParameter.name: namedQuery
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a named query when consuming data.

uriParameter.name: sharedEntityManager
uriParameter.description: Whether to use Spring's SharedEntityManager for the consumer/producer. Note in most cases joinTransaction should be set to false as this is not an EXTENDED EntityManager.

uriParameter.name: lockModeType
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To configure the lock mode on the consumer.

uriParameter.name: remove
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Indicates to use entityManager.remove(entity).

uriParameter.name: entityManagerProperties
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Additional properties for the entity manager to use.

uriParameter.name: scheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: useFixedDelay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

uriParameter.name: runLoggingLevel
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

uriParameter.name: backoffErrorThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: greedy
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

uriParameter.name: maxMessagesPerPoll
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: An integer value to define the maximum number of messages to gather per poll. By default no maximum is set. Can be used to avoid polling many thousands of messages when starting up the server. Set a value of 0 or negative to disable.

uriParameter.name: skipLockedEntity
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To configure whether to use NOWAIT on lock and silently skip the entity.

uriParameter.name: scheduledExecutorService
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

uriParameter.name: persistenceUnit
uriParameter.description: The JPA persistence unit used by default.

uriParameter.name: timeUnit
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

uriParameter.name: usePersist
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Indicates to use entityManager.persist(entity) instead of entityManager.merge(entity). Note: entityManager.persist(entity) doesn't work for detached entities (where the EntityManager has to execute an UPDATE instead of an INSERT query)!

uriParameter.name: entityType
uriParameter.description: The JPA annotated class to use as entity.

uriParameter.name: query
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom query when consuming data.

uriParameter.name: sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

uriParameter.name: schedulerProperties
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: usePassedInEntityManager
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: If set to true then Camel will use the EntityManager from the header JpaConstants.ENTITYMANAGER instead of the configured entity manager on the component/endpoint. This allows end users to control which entity manager will be in use.

uriParameter.name: nativeQuery
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: To use a custom native query when consuming data. You may want to use the option consumer.resultClass also when using native queries.

uriParameter.name: consumeLockEntity
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Specifies whether or not to set an exclusive lock on each entity bean while processing the results from polling.

uriParameter.name: backoffIdleThreshold
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

uriParameter.name: delay
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Milliseconds before the next poll.

uriParameter.name: pollStrategy
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

uriParameter.name: joinTransaction
uriParameter.description: The camel-jpa component will join transaction by default. You can use this option to turn this off for example if you use LOCAL_RESOURCE and join transaction doesn't work with your JPA provider. This option can also be set globally on the JpaComponent instead of having to set it on all endpoints.

uriParameter.name: resultClass
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Defines the type of the returned payload (we will call entityManager.createNativeQuery(nativeQuery resultClass) instead of entityManager.createNativeQuery(nativeQuery)). Without this option we will return an object array. Only has an affect when using in conjunction with native query when consuming data.

uriParameter.name: startScheduler
uriParameter.label: consumer,scheduler
uriParameter.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

uriParameter.name: consumeDelete
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: If true the entity is deleted after it is consumed; if false the entity is not deleted.

uriParameter.name: parameters
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: This key/value mapping is used for building the query parameters. It's is expected to be of the generic type java.util.Map where the keys are the named parameters of a given JPA query and the values are their corresponding effective values you want to select for.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: flushOnSend
uriParameter.label: producer
uriParameter.description: Flushes the EntityManager after the entity bean has been persisted.

component.title: MongoDB
component.description: Component for working with documents stored in MongoDB database.

uriParameter.name: connectionBean
uriParameter.description: Name of com.mongodb.Mongo to use.

uriParameter.name: writeResultAsHeader
uriParameter.description: In write operations it determines whether instead of returning WriteResult as the body of the OUT message we transfer the IN message to the OUT and attach the WriteResult as a header.

uriParameter.name: synchronous
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

uriParameter.name: tailTrackDb
uriParameter.description: Indicates what database the tail tracking mechanism will persist to. If not specified the current database will be picked by default. Dynamicity will not be taken into account even if enabled i.e. the tail tracking database will not vary past endpoint initialisation.

uriParameter.name: collectionIndex
uriParameter.description: Sets the collection index (JSON FORMAT : field1 : order1 field2 : order2)

uriParameter.name: exchangePattern
uriParameter.label: advanced
uriParameter.description: Sets the default exchange pattern when creating an exchange

uriParameter.name: outputType
uriParameter.description: Convert the output of the producer to the selected type : DBObjectList DBObject or DBCursor. DBObjectList or DBObject applies to findAll. DBCursor applies to all other operations.

uriParameter.name: persistentTailTracking
uriParameter.description: Enable persistent tail tracking which is a mechanism to keep track of the last consumed message across system restarts. The next time the system is up the endpoint will recover the cursor from the point where it last stopped slurping records.

uriParameter.name: writeConcern
uriParameter.description: Set the WriteConcern for write operations on MongoDB using the standard ones. Resolved from the fields of the WriteConcern class by calling the link WriteConcernvalueOf(String) method.

uriParameter.name: collection
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB collection to bind to this endpoint

uriParameter.name: persistentId
uriParameter.description: One tail tracking collection can host many trackers for several tailable consumers. To keep them separate each tracker should have its own unique persistentId.

uriParameter.name: tailTrackCollection
uriParameter.description: Collection where tail tracking information will be persisted. If not specified link MongoDbTailTrackingConfigDEFAULT_COLLECTION will be used by default.

uriParameter.name: database
uriParameter.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB database to target

uriParameter.name: dynamicity
uriParameter.description: Sets whether this endpoint will attempt to dynamically resolve the target database and collection from the incoming Exchange properties. Can be used to override at runtime the database and collection specified on the otherwise static endpoint URI. It is disabled by default to boost performance. Enabling it will take a minimal performance hit.

uriParameter.name: tailTrackField
uriParameter.description: Field where the last tracked value will be placed. If not specified link MongoDbTailTrackingConfigDEFAULT_FIELD will be used by default.

uriParameter.name: tailTrackIncreasingField
uriParameter.description: Correlation field in the incoming record which is of increasing nature and will be used to position the tailing cursor every time it is generated. The cursor will be (re)created with a query of type: tailTrackIncreasingField lastValue (possibly recovered from persistent tail tracking). Can be of type Integer Date String etc. NOTE: No support for dot notation at the current time so the field should be at the top level of the document.

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: cursorRegenerationDelay
uriParameter.description: MongoDB tailable cursors will block until new data arrives. If no new data is inserted after some time the cursor will be automatically freed and closed by the MongoDB server. The client is expected to regenerate the cursor if needed. This value specifies the time to wait before attempting to fetch a new cursor and if the attempt fails how long before the next attempt is made. Default value is 1000ms.

uriParameter.name: readPreference
uriParameter.description: Sets a MongoDB ReadPreference on the Mongo connection. Read preferences set directly on the connection will be overridden by this setting. The link com.mongodb.ReadPreferencevalueOf(String) utility method is used to resolve the passed readPreference value. Some examples for the possible values are nearest primary or secondary etc.

uriParameter.name: operation
uriParameter.description: Sets the operation this endpoint will execute against MongoDB. For possible values see MongoDbOperation.

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: createCollection
uriParameter.description: Create collection during initialisation if it doesn't exist. Default is true.

component.title: REST
component.description: The rest component is used for hosting REST services which has been defined using the rest-dsl in Camel.

uriParameter.name: method

uriParameter.name: uriTemplate

uriParameter.description: Human description to document this REST service

uriParameter.description: To declare the outgoing POJO binding type as a FQN class name

uriParameter.name: path
uriParameter.description: The base path

uriParameter.name: bridgeErrorHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer
uriParameter.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: routeId
uriParameter.description: Name of the route this REST services creates

uriParameter.name: produces
uriParameter.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml' or 'application/json' this REST service returns.

uriParameter.name: componentName
uriParameter.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the REST transport such as restlet spark-rest. If no component has been explicit configured then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestConsumerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found then that is being used.

uriParameter.name: inType
uriParameter.description: To declare the incoming POJO binding type as a FQN class name

uriParameter.name: exceptionHandler
uriParameter.label: consumer,advanced
uriParameter.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

uriParameter.name: consumes
uriParameter.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml' or 'application/json' this REST service accepts. By default we accept all kinds of types.
